text: They offer punch cards and it's miles ahead of starbucks.  Great local cofee shop

I absolutely loved everything about this place!!! The customer service. The atmosphere. The food and drinks.... It makes me feel comfortable and safe. The feeling of a real down to earth coffee shop experience. Thank you!!!
Fantastic coffee, great vibe. Just an all around great place to sit and chill.
very friendly staff, yummy drink options, good coffee, loads of cool art work and lots of space to hang out.

Good people, good service, and really good sweet tea! I have only been here once, but because of the friendly service & the delicious sweet tea, I will be making another trip to see them as soon as I can to try some of their other options. No grouchy workers here, just some nice guys selling some good drinks :-)

Went to GJ's today b/c I found out that they use a local roaster for their beans.  The drive through was friendly, even offered 4 choices for milk and the drink was excellent...better than any I have ever had at Starbucks and cheaper.  I will go back again..it is close to my house and if this trip was any indication, I will be there frequently.

If you want to go someplace where everybody knows your name....
This is it.  Thoughtful service, amazing coffee & yummy food.  Great atmosphere, amazing view, this place has it all with an abundance of power strips to boot.  The Jerk Chicken wrap is great, the Grouchy John cookie is amazing if you can catch one and the iced dirty chai is the best I've had in town.  It's a coffee shop where you actually want to stay and hang - game shelf rocks.

This is our now favorite coffee and drink shop. What a great atmosphere, friendly staff, and lots of tasty options for drinks. We have had regular coffee drinks and several of the specialty drinks, all excellent. Try the Mayan Apocalypse, blended or iced!
Great coffee, great staff and best of all you are never ever board inside.  I enjoy the ambiance as you can read, play games, be loud or be private. Everything goes and its all good!
Love this place, it's just so comfortable. I have had such a hard time finding a good coffee shop in Vegas, but this place does it well.

This coffee shop is definitely up there on my list of favorites.

I used to frequent this place to study and I'd stay there hours at a time. For some reason, this is the coffee shop where I manage to get the most work done. There's a good amount of outlets and the noise level has not been a problem. 

My favorites from here are the butter me up latte made with cookie butter, the pbm, the nutella latte, and the mayan apocalypse! I recommend exploring their menu because their other drinks are just as delicious. And I've overheard their willingness to make you a new drink if you're not satisfied with what you received. 

Staff is friendly and they even walk around to check up on you to make sure you're doing okay. In all, the atmosphere, the drinks, and the service are excellent. Grouchy John's a must-try for those who haven't yet.

Check in on yelp and get double stamps! After 10 stamps, get any drink, any size for free.

WARNING! This coffee is extremely deliciously addicting. I'm a boring coffee order guy, black coffee with espresso, but this is by and far some of the best coffee I have ever had. I take all my friends that come into town here and every time they come back they insist we make a trip back here. 

Staff is always nice and it's a great atmosphere that always has a lot of friendly faces around.

I just came here for the first time this morning.  When I walked in, the smell of the coffee was awesome.  I ordered a breakfast sandwich, and it was very warm and delicious.  Also, the price was very affordable, compared to big chains like Starbucks.  I would definitely recommend this place to my friends.
Some of the best coffee in Vegas for sure.  I wish they had larger sizes.

There are not too many places that I can say I am greeted authentically every time I walk in the door - this is one of those places.  I come once a week minimum, and I drive a little out of the way to get here.  Often, I sit with my son and quietly enjoy a game of Sorry, one of the many board games they provide.  On other days I relax at one of the many places to sit and read one of the gently used books that fill the cafe's shelves.  I come for the lack of pretense and I come for the coffee.  There is disparate art on the walls and your concern, comfort, and happiness is top priority right when you walk in.
Got a Stout Nitro Brew and a Latte, both delicious. The lemon danish and chocolate donut were ok. Friendly and helpful staff.

Grouchy John's has a very comfortable and friendly atmosphere. I used to go there to do schoolwork and all the employees were very helpful and friendly. The coffee is delicious as well, especially the "Grouchy John!"

I love this place. Third time visiting and the service is always consistent. Good quality coffee and very friendly staff. Nice atmosphere and plenty of outlets to get work done. I enjoy bringing my laptop here and catching up on work. I also enjoyed the unique art from local artists that decorate the walls; gives a unique vibe to the place. The only thing about this place is s that the danishes are kind of hard (I've found the bagels to be better). Still, I'm a fan and will be coming back here.

Love an alternative to Starbucks!  This is my 2nd visit. Love the couches available. The 5 bookshelves and art for sale. Like an old fashioned comfortable coffee shop to hang out. The 3 drinks we ordered were great!  The specialty drink choices were fun to imagine and try someday. Sorry I can only drink one coffee today. Love the almond milk option too. We will definitely come back and recommend friends.

Grouchy John's was a excellent experience. I went there over 10 times in my 3 week vacation. Great coffee Plus the owner often works behind the counter they ask if you like your coffee and if there is anything they can do for you. Real mellow atmosphere, power plugs all over for your computer. Friendly and make you feel comfortable. Thank for being genuine
A real gem, hidden away from the suffocating Strip. Perfect west-coast vibe, replete with top quality espresso, nerd-art, and a comfy, welcoming vibe. Grouchy John's has my full recommendation.

I love Grouchy Johns! It reminds me of a time before there was a Starbucks every 2 blocks, when each coffee joint was different, individual with its own personality. And this place has lots of personality! Cool artwork, friendly staff, old board games, great coffee drinks and a few BOOKS (remember those?)!

I hope this place is around for a long time!!!

This place is fantastic. The staff is very friendly and the service is excellent. One thing I love about this place is that there are plenty of outlets. It is a great place to study or just stop by for a quick coffee break while out running errands. The drinks are delicious and the menu has variety. They even make smoothies (I highly recommend the Yoda). When it comes to coffee shops, Grouchy John's is a rare find in Vegas.

I've been coming through the drive through after the lobby closes a lot lately and every time I order, even though it's late, Randi is super energetic & sweet! They have the best service any time of day. Definitely recommend. :)
This place is great, and the service is friendly.  Try the Jedi coffee drink, it's one of my favorites.

This coffee shop encourages you to hang out by watching a sports event on the tv, talk about the local artists on display, play one of their two dozen board games, chill with friends, or soak up their decent wifi. Coffee choices are great, place is clean, and staff is super friendly.

One anecdotal story that made this my "go to" coffee spot, I made my order and promptly figured out I had lost my wallet prior to arriving. Asked the staff to hold off making the drink until I checked my car first and they said the drink would be ready when I got back. Confused, I pointed out if the wallet was not in my car I could not pay them. The response, "Don't worry about it. Hit is up on your next visit." Won't get that level of customer service at Starbucks.

Upon walking into Grouchy Jon's for a coffee, the atmosphere is very inviting. Lots of room to relax and enjoy a HOT cup of java and chill. The staff is very friendly and always wears a smile. A coffee that stays hot for over an hour....that is a great cup of joe. When in the area make sure to stop by for a coffee. What can I say they brew a different taste fresh every day. Give it a try. :)

Thank goodness this place opened.  I have had a number of their coffees and they rock.   The best thing about it is the water dish for my dogs.   I love going to the park and then heading over with the dogs for some coffee to see my friends.  Oh and the service is wonderful.   They always ask me how my coffee is.   Its nice.  My new hang out.

The BEST quality drinks PERIOD. I do not make a trip to Vegas without a visit to my new favorite coffee shop! It made me realize how bitter and horrible Starf****s really is!

Also, the shop is a really comfortable place to camp out for awhile. The FASTEST free Internet anywhere, good tunes, and cool local art displayed on walls. Board games, books, free Starburst for kids, dog water bowls outside.... This place does not miss a beat!

I'm so happy I found this little oasis of quality and culture in this often soulless desert town.

This is a great little coffee spot in our area with great prices and an interesting menu that you can make your own kind of coffees how you like! Sometimes they are so busy they forget some of your order, but overall it's a great place to get coffee quicker than Starbucks! The Jedi is the best!
Cheese pastry was delicious... Friendly staff.  Coffee was really good. Nice place to relax and enjoy a good cup of coffee.
Best coffee in Vegas by far. Grab a pbm. It's heaven. They have a full menu with lots of variations and even offer bullet proof coffee.

What does Grouchy John's Coffee Shop and this review have in common? There's a first for everything. I couldn't be anymore pleased with the satisfaction this coffee shop delivers.  The atmosphere is aspiring, wealthy and relaxing.  Customer service is a first.  Many places who sell coffee like Starbucks bring a meaningless and boredom with many of there interior designs.  This coffee shop is unique with a themed Star Wars, board games,  shelf of books and clean bathroom.  I would recommend this place to anyone willing to try something new.

I absolutely love this coffee shop. Everyone is very friendly, the coffee is delicious and the decor is great. It reminds me of the coffee shops you see in movies / TV. because it is just that cozy inside. I enjoy the iced A.R.M and the iced O.G.. The Grouchy John is really good as well. Today was their 1 year anniversary and they did a blood drive, toy drive and were giving out buy one get one free drinks and free drinks for donations. Awesome place! My one is complaint is that they don't open until 7 on the weekends, when that's pretty much the only time my butt is out of the house that early.

The service is always great.  I'm always greeted with smiles.  The coffee and smoothies are addictive.  My personal favorite is the grouchy johns latte.  I also.like how they have special drinks.  It forces you to try something new since their so.tempting like the almond rocha mocha which is to.die for!  I try to visit they guys as.much as possible and you should too!

Really cool coffee shop.  Don't get me wrong, I enjoy Starbucks; but going to a non-chain coffee shop just feels better, and gives me a more genuine experience. It also reminds me a lot of the Bay Area, i.e., a world where both homogenized coffee AND more intimidate, community-feel shops can co-exist. 

I had the "Grouchy John," which is a white chocolate and amaretto latte. As a person that LOVES "sweet" coffee, this was heaven!  They offer five other coffee specialties.  The shop also offers pastries and the muffaletta sandwich from Bread & Butter in Henderson (which is also delicious).  Oooooh, so many good things! 

The place has about nine two-person tables, and a couple of couches.  There's a couple of bookshelves, with a wide variety of books (and "good" titles), and board games (scrabble, yahtzee, etc.).

Two other things I love: it's a comfortable temperature inside, i.e., the A/C is not kicked into overdrive, and the music isn't too loud. This means I can actually read or have a conversation in relative peace. Oh yeah, the staff is really friendly (ok, so that's three things). 

Last tip: if you tell them you do reviews on an online social media site, you get an extra stamp on the frequent flier punchcard. Yee haw!!!

Omg!!! My best friend took me to this coffee shop, TO DIE FOR! As funny as it sounds, I didn't feel like coffee, so I got a smoothie. The "Yoda" was hands down delicious and I crave it on the daily now. Wish it wasn't so far from my home!!!

The staff and the service at this coffee shop were outstanding. If I lived in Las Vegas, I would go to this coffee shop frequently. I thought my drink was too sweet and they fixed it for free and even threw an extra shot of espresso in there on the house. I told them I would pay for it since I should have requested the drink less sweet, but they would not have it and provided a delicious replacement complimentary. The cusotmer service and the atmosphere are great.

Nice staff, really good coffee. A little sweet for my taste, but I'm sure I could ask for fewer pumps of flavor, they're super accommodating, and always make sure you like your drink. I'll be back for sure.
This is the most awesome coffee shop ever! Great atmosphere and super cool people. There is room for meetings and wifi. Also there is art for sale as well. Go check it out now! Hehe

A fantastic little local gem that has great coffee and very fun decor! Inside the shop, there's star wars, walking dead, and a lot of awesome art to look at. Also they provide board games to play while you enjoy your coffee! The service is friendly and helpful as well. 
Check this place out! 5/5 stars!!
Great little coffee shop! Offers almond milk as a substitute and the smoothies and tea are very tasty!
The coffee here is top notch and the people that work here are exceptional!! Friendly and personal staff and JJ the owner is a pretty cool dude! Try the Grouchy John Frappe-tasty!

Why didn't I come here sooner?! So many Flavors to choose from at a reasonable price. Staff is very nice and I got 2 starburst candies when I pulled up to the window!! So cute! I enjoyed my coffee and it was nice having people give you great service with a smile! Unlike other coffee shops. Just sayin'.

I was unaware of Grouchy John's Coffee Shop until my daughter recommend it a year ago. I'm glad she did, as the coffee's great and the atmosphere is very cool. Give it a try for different and fresh coffee experience.

I love this place!  Grouchy John's has a great variety of coffee drinks. I go for the frappes. I like the O.G. which is salted caramel and vanilla...delicious. The staff is very friendly. They have board games and books for you to peruse. I am a regular now!

A welcoming, lounge like atmosphere with incredibly tasty and memorable coffee's! When was the last time you had a totally memorable cup? This place will be our first and last stop every time we come, thanks Grouchy John's ! Cinnamon dolce, The Chewbaca and the bulletproof brew - well done!!!!!

Really enjoyed my short visit there on the way to hoover dam.
Got a fresh breakfast bagel for $4 with veggies, egg and cheese which hit the spot and Caramel Mocha blended coffee (all varieties were half off  that day) - which was really tasty and not too sweet.

I spend way too much time in coffee shops..  Being a student I often find myself going to one when I need to get out of the house (too many distractions) and get some hard core reading in.   I've been to the big chains and you can find me pouring over books in out of the way cafe's.  I've been to hipster joints, shi shi posh pinky finger up when you sip espresso places.  I've seen the highs and lows.  So what puts Grouchy John's heads and tails above the rest simple they care.  From the drinks to the way they treat customers they just care.  I've been here a few times now, and have just decided to up my frequency on today's visit.  Things I have noticed on my stay here firstly they seem to know their customers, now I'm not just talking drink preference any average Joe can do that, but they truly seem to know them and like them.  If I weren't the jaded individual I am I would assume that they're inviting some of their customers over for Sunday brunch, as they seem like old time buddies.  Now am on that level of chummieness with the staff, no, but that did not stop them from walking to my table and asking me if I wanted a glass of water. I know there is somebody out there saying, "well whats the big deal with that".  Well it is a big deal.... when was the last time somebody did that for you?  In fact I have seen them treat everybody with that same level of thoughtfulness and respect.  Now if this doesn't convince you to give them a try then let me just say this board games and star wars.... now if you don't like any of those things I think you're better off getting a coffee from the gas station because you sir are dead inside.
Very cool vibe- enough room to study and enjoy the yummy coffee drinks! Lots of choices on menu! Great service!
Best local coffee shop. They are creative and fun and support other local businesses. You fell welcome every time you step through the doors.

Grouchy John's and their staff are great! The staff was very friendly and they served your coffee to your table which was nice. The atmosphere is really chill and laid back. It's perfect for studying or grabbing coffee with a friend. 
I got a Sith Latte (dark chocolate and coconut) as well as a drip coffee. The Sith was awesome. It didn't taste super syrupy like some lattes tend to be. The drip was pretty good... once it cooled down. When I got it, it was burning hot and tasted a little bit like the beans were burnt in the process. Once it cooled down, the burnt tasted went away. 
Overall, I would highly recommend if you are in the area or want to take a slight detour on your way out of Vegas.

Starbucks move aside!  Grouchy John's here to stay...

I finally experience the awesome customer service provided by the personnel here at Grouchy John's.  They are very helpful and kind.

The coffee taste delicious, and the almond roca is very satisfying.  I also got the cheese danish and it was out of this world.  The best cheese danish I have ever eaten.   I long for the next weekend where I can just come back to GJ, order a black coffee, the cheese danish, and just lounge in the coffee shop...ah, peaceful indeed...
Great coffee, nice cafe space, friendly people. Why one would chose Starbucks over them is beyond me.

I've only been here once but it made a lasting impression. My friend and I both had a latte and pastry. I tried a unique flavored latte that was very good. The pastries were delicious.  The staff is very helpful and friendly.
Okay this coffee shop is the best in the world their coffee is so amazing I can get chocolate with coconut in it which is so good.

In the drive-thru this morning, I realized I didn't have my wallet. They told me to order a drink anyway and they'd "open a tab" for me. What was an embarrassing situation turned into a really pleasant one. I love Grouchy John's and I love being one of their regulars!
Such a great cafe! Love all the cool art and decorations. Plenty of space for meet-ups or studying. Great customer service, drinks, and food! My favorite is their green smoothie!
I love to support local businesses and this does not disappoint. I think the names of the coffee are so cute and they are yummy. Very unique combinations.

Love this place.!!! Found this place by accident but so glad we did. 
Super friendly staff, very attentive & quick.
 GREAT coffee & LOVE the atmosphere.
Came with my son (13) and he liked this place. Said it was super cool.
Definitely will be back.

Awesome place! I was in town for a wedding and needed a place to study. After going to a terrible Starbucks I walked here and found it totally worth it. Great environment with books, games, plenty of outlets, and nice areas to spread out and study. Not to mention the drinks are tasty and have unique combinations too! Food is good. Best thing is their staff is very friendly and accommodating! I strongly recommend this place! If I lived in Vegas I would definitely be a regular!
Great coffee, great atmosphere, better employees! Be sure to get an iced drink during the summer, it can get a bit hot!
Got the suicide smoothie today, it was delicious.  The guy there was very friendly and gave me a starburst candy snack while I waited, yay!

The dirty chai is good, customer service is good. They offer a punch card which I love. I came enough times to fill my punch card. My husband doesn't like that they don't offer a large in his favorite latte. Only once was I not impressed, I was served my a blonde lady, acted like the owner or something. Not very friendly but the staff usually is. I'll visit this place again if I'm around but I won't go out if my way for it.
I switch from about 4 different drinks and love them all!! This place does it all right. Randi helped me today and was super helpful with trying something new. Thank you so much Grouchy John's!!
Awesome coffee joint! Great drinks, great pastries, and great service! I really dig the funky decor too, kinda reminds of a shop you would see in Portland, OR.

This has become my favorite cafe in town. It's a great place to work and enjoy some coffee. I also love their cheese bagels and oatmeal. Good decor for SciFi-ers and a nice little library to peruse. The staff is also amazing- such great customer service. You can tell it's part of their value system to treat customers well. The few times my order hasn't been just right, they caught it on their own and compensated with free drinks for the future, in addition to correcting the order. A great cafe to support.

Easily my favorite coffee place in the valley. 
Everyone working there is extremely friendly and makes you feel welcome, and all the coffee / food offerings are far better than what you'd get at a chain. Stop by and support local.

The only thing that surprised me is that Grouchy John himself is not all that grouchy; rather, he's a splendid chap all around. But I suppose you can't name a coffee shop "Really Nice Guy John" and get results.

I thought, there's no way this place can be getting 5 stars from everybody.  And then I went here.  It is amazing.  Amazing coffee.  Amazing staff.  Table games.  Football on the TV (cuz I wanted to see my game)... Awesome place!  Totally deserves the perfect rating!  They even came out to my table to check on me and my wife, getting us waters.  Love it!

I will never return to this coffee shop.   I ordered a breakfast sandwich and was asked to pull around front to get it.-no big deal it's nice not to hold up the line.  After an extremely long wait the worker ran my sandwich out and gave me the wrong one. My order was completely wrong.  Using the drive through is not because I'm lazy.  I have two kids and am pregnant I can't just come inside.  I have dietary restrictions-so I can't just eat the wrong order. 

I called the store FIVE TIMES and no one ever answered to help fix my order.  

I just wasted my time and money.
The best coffee shop in Nevada! Seriously.. Their coffee is tasty, their Monday half off specials are awesome, & they have super friendly workers.

My love for this place totally depends on the staff. Most of them are super nice, friendly, and efficient, and it's always a pleasure. But a few of the staff just stands around hitting on customers and being loud and obnoxious. Like super loud, all the time. Loud enough that it's hard to talk over them. It's ridiculous.

And the TVs are super distracting and always turned to something inane. No one goes to a coffee shot to watch Dr. Phil.

But, I can't completely hate any place with walls full of books and local art. Nerdy art at that! Drinks are good and prices are reasonable. But if there's a chance I'm going to have to shout to be heard over the staff, I'll go somewhere else.

I am a sucker for coffee shops and I am not afraid to admit it, especially if it is local coffee shops! I am extremely picky when it comes to coffee. I must say, this place meets my expectations! Their coffee is extremely good. The store offers beautiful art pieces made by locals, which some are up for sale. To be quite honest, I am not a fan of Star Wars but their Star Wars theme is just adorable!

You honestly can NOT go wrong with Grouchy John's. They put that other place to shame. I have yet to come across a drink that that I don't love but I must say the Butter Beer latte hot, iced or blended is my all time favorite. The staff is 5 star and the owner is amazing for these reasons I drive all the way across town when I want a special treat! It's unfortunate that Yelp only lets you give 5 stars because they deserve so many more!
Love grouchy John's always great coffee and great service. I love that they have options like almond milk. The ambiance is great and the service is always friendly!

Nice staff but very busy behind the counter and no one seems to know what they are doing. People, if someone orders an espresso to drink there give them a real espresso cup not a paper cup. It makes such a difference in the coffee when it's in a paper vs. ceramic cup. Sorry, this time the ceramic cup did not help the poor quality of the very acidic coffee.

I prefer this place for my coffee fix over any other location in Las Vegas (yes, even Starbucks). The service is so friendly, the prices are fair, and you can taste the quality. Also, their stamp-card is a great reward system and it keeps me coming back. When I check-in on twitter during my order, the cashier gives me two stamps so that free drink comes around pretty quickly. I'm sure the employees recognize me in the drive through by now.

I always get excited when I find a locally owned business, I feel like that doesn't happen as often as I would like in Las Vegas! I walked in and the atmosphere was fun and inviting, I was greeted in a timely manner, I ordered the bulletproof which is coffee with grass fed butter and MCT oil, so delicious. Not a bad price for what you're getting ($6.50 $6.75 can't remember.) I hate Starbucks and all their coffee flavored sugar drinks, so I was super stoked to find this little coffee shop. Although I don't live here anymore (born and raised in LV) i visit often so I'm going to make a point to visit this coffee shop at least once every time I visit.

Grouchy John's Coffee Shop is the best coffee shop in Vegas. Not only is the coffee delicious, but the service is some of the best I've ever experienced. 

From the stamp cards, to the Starburst, to the smiles - every single time I go to Grouchy John's I leave happy. I hope they open up more locations everyone in Vegas has a chance to try these guys!
Love it, always a place to sit down and work. Plenty of outlets. Games in the back room. Coffee is good as well.
The people here are so friendly! They should name it Friendly John! Anyways, great coffee and smoothie! They always make my day in the morning!
Love my local coffee shop!!! Great coffee, food and service. I will drive out of my way to go here versus anywhere else

Grouchy John's hits all the marks a quality, independent coffee shop should: friendly, inviting atmosphere, consistently good coffee and a sense of community. I enjoy going to Grouchy's as it feels like I'm feeding into the positivity their shop and truck exudes. Great coffee. Try the salted OG with soy, iced!

Where can you find a coffee shop that serves decent coffee and not full of annoying teenagers? This place, Grouchy John's coffee shop  :) Don't let the name deter you people, this place is the real deal. Whether you're looking for a nice pastry (they get theirs from Bread-n-Butter, you can't argue with that), that cup of coffee or just somewhere to hang out on a hot or cold day, this place is a gem. Not only can you get all those things, this place also offers board games (free) and random books (free) that you can use while you're here. So, leave all your stuff at home and come use theirs.

I love a great coffee shop with an inviting atmosphere, especially when the service is there to match. Every time we've come here, the girls are always nice and friendly. There's usually an asian (I think) guy there that is always helpful. I ordered a bagel and he even bought it to my table for me. Now that's service. 

However, be careful of the two men crew. We were there on a friday afternoon and the service was not all that. The guy that took my order didn't seem to care. I tipped him and he just looked at me like it wasn't enough. Not to mention he didn't even say thank you. When they called our order, we went to the counter to pick it up and again the other just looked at us, annoyed. This is the first time that we've had bad service here. I guess they're the ones that named the coffee shop :)

Ciao and until next time, happy drinking everyone :)

We love our coffee and really enjoy spending time hanging out at cool coffee shops.  We travel a lot and really missed the atmosphere of the coffee shops in Portland and Seattle.  Grouchy Johns makes good lattes and the staff are always friendly.  The vibe in the shop is really chill.  They offer smoothies and loads of different donuts.  If you are a fan of star wars you need to come check out the decor.  They also have a drive thru which is nice when you are running late to work (like my GF always is) and there is a patio so we can bring our dog.

Love the coffee. The drive thru line can get a little long in the morning but it usually goes pretty quick. Seems to be a local hotspot for the police to meet for breakfast. We once had a small mistake on our order the they staff was so quick to make it right and handled it wonderfully.Many original flavors and they can add and subtract pretty much anything your heart desires. My daily coffee shop.

My favorite coffee shop in all Las Vegas. Love the Star Wars theme throughout the whole shop! Drinks are incredible and always made just how I like it, which is great cause I'm super picky! They have almond milk and truvia! Wide selection of books and board games... Great place to hang out! I'm patiently just praying and waiting for one to open in the west side!

This review is a long time coming. Grouchy's is more than just an awesome coffee shop. It's also a community cornerstone. The owners and staff are as friendly as can be. 

There are a ton of options for drinks and they have awesome latte combinations (I recommend the Iced OG or a hot Christmas in a Cup). Drinks can be a bit sweet, but the staff is more than happy to alter your drink to be 1/4th sweet, or however you would like it. Ask about their Monday half-off drinks. Another good deal they run is their stamp card. And for those who don't drink milk, they have both Soy and Almond milk.

I have been coming here for three years now, and for someone who doesn't have family or a huge network in Vegas, it's almost like a second home to me. What other coffee shop will give you a free drink when they find out you lose your job and also gives you a reference/contact for a new job?

I look forward to many more visits at my favorite coffee shop!

What can I say? 

I LOVE the idea of an independent shop. I try to support local businesses as much as I can. Unfortunately, their coffee is not that great. 


Staff is super friendly. Love the atmosphere. They could have better hours. I have been there several times and really, really want to like it more. 


However, their coffee just doesn't taste good. I have had a varies of drinks. Everything from regular old joe to some of their more popular concoctions. Just dosnt do it for me.

My office is just down the block from Grouchy John's and it is my go-to place for meetings. Service is quick and super friendly, love the coffee and the tea, and everything else about this place. No pretense whatsoever.

Almond Roca Mocha Soy was so Delish!
Will return for more!!

I started seeing this truck at UNLV and decided to give it a try... I really like the unique combination of flavors, my fav so far is the "Jedi", which is white chocolate and coconut. Also, the staff is extremely friendly and welcoming! Really good alternative to the usual corporate owned coffee shops.

My favorite coffee shop! I have never been a huge coffee drinker until I found this place. I've basically tried almost all their drinks and love them. Their stamp card is great and to this date the only ones I ever fill out before losing because I come back so often. Their drive thru is also 24 hours which is amazing for those late nights projects.
Grouchy John's is a "must go" coffee shop if you love great coffee/espresso.  They also have a mobile trailer.  Find in around town by following them on FB or twitter.

I've given grouchy John's three tries and now they're out. First time wasn't able to get served because of the chatty Barista sharing her tattoos. Second time I was served what was the worst espresso I've ever had in my life. I know this is a lot of people's favorites and I hate to be the one to say it but bad service and flavor.

My favorite Vegas find since living here ! I am here at least 5 times a week !! Coffee is delicious and the customer service is amazing :) I love the stamp card and I always get starburst or dog treats if I bring my fur baby !!

I love this place!!! It is a great place to sit down, drink a couple cups of coffee and crank out some work for grad school! And even if you don't have homework, it is a good place to come relax and catch up with friends.  Everyone is super friendly, the place is very clean and creatively decorated.  Highly recommend going here!

Life's too short for bad coffee! Best coffee in town! 

Mom n pop shops are where I want to spend my hard earned money & the quality here makes it worthwhile! 

Grouchys is solid! Stop in.. You'll be so happy you did!!
If you dont drink your coffee at grouchy johns, I feel bad for you son. Ive got 99 problems but bad coffee isn't one.

The best coffee in town! You will not be disappointed with the large selection of coffee. Not bitter or burnt.  Always so nice and friendly. Plus they always give our little pooch a treat. We went to a few other coffee shops this weekend...AND we're back at grouchy johns....the best!
Friendly atmosphere, down-to-earth vibes, and great coffee.  This is my regular go-to shop for caffeine and comfort :)

Best Coffee in town , Plus my puppy get a little treat with every visit!!

I just wish he would get on board with the coffee drinkers that need their fix BEFORE 7AM on the weekends..I had to go to Starbucks today at 6AM :-( --- please open at 6 am on the weekends so I no longer have to go to Starbucks and get ripped off and have to drink bad coffee... thank you
Great customer service!  Best coffee I've ever had!!! I don't know why I didn't come sooner! Bye Starbucks!

The options here seem endless and everything is great. I'm not a coffee drinker, but they have so many hot beverages that aren't coffee,I have a hard time deciding. Their staff is so friendly and helpful.

Located on the east side this coffee house is popular with the uniform and badge crowd. Seriously, this has to be the safest place in Vegas to enjoy a cop of coffee. 

As for the coffee,  it's good, slightly above average and hits the spot after a night of trying to get your teething baby to sleep. 

If your in the hood, want a safe place to enjoy a cup then this is your spot. Strangely however they don't serve donuts. They probably should with how many uniforms and badges are always in there.

I'm always shocked when I see a line that "that other place" down the street!  Grouchy John's is amazing and makes me not so grouchy anymore! Their staff is friendly, and their drinks are amazing. I've never ordered anything I didn't LOVE and made me come back for more and more... try the Butter Me Up!  Just thinking about it makes me want to go snag one!!

Amazing coffee shop.   
-The workers are very friendly.
-The feel of the place is like a local, kind of geeky, modern vibe. 
-The prices are very reasonable.
-Best of all the coffee is amazing.  Try the OMG. it's not something that I would have normally ordered, but I tried one from a friend, and now it's the only thing that I order.  It's amazing.  

I go almost every Sunday.
Endless drink combinations! Friendly staff! A definite regular here, and raving reviews are consistent!

I luckily found this place through meeting some amazing people. Long story short I was helping a lady install license plate lights in her car at autozone. Next thing you know her husband showed up to offer her help as well, I finished the simple task, and they were both very helpful. JJ pulled out his business card for Grouchy Johns and gave me 2 coffees for helping out. 

Two weeks later I came and tried our this place. Coffee is delicious and the atmosphere is local and awesome. You can get all types of interesting coffees, like cookie coffee and pb&j coffee... I don't even know!!!! 

Place is awesome, chill, and what Vegas has been missing. Come by and check it out. I don't know if I will ever go to Starbucks again, and I love Starbucks atmosphere. 

This place is also awesome for little day dates. They have coffee and board games as well! Tons of board games!
Pretty good coffee; great chatty staff at 7:00 am came here 3 days out of seven while in this area.

I will come here over Starbucks anyday. I love the customer service and they are the only place that I've been to that has Amaretto flavoring. Amazing breakfast sandwiches as well. I come here almost every morning. Love this place!!

Went in for a cup of coffee late in the evening as I saw the lights still on. Appeared like it was quitting time when I walked in so I asked and was informed that indeed it was 15 minutes ago. The man behind the counter whose name I didn't catch went ahead and made it any way for me with a smile on his face. Every other employee didn't seem upset to be helping after hours. Once I drank Grouchy Johns coffee for the first time it was way better than any I've had before. I will be back a lot based both the experience I had and the awesome coffee. Thank you!!!!
This shop has great reviews for a reason. They're very friendly to their customers and the Nutella Latte tastes amazing. I would definitely chose this shop over Starbucks.

I've been coming to this place for months so I think it's about time to write a review.

Grouchy John's is my favorite coffee shop for so many reasons:
1. It's local! It's so hard to find affordable, local places in Las Vegas so this is truly a hidden gem.
2. The service - the owners are here every day, and they're really personable guys who want you to have a good experience. The staff is super helpful.
3. The ambiance - Just go inside. You'll love it.
4. Starbursts! I still don't know why they give them out, but I'm not complaining.

My go to drinks are a simple nonfat latte (something I refuse to get at Starbucks because it's just not the same quality) and an iced chai with almond milk (another reason Grouchy John's wins), but really everything I've had here has been delicious. You're going to pay a little more than at Starbucks, but it's worth it.

Went here at 11:30 am on a Monday morning with my husband to hangout on his day off. It's a very quaint shop. We ordered a Jedi coffee drink- it's very sweet if you have a sweet tooth, it's good. I ordered a cafe latte with almond milk-I know, it's boring but I'm cutting out all sugar in my diet., it was fine. They have bagels,muffins, and I a couple of donuts choices. Not too many food choices but there's something for everyone. The people here are very friendly. I would definitely return.

I love to support small local businesses that really do a great job with their product and service.  Grouchy John's is such a place!  I love their sugar-free vanilla late w/ almond milk, as well as all their yummy fresh pastries, not to mention the service is always great!  Keep up the good work Grouchy John : )

I will not buy my coffee drinks anywhere else in Las Vegas.  
Customer service and drinks are epic.  A glorious melange of books and games.  Brilliant art work as well. 
I'm addicted

Love this place. Coffees and teas are very good and service is great. All the star wars decorations and coffee names make it so much fun! 

So go in, unless you're in a hurry or just too lazy to get out of the car, in which case you can use the drive through.

This a great place for a quick caffeine fix!
My daughter goes to school around the corner from here so I'll grab a small specialty coffee to hold me over in car line. 
Unfortunately there is an inconsistency in the flavor. 
I love the Evil Monkey and even tho it's always been good, sometimes it's been GREAT! I also love the Dora and have faced the same problem...
I hate that the flavor varies. 
When it's off, it's too sweet or is under sweetened with an espresso type of finish. 
But either way way, I can appreciate it. The flavor notes that are promised always come through so I come back. 
This place is worth a shot!

Working in the customer service industry myself, I find myself very critical (and oftentimes very disappointed) in the lack of this crucial element in businesses (both big and small). 

From the first time I set foot in Grouchy John's, I was immediately greeted with happy faces, great attitudes and I saw that every customer before me was greeted by name. I knew then that this place was exceptional. From that moment on, they remember what time of day you typically visit, what your drinks of choice entail, what special preferences you might have (what kind of milk or sugar you use, etc), and they even remember where you work and things you may have mentioned that you participate in outside of your daily visit. True customer service at it's best. 

One of the things I was intrigued about with Grouchy's was their penchant for community support (they take their business mobile and participate in local events), and their support for local merchants, vendors and small businesses (almost everything listed on their menu can be found here in Vegas - the coffee, the tea, and even the pastries!). 

THEN came the actual tasting itself... Heaven. In. A. Cup. Their menu includes a wide array of different and unique flavors, tastes and options that truly separate their menu from the leading chains, and they have something for everyone. The coffee itself is very, very smooth with a nice finish that literally tastes amazing by and of itself. If black coffee isn't your 'cup of tea', you can choose from a really neat of dairy alternatives (almond or soy milk), the usual milk or half-and-half, and sugars and sugar alternatives including agave nectar, stevia and honey (among the usual sugars). It doesn't have that 'burnt' taste you tend to chalk-up as 'normal' when visiting Starbucks or any of the other big name chains. It just tastes GOOD. Who knew coffee grown here in Vegas (Boulder City) could taste so fantastic? Although I typically get an iced americano with almond milk, their lattes are incredible, their espresso is comparable to that piece of dark chocolate you savor with each bite, and their unique flavors (Salted Caramel Latte, assorted smoothies, and 'Specialty' flavors such as the 'Butter Me Up' created by the customers and staff themselves) are something you won't find anywhere else. And the Starburst you get while waiting for your order will surely put a smile on your face. 

They truly cater to the health conscious and/or people who may have an allergy or sensitivity to the typical 'dairy only' products seen on most menus. 

The teas are also something left to be desired. The interesting blends and flavors brought in by a local woman who owns Joy's Teaspoon are absolutely amazing and definitely worth checking out. You won't find tea blends like hers anywhere. The Almond Cookie (decaf) is an experience in itself and you won't find anything like any of the other flavors in any other stores or coffee shops. 
The pastries (brought to you by the staff at Bread and Butter and Tasty Bunz) are to die for. Be sure to get a macaroon next time you stop in. You won't be able to just have one bite. 

Also, they have board games, bookshelves loaded with good reads and the atmosphere and ambiance is very inviting (think comfy couches). Stay for a while and get your work done (or just chill out and stay awhile!). 

All-in-all, Grouchy John's is a small business with a big heart that specializes in making people feel good and guaranteeing you will have a wonderful and fantastic experience each and everytime you walk in to buy your daily dose of caffinated goodness. Not only will you leave with a smile, but you will be a part of the growing community we love called Grouchy John's. 
Oh... And be prepared to possibly forget about Starbucks.

My favorite drink is the Chewbacca latte. Definitely a sweet treat. They have a great pastry selection and their breakfast sandwich is amazing - made to order with whatever you want cooked right into the egg. This has become my weekly breakfast date with my little son :)
This place is so relaxed. If you want to go to a confortable place to read, study or just relax this is it. Great customer service! Support local businesses !
So many awesome choices. I got an iced sugar free, soy, chocolate hazelnut latte & it was perfect!!

I understand the appeal of this place, I really do. Fun decor, loud baristas, and lots of interesting flavor combinations. However, out of all 6 of the drink my group ordered, not one of us was blown away. 
Granted, we are not the type of people who call super sweet beverages "coffee" like a lot of the world these days. These drinks were just plain dessert in a cup, with espresso added as an afterthought (maybe? I didn't taste it). If that's what you're into, then head over here. But if you're looking for a true coffee shop, please look elsewhere.
This place is amazing! Great coffee and a friendly atmosphere. They even have a pile of board games you can play while you enjoy some amazing coffee. My favorite local coffee spot! :)

SHOP LOCAL!
I used to meet with clients at Starbucks, but realized I wasn't doing my part to support our local economy. I began meeting at Grouchy John's. This place is by far the best coffee shop in Las Vegas. They offer unique blends and there's always a positive atmosphere when you walk in. Love going there!

Nom nom nom!! The salted caramel is delicious as well as everything else we've tried there. Most definitely better than chain coffee shops, so much in fact if its not from GJ I wont buy it. Oh yeah, and Vanessa makes the best drinks, hands down!!!

Let's just say I'm very thankful that Grouchy John's exists. Since they've opened years ago, I love coming here and going through the drive-thru to get a Strawberry Banana Smoothie. Now matter where I drink smoothies or if I try to make them at home, I can't seem to find a place that does it better. I also love their Grouchy John's Frappe, it tastes better than any Frappuccino at Starbucks. Everyone now and then, I'll stop inside with friends and we'll all buy coffe and tea and play board games here. It's just an overall great place to chill at. And all the artwork at this place really adds to the atmosphere.  Additionally the employees here are always energetic  (maybe they drank too much coffee lol) and the owners are really fun to talk to too. I'm also grateful that the Grouchy John's truck comes to UNLV every now and then cause I don't have to drive to their coffee shop. Oh and got to love having a punchcard and all the free starburst they give me (it still confuses me to this day every time an employee hands me a starburst). Lastly, I want to thank Grouchy John's for sponsoring my Operation Smile Walk-a-thons at Silverado High School in the past by donating tons of coffee certificates.

Thank goodness this place is by our office! Not only do they serve the best coffee in Vegas but they have the best staff. Like Cheers but with coffee, they really do remember your name.  My personal favorite is the Grouchy John, hot in the winter and frappe in the summer.  

If you like this place, like them on FB as well.  Their posts about random staff conversations are hilarious.

A COFFEE FAIRY TALE

Once upon a time, there was a magic elixir known as "coffee." People far and wide loved and revered this elixir for its taste and it magical ability to keep them awake at all hours of the day and night.

Then, an evil mermaid came along and built coffee shops every 200 feet. She decided to produce coffee that was often burnt tasting. To cover up the poor coffee, the mermaid loaded up her drinks with sugary syrups that masked any taste at all. The result? Carb-loaded beverages that tasted nothing like coffee. And she laughed her evil laugh while sucking money out of her victims' wallets like some demented cross between a Dyson and a $10 hooker with poor taste in coffee.

But in a small hamlet known as Henderson lived a valiant errant knight named Sir John of Grouchy who declared that it was indeed possible to not only have delicious coffee, but to offer a menu filled with flavored coffees, milkshakes, frappes and magical bunny rabbits where not only could you taste the individual flavors but still taste the actual coffee that went into it.  

(EDITOR'S NOTE: Though we haven't specifically seen the magical bunnies on the menu, we're relatively sure they're hidden there somewhere. We also assume that although Sir John is grouchy, it's unlikely he would serve up bunny rabbits for consumption and they are likely only on the menu to distract small children while their parents imbibe tasty beverages.) 

In late August of 2015, this knight brought forth a pumpkin spice frappe that was not only made with real pumpkin (not just some sugary syrup), but was so cleverly balanced in flavor that the coffee was still the front-and-center item to be celebrated. A single sip of this frappe introduced the individual flavors of pumpkin, coffee and cinnamon to the tongue with not a single flavor overpowering the others. A glorious treasure to behold.

A sampling of other items from Sir John of Grouchy's menu revealed that this clever balancing of flavors was successful across a myriad of coffee-related and non-coffee-related items. And thus, the balance and harmony of the elixir "coffee" was returned to the kingdom and Sir John was held in extremely high esteem by hundreds and hundreds of coffee enthusiasts, among them this fairy tale writer.

Although the evil mermaid continues her stranglehold on the fair citizens of the desert and much of the rest of the world, Sir John of Grouchy continues to hold his Sword of Coffee Excellence aloft and fights a valiant battle daily against this force of evil. Only we, the faithful following, can ensure that Sir John emerges victorious in his quest.

The End
(EDITOR'S NOTE: Well, not really the end. The store's open seven days a week. So you could technically go any day you want and that wouldn't be the end. Unless you moved away. But even then that wouldn't be the end because you could always visit. But you know what we mean.)

There's something for everyone here! The staff is friendly and if it's not right, they'll fix it for you! They are thoughtful to the community around them and host some awesome "caffeine and canvas" nights monthly. I would highly recommend Grouchy John's.

I'm a caffeine junkie so I decided to give grouchy johns a try. I was quite impressed on how they gave my dog a treat and have us candy at the drive thru. That's what you call a good first impression!
I ordered a grouchy johns iced coffee. Despite the 2 flavors to create the ice coffee, it wasn't too sweet. I also like how my coffee didn't have that strong burnt taste that Starbucks coffees have. $3.68 for a large iced coffee with flavoring is an amazing price! They also have a stamp card program and if you check in on yelp, fb, or four square you get an extra stamp. How sweet is that?
I will definitely come back here again. I might have found my new favorite coffee joint. I'll also make sure to bring my dog through the drive thru again because she sure enjoyed the treat.

Great coffee, friendly staff. I recommend white chocolate cappuccino  :) 

Interior is a great and hip place to hang out.

Grouchy John's is my NEW favorite study spot. It has everything I could want in a coffee shop and I would give this place more stars if I could... Sometimes, as I am driving to Grouchy John's, I found myself seriously considering whether or not I should just move closer to it since I'm there all the time. I would probably be there everyday if I lived closer. 

So start off -- atmosphere is always amazing. I love that there are two separate rooms-ish. I think they expanded, I'm not sure. But one is more coffee shop like. The other is more like a fun lounge, cafeteria like atmosphere. Tons of games set up for your enjoyment. I love the decor!!! Super cute.. I love how community driven this coffee shop is!

I used to be a Starbuck's barista -- I'm not going to pretend and say I know a darn thing about coffee because really, they don't train you to know much -- but I will say that out of all my little experiments at Starbucks making secret drinks and concoctions... PALES in comparison to the amount of choices that you have here! Though I usually order my regular - iced coffee with light cream, I like to venture out and try interesting flavors now and then, and Grouchy John does just that! I've had quite a handful but still have mountain loads left to try -- and I love that. The OJ is probably my favorite so far! 

I think what separates Grouchy John's from other shops -- the people. Definitely the people. I don't interact with them as much as I'd like mainly because I'm always in intense study mode. Medical school does that to you; takes away your ability to interact normally sometimes. ha, but I observe. The owner tends to be there, and he and his team ALWAYS makes the effort to let you know that you are well-taken care of. They are always welcoming, and put in that extra mile to acknowledge you. He often says "Welcome back!" That is so little, but can mean so much. It means -- he remembers you and hasn't forgotten you. I can't rave enough about the customer service they give and the genuine-ness that they provide. I set there HOURS on and and they don't ignore me, they will often come around and ask if they can bring water or refill my coffee. I love that it seems to be a very close-knit community and the owner seems to know everyone that walks in by name! They really try to make you feel at home here. 

Other bonuses here:
1.) First coffee and tea refills are FREE!
2.) They have stamp cards, check in and get 2 stamps, get 10 stamps, and your next coffee is on them!
3.) On Mondays -- they have flavor of the day lattes half off! 
4.) They have this Coffee and Paint? Not sure, something like that. But basically coffee instead of wine, and painting!! This definitely seems like fun and the art looks amazing! Again, love how engaging it is with the local and community around it!


I love trying new places because I am a huge foodie, but Grouchy John's has utterly put a stop to my search of finding a coffee spot. I don't need to try anywhere else! I rave about this place and tell all my friends because GJC deserves to be talked about. As a medical student, I don't know how else I would be getting through it all without GJC's... it really is the perfect atmosphere for me. The ONLY thing I would change about this place? Wished it stayed opened passed 8pm!

I've been going here since they opened and have seen them grow in customers and space. One thing has remained the same all along and that is the quality and personal attention. JJ and the entire staff is awesome and attentive to making sure service is genuine. If ever faced with the quick around the corner stop at a major chain coffee shop or a short drive to Grouchy's......I make the short drive every time time. The force is strong with Grouchy Johns.
My husband and I have our favorite on the menu. Price is no worse the Starbucks and they give you a piece of candy and our dog a treat. We like to try the different drinks

I just moved here a couple of months ago and started visiting grouchy johns because it was close to my home and it had good reviews. Although I tend to swing through the drive thru most days now, when I have time I try to stop and sit inside for a bit. When you first walk in you're greeted by a bunch of different art and memorabilia. There's basically a mini library in the main lobby and the back area has a ton of seating.

As for the staff they are top notch. They're all pretty unique and have great personalities. They go out of their way to make the experience a great one. The owners still work with the crew, and they're just as amazing. There have been multiple times I've seen an owner/manager attend to a customer or offer an unsolicited apology for something taking too long.

It's the way I'd imagine a small business to be run. It's a wonderful place and whether you're looking for a pit stop or need a new regular cafe, I highly recommend Grouchy John's.

This is my favorite place to get my brew and the mocha frappe is the best.
Reminds me of my college coffehouse.

Super awesome coffee shop. 
I had the Grouchy John Breve as my drink. 
Friend had the OG Frappe. 
Wonderful people and service from JJ. 
I will definitely go back. Lots of fun, free Wi-Fi, reading material and games for customers.

After looking for a nice, quaint little coffee shop to hang out and reading the great reviews, I decided to give this place a try. I am proud to say I am now an owner of their loyalty punch card program because I have become a loyal customer. The place has great coffee, but equally as important, they have owners that appreciate their customers. I love supporting small, local business and this place is worthy of its praise!

Good service, great vibe, lots of comfy chairs which is crucial. Drinks and food are pretty good, not outstanding but good. Expensive compared to the chain coffee shops in town. Free wifi is a plus. I would go back for sure.

LOVE, LOVE, LOVE this place.  I think it's better than Starbucks.  Their signature drink, Grouchy John Frap is the best.  Although, I can't seem to tear myself away from that one to try more. ;-)   Love how they have smoothies for the kids as well!

Excellent coffee shop. Staff was helpful and accommodating and the coffee was amazing. Nice seating and ambiance and a great collection of books and board games.  Props for the Star Wars references everywhere.

I came across this coffee spot and instantly fell in love. When you go inside, it's like you enter another world- a comfy, creative, and unique environment. The best part about this place besides their DELICIOUS menu options is the owner. He is so friendly and welcoming! If you're not completely satisfied with your drink, he insists that they remake it until it's made to your liking (I didn't have this problem, though, because they got it perfect the very first time!) The walls have a lot of different art that makes it fun to look at. This place is truly a hidden treasure; they deserve so much more recognition than they receive. They also have such a large variety of beverage options- smoothies, teas, seasonal drinks, and of course...coffee! They also have so many substitutions for milk which is so helpful. I recommend this place to everyone! You're bound to find something you like. I recommend the pumpkin spice frappe and the banana nut muffin. They're to DIE for! Yummm

I must admit I have never been a big fan of Starbucks coffee. I find it bitter and overpriced. I like DD better on both counts. But then my sister recommended this local coffee bar Grouchy Johns and I am addicted! The prices are great, the coffee is the best ever -- never bitter. The staff is efficient and friendly. They have every flavor imaginable. Food including breakfast sandwiches and gluten free protein muffins. Plus waffle Sunday's. If you are in a hurry they have a help yourself pot and drop $2 in a cup. I am so impressed and I really prefer supporting small businesses.
Great customer service every time! In my opinion best coffee in town. Much better experience and product than Starbucks!

I received this reply from one of the owner's this afternoon and was pleased and impressed.  
"My name is JJ, and I am one of the co-owners at Grouchy John's Coffee Shop. I want to thank you for sharing your experience at our shop, and I'd like to make it up to you, since it's clear what happened wasn't up to our normal standards. On your next visit to our shop or trailer, please ask if I or my partner John are there, and we'd be happy to make you & a guest a FREE DRINK of your choice. And, again, thank you for sharing your experience with us so that we can prevent such a mistake from happening again. Stay caffeinated!"

I'm not entirely sure what all the hype is about, honestly. The only outstanding thing that this place has in comparison to other places with coffee is the atmosphere. Art, books, board games, WiFi and great customer service. The coffee is somewhat standard but a little on the sweet side in my opinion. Has sort of a Sambalatte Terrefazione taste to it, when I just ordered the standard Grouchy John. Regardless, it is a great place with a nice view of some places on the Las Vegas strip. Has a bit o a competition against Sambalatte.

Awesome coffee shop.  Offers your classics, but also some very cool and unique specialty drinks.  Decor is pretty cool with art and other collectibles throughout the building.  Good breakfast options like donuts, avo toast, and sandwiches to go along with your coffee beverage.

Good strong coffee. The workers are so friendly it makes you suspicious. The only possible detraction could be that this seems to be a high school haunt, but what good coffee shop isn't, and it just means that I'm at the cool spot for the first time in my life.

Grouchy John's is so much nicer than the name! It has a great vibe with all the graffiti art, book and games around. I could spend hours in there and not even realize it. The coffee and snacks are always fresh and tasty. One of my favorite hang out spots.
My wife and I also just went to one of their Caffeine and Canvas nights and had a blast. We are not artistic by any means and our work came out looking like we were pros. We are so excited for their next piece!
Grouchy John's is another reason why we can never leave Henderson.

Update I had espresso, way cheap price, however was not drinkable.  I only wish I would have had it there instead of to go so I could have it remade.   Three strikes you are out.  I really wanted to like this place.

Love Grouchy's and ever since they opened up the second room there's always space to sit and study. Lots of regulars and always great coffee. The nitro cold brew is really smooth. 

Ps Grouchy is actually a pokestop. With desert bloom park across the street, having 10+pokestops.
Love this place! My order is always right and taste delicious! Love they have a drive thru as well!! They also have a rewards program for free coffee.

This place is THE best. I've been coming regularly for nearly three years and can't believe I haven't reviewed it yet. The specialty drinks are all delicious; order them half-sweet if you're not as much of a sugar person. The food options are tasty...I recommend a breakfast sandwich or wrap. The service is awesome. The staff are all friendly and helpful. The vibe is spot-on; they have great music playing, fun decor, and great seating options. Highly recommended!

They have numerous unique coffee flavors and combinations, but many of them are for the more adventurous. If you like banana and Nutella flavors in your coffee, this place is for you! Personally, my favorite is their Nutella latte; it's a more intensified mocha drink with hints of hazelnut.

My favorite coffee shop in Vegas. The coffee is amazing and very affordable. The staff are great. Jennifer is very helpful and always brightens up my mornings. They need to open more of these shops up around town.
This is by far my favorite coffee shop in Las Vegas. I have driven out of my way to get coffee from then. Great staff, great menu!

I have always loved coming here in the morning for their wraps. Never have had many issues except the fact that every time it's always a different price and I always order the same exact thing. However,
my last visit, I came to get the same order and gave the lady $20. I was waiting a bit for my receipt and change....Well I never got it. After a gentleman handed me my wraps, I pulled around to go inside to get my wraps and change. I ask the cashier for my change and receipt she in a very smart-alic voice, " oh did I not give you your change? And laughs"! She hands me a receipt for an order that wasn't mine, it was for a car that paid with a card. I inform her it wasn't my receipt and she starts scrambling. She right than and there, rings up my order and gives me my receipt and change. With her being under pressure, she rang it up wrong. I think this lady thought I was an idiot but I work in customer service I know she was pocketing my $20 and not ringing it up in the register. I wonder how many other customers she has ripped off and how many times she's been stealing from the owner?!

Yummy cup of coffee and an awesome vibe! 

I love this coffee shop! They serve really delicious coffee, have a friendly and quick staff, and the overall atmosphere is chill. They have tons of seating so it's a great place to meet up with a few friends. You can even borrow some card or board games to pass the time. 

I really like that it's a local coffee spot but It also has a drive through! As a mom, I find this really convenient because I don't have to unpack my daughter, wrestle with her while I order, then pack her back up. Before I found this place, convenience pretty much forced me to drink burned bean coffee at one of the larger chains. 

Definitely check this place out. You won't be disappointed.

Went in for the first time today and I have to say it was the best experience I've ever had at a coffee shop. JJ, the owner, is very knowledgeable about the products and I really liked the star wars theme in it.

The coffee here is great and the staff is amazing- always friendly and makes it fun to come in.  It has a nice neighborhood feel and they are very supportive of other small businesses, art, just an overall great place - it sure beats the massive chain coffee shops.

Great local coffee shop run by real people. The coffee is plenty hot and fresh, the edibles tasty, and the drive-thru is open early. They're a friendly, caffeinated group, and they have specials for early risers. I usually drive through, but the interior has a a nice atmosphere with local artwork and plenty of Star Wars decor.

Mayan Apocalypse - dark chocolate, horchata, and cinnamon.  Great combination of flavors without it being overpowering. Definitely worth a visit when nearby or you'd like to try something besides the regular flavors at most coffee shops.

Honestly, I keep forgetting this place exists. Mostly for the reason that I am so far from it. One of my co-workers is actually obsessed with the coffee/smoothies here and kept telling me I should come here. Took me a while, but I finally went by to try it. 

On my way to work I decided to make a pitstop, I was super happy that the location on Maryland Pkwy had a drive-thru. Seeing how I had no clue what to order, I literally ordered the first thing I saw. I was not disappointed. My first drink ever from Grouchy John's was a Butter-Me-Up, iced. Cookie Butter, Honey and Vanilla - Highly recommend if you have a sweet tooth. The person working drive-thru was super nice, and even while waiting for my drink, struck up a conversation with me. It made my first experience way more personable and something to remember. Next up on the "To Try" List is Dora, A.R.M and Twinkie. 

Definitely if you are heading towards the Henderson, and able to exit on Windmill and onto Maryland Pkwy... go for it! It is a bit out of the way, but it is worth the stop before you run your daily errands, or like me, a stop before work.

Absolutely love this place. Staff is always friendly. Drinks are delicious. I love the stamp card too. I mentioned stopping by here and my 7 year old immediately yells "starburst!!" She already knows!
Held a meeting here recently. The shop is large, with a secondary meeting room off the main area, the staff were kind, and the coffee was excellent.

Had an early moring meeting and was out of coffee at home so I stopped here because it was on the way and so happy I did. Not only were they open at such a weird hour they were happy and awake!! I got my coffee and got hot chocolate for my son and they smiled the whole time. Very nice and friendly. It actually made my day for the rest of the day because I thought if they can be happy at this hour then so could I!! Will be going back everyday. Might not buy coffee for the house just to have an excuse to go back LOL

The staff is always friendly and helpful.  They have a solid menu full of nothing but good flavor combinations - but if you don't like anything they are more than willing to offer alternatives or change anything you want.  And unlike other coffee shops - they don't up-charge for soy milk.  And if the coffee wasn't reason enough to go there - the interior is always filled with local art :). Love this place!

Well holy cow the atmosphere is speechless to describe! Immediately Jazmin, and Stephanie came to greet me as I walked into the door. I must say I expected to see a Starbucks like entry yet once I walked in I couldn't help but to express an exciting "WOW!" because, this place is a beautiful artsy hangout for the "cool kidz", definitely Star Wars fanatics and the boardgames. I was very impressed with the scenery I can't wait to bring my family and friends to hangout here! 


FREE WIFI!! 

The drink I had was introduced by the two young ladies as the Disneyland, Hazelnut and Caramel mixed iced coffee with an espresso shot was definitely what I needed to hit the spot! Indeed a stop if you're driving by. YOU WILL NOT BE DISAPPOINTED !!

Grouchy's is one of my favorite coffee shops in town! The drinks are amazing, the atmosphere is weird and fun, and the owners get to know you if you stop by enough.

They host tech coworking nights every other Wednesday until midnight - I look forward to these nights all month. :)

Edit: Forgot to mention how fun their Facebook presence is: https://www.facebook.com/GrouchyJohnsCoffeeShop

Great place!  I liked the ambience and the people. Stopped in early on a Sunday morning while staying in town in business. Had to go into work early and went Yelp to search for something different than usual Starbucks. Coffee was great. They have assortment of flavorings and can fix anything you want. I also had a bagel sandwich with egg and sausage. Made to order. It was good and hot!

Ambience-wise they have books everywhere. I liked the decorations (wall art and pictures). Wifi is provided. Outside seating is available too. Service was very friendly and sincere. 

Menu says they have smoothies. I'll have to give them a try on my next visit.

My type of attitude first thing in the morning. People greet with a smile and feel very genuine neighborhood feel. They remember your return, short conversation that is just right then the coffee. The coffee is one of a kind various flavors, healthy options, fresh baked goods, and THE PERFECT WAY TO START ANY EVERY DAY! 

Phill Pineda
great coffee as well they offer almond milk and stevia you will not find that at Starbucks

Grouchy johns. You made me not grouchy anymore. You have a fabulous little spot here in a super non-description area. I had the chipotle chicken wrap with an iced coffee and some lays potato chips. Perfect $10 lunch and I saved half the wrap for later!
Great coffee at great prices. I always like a good local coffee shop that isn't Starbucks,  and this place is a great spot to feed your coffee habit, grab a bit, or get some work done.

3 very amazing and very delicious words: Cookie Butter Latte. Please please pllleeeassseee open a Grouchy John's in the Southwest or hell even the West!! 

I love a good local coffee shop with amazing coffee!
I think this is my favorite place to get a coffee drink. The atmosphere is really great, as well as the beverage quality!

GJ's is about 12 minutes away from my 'hood, but I feel like it is the center of my community. I visit almost every day. John, JJ and all the baristas are the most genuinely nice people I've met in Vegas. They chat with you like real people.

Their pastries are local and their coffee is locally roasted. They support the tech community, local musicians and performers, and have art events at the coffee shop.

Besides all the warm-fuzzies, the coffee is the best I have found in Vegas. A friend from San Francisco came out for a week. I took her to GJ's on the first morning and every morning after that she insisted we go by to get a drink. She tried something different every day, and said the coffee was like Blue Bottle coffee in SF, if that helps anyone.

The other day was the first time I went inside of this place. Last two times I got unsweetened iced tea (which was good) through the drive thru.

I have been here a few times via drive-thru but after meeting someone here the other day...his request...hopefully I will not be back.

The workers at the front were loud and telling stories amongst themselves, seemed put off to help me.
The place was SUPER dirty. Dirty everywhere. Dirty tables with crumbs and sticky on them.
When I ordered, zero mention of stamp card. Put off attitude. Immediately went back to their random loud convo. 

After sitting at a dirty table out front near the tv, I went to the back room area. Sat at one of the large round tables and of course AGAIN it was dirty and sticky.

The parking lot is a nightmare, was scared to park my car because of crazy people in and out of their junkers. Not sure where all the crappy cars came from, the place was almost empty.

In the back room I look up and notice shit everywhere. Boxes, supplies, furniture and dirty crap lines the nasty painted back wall. Stacks of shit everywhere. Flowing out of the kitchen? What is all that crap?

Then the smell.........this place REEKS of dirty soured mops. It made me dizzy. I don't know if they serve food here but along with a rotten mop there is probably dirty garbage cans and rotten food.
If the dining room smells that bad, what kind of funk is  going on behind the scenes?!?!?
Nasty. 

Clean this place, remove all the junk, scrub the floors, scrub the tables and chairs, and give this place a need paint job. 
Disgusting. I will never go back.
Great service. Friendly staff. Had the Grouchy John Latte with skim milk and a banana nut muffin. Perfect way to start the morning. Thanks!!

A great locally owned coffee shop with some of the two most gracious and accommodating owners you will meet in John and JJ. Great coffee, I get the mocha frappuchino with almond milk and stevia. Those are two options you won't find at the big corporate coffee shops, and it makes my day. Also there are some games you can play while you're there... Uno anyone?
The worst part about moving across town is that I no longer am 5 minutes away from this coffee shop. :( Maybe we'll get lucky and they'll open a second location lol

This will always be my favorite coffee shop. I've been to so many coffee shops and nothing beats Grouchy Johns. The coffee is amazing! Their drink names and ingredients are so unique, it is rare to find a place like this. Don't get me started about their service, everyone that works here is ridiculously nice! They take really good care of you and constantly ask if you need water or anything else. I am so happy that their business is doing so well and is always expanding because they honestly deserve it! 

[All of their drinks are amazing, but here are just a few favorites in case you need help deciding what to get]

Some of My Favorite Drinks:
1. The Grouchy John (My all-time favorite which consists of White Chocolate & Amaretto)
2. O.G. (Caramel, salt, & vanilla)
3. Curious George (Honey, banana)

Fun Facts:
1. If you love Star Wars, this is your coffee shop. Many of the drinks and decor are inspired by Star Wars.
2. Once a month Grouchy Johns does a canvas painting in the shop.
3. If you check in on Yelp, they'll give you 2 stamps on your punch card. 
4. Every Monday, they have a 50% off drink.

What a GREAT experience!  Staff was amazing, theme was super fun and my coffee was Yummy!!! I asked for 1/2 the sweetener and it was still pretty sweet, but the coconut white mocha americano with a splash of soy was to die for!  This will definitely be a favorite stop when I'm on this side of town!

This is probably my favorite coffee spot in town. The atmosphere is funky and inviting. There's plenty of seating indoors or on the patio if you prefer to stay. If you're in a rush the drive thru is always quick and efficient. I usually go for the Nutella latte or an iced americano. You really can't beat their quality of espresso. If you haven't been yet, you're missing out!
Lots of great flavors to pick from without the crazy coffee price! This is my go to spot for coffee when I need that pick me up! I recommend others to give it a try.

This is my second time coming here and I am only now questioning why I haven't been coming here whenever I needed to study! Well, Im sort of a late night study bug, but despite their early closing hour, I would've (and now will) totally come here whenever I do get the chance to study in the day time!

It's not your ordinary coffee shop for sure. You could walk in, sit down, chill, or order your go-to at the drive thru. They have a shared private parking lot in front of the entrance. There's a fair amount of specialty flavors for lattes to choose from, hot or cold, non-caffeinated or caffeinated. (Still dying to try their Sith and Jedi lattes) They also have teas and pastries as well! As for the coffee, they taste better than I've expected them to turn out. Butter-me-up and Nutella has never tasted better in a coffee cup. (:

Now let's talk about ambience. It is definitely a vibrantly decorated place (on the inside.) So much art, starwars decor, canvas', board games, and an indoor mural against the largest wall in the back room. Oh and they also have a television inside as well! I realized that they have a lot more tables than other coffee shops I've been to in Vegas, so finding a table won't be a hassle for anyone wanting to study here. Not to mention, they have a few tables outdoors as well near the drive thru.
