Customer service has always been more than excellent each time I've been here. They're patient and super helpful whenever rI don't know what to order each time around. I also got starbursts upon completion of my order LOL. They come around as well and check up on you if you want water or anything.

When you do come here, don't forget to ask for a stamp card as well use the yelp check-in offer for an extra free stamp!

If you've never been here, then you HAVE to come here on you're next coffee run. Who doesn't love another unique and beautifully designed coffee shop?
The OG is delicious, salted caramel & vanilla is yummo! Is perfect pairing w Blueberry muffin...love that their food truck is now at Canyon Ridge Christian Church

I love this place!  Everyone is so warm and welcoming and the coffee IS. JUST. GREAT.  I also really love that they have almond milk as one of their milk options for a Paleo coffee whore like me.  I love the Grouchy John Latte, Caramel Macchiatto, & Cafe Au Lait.

I am not a big fan of coffee, but I have been trying new things, like trying different types of coffee other than *bucks or TRYING to like wine. Anyway, I usually get my sugar and caffeine fix from *bucks once a month because it's the only place I know and it's everywhere.

Once I had John's coffee, I had a wake up call. I realized that I absolutley hate corporate chain coffee shops. The espresso was perfect. It had right amount of bitterness, it was fresh and the aroma was heavenly.
Love this place. The coffee is the best, and love that it's a local business I'm supporting.

I passed this place for over 2 years always said I was going to try them, after too many to count bad expierences at the starbucks up the street and a conversation with the manager that even though she made it right after speaking with her the place lacked the customer service i expect from a place i am spending my money at. I am not going to say that all of them have bad customer service by Starbucks maryland location is aweful!
So back to my dear dear Grouchy John's, So from day one I have been a very happy customer! The customer service is the best I have ever experienced! That alone tells you why they have people come time and time again breaking away from the chain coffee places. The coffee is amamzing, love all of the creative flavored drinks one of my fav's is the Cinnamon dolce with white moca almond milk and whipped cream. Now on that note one thing I like is yes i am not getting reg milk but want whipped cream and they always catch it before I get my drink if someone forgets, the guy joked the other day and was like they can't miss the most important thing. The place brightens my moring with the friendly employees and the top notch coffe I am a fan of this place. I have not ordered a coffee that I have not liked almond roca mocha is another favorite of mine, I love the milk options as well, I prefer almond milk and they have sugar free flavors!! On halloween they showed their spirit dressing up one of the guys was an incrediable, that kind of tells you the type of service you will get with this place INCREDIABLE!!

This review is long over due I've been coming here for the last 4-5 years maybe a long ass time and coffee is always phenomenal, I love all the drinks but my favorite is the evil monkey my absolute favorite drink is a dirty chai but being introduced to banana syrup has been a game changer I don't know why more places don't have it! I've even based one of my signature cupcakes on this drink and the staff is amazing! 

Plus stamp cards! If I'm already coming to get a drink and I get rewarded with a free drink friggin makes my day!

Awesome place, friendly staff, and amazing coffee. Try their nitro cold brew... literally straight from the tap and its creamy like a guiness. Only con... but this is just a personal preference ... specialty drinks tend to be on the sweeeeter side... simply request half sweet and perfection!!

I enjoyed the space they had for studying. If you don't like sweet drinks, I highly suggest you get half or leas than half the sweetness. I got half sweet and its still pretty sweet to me. They have some interesting flavors though that I still have yet to try.
Amazing coffee! Fabulous staff! They always make you feel welcome. They host painting classes.. Super fun!

So delish! Googled and went on our way out of town. I had the butterbeer latte, mom had the pumpkin spice latte, brother had peanut butter mocha. My dad got a capp. The lattes were fantastic. Flavorful but not too sweet. The place has a great feel to it too. Cute pop culture themed art work ala keith harring.  Will definitely stop in again next time we're in town

Was good, atmosphere was that of a kick back coffee shop. They had plenty of board games to be entertained with if you weren't studying or anything else. The barista bused tabled and personally brought us our drinks. Even asked if we wanted refills at the table. Amazing service and friendly workers, great experience all around.

Was my first visit and I will definitely be back! My almond iced latte was delish, I got a stamp and redeem card, and a free starburst! The art in the walls for sale was real funky and I loved the shelves full of books you could grab and read in one of their patched, worn but inviting leather couches. The staff was real friendly and even came outside to check on my friends and I. good prices and a cool environment.

Okay... So this establishment's reputation certainly held up when I went there for a spontaneous coffee adventure before work. 
I get there, and there was a decent line. Not to mention that the space was decorative and cool to admire (ex. selling art pieces or board games available to patrons). The coffee area was certainly busy fulfilling orders, and the girl I placed my order with wasn't phased by the activity and was nice. 
Let's see... I ordered the Nutella coffee and Yoda smoothie. Both scrumptious! The coffee definitely tasted like the spread, and the Yoda smoothie I made last in my work fridge made me feel refreshed whenever I got to sip at it. 
I hope I catch them on campus some time 'cause I've seen them around the Student Union, and I definitely remember seeing it parked in front of their home base.
great coffee, staff is nice, prices are fair, clean store, I'm coming back for sure, cool environment to kick back and sip your coffee

Yum!!! 

I'm a total coffee fiend... Coffee monster satisfied  got the almond Rocha frappe w/non-fat milk.  Taste: light & I can taste the mocha for sure. 

Atmosphere: Friendly staff. Small & a little dark.  Comi-con theme decore.

I have never been to the actual store front of Grouchy Johns, but every Thursday at UNLV the mobile van is outside of the Library and it is my regular stop after my first class.  The guy that works it is always amazingly helpful when I tell him, for the 5th time, that I have no idea what I want! I have not found a drink that I do not like. My favorites are the Grouchy John and the Cinnamon Dolce which I tried for the first time today and adore as a frap! Some may say it's a bad thing that the worker recognizes me now, but I think it is great service. It adds a little something to my morning that I greatly appreciate! I will continue to get my Thursday coffee at Grouchy John's Mobile Van as long as they are here!

Grouchy John's is great! First off, their drinks are amazing. Secondly, the staff couldn't be friendlier which makes for a nice experience with such an extensive menu. And thirdly, the atmosphere inside is quite welcoming; great decor, comfy seats, morning news...

Well, I finally racked up enough stamps for a free drink and went in to get the Yoda. After some casual chit chat, I end up telling the server it was my birthday. Well, GJ's being as awesome as they are handed me back my stamp card and said I could have this birthday drink for free. Sweet!
First time here and it's been a great experience so far. Also, I appreciate them taking care of our local law enforcement!

Ordered a chai tea latte, bagel toasted with cream cheese, strawberry banana smoothie with no whip, and a donut...half the order was fine the other half not so much. Everything took forever to come out, others received their drinks before us even though they ordered well after we did, I had to ask for my bagel because it was just sitting in the toaster forgotten about (which it was over toasted and hard by that point) and finally the ordered smoothie with no whip came to us with whip. It didn't seem like they worked well with more than a couple customers at a time. 
The place is cool and different with a nerdy type feel, just the service was not my cup of tea.

This was a welcome surprise to walk into.  Really wishing I had visited here much sooner!!! The coffee is fabulous (I bought some to have at home), the staff are great and the atmosphere is friendly all around. 
They have WiFi, but I didn't see many people using it. Instead I saw people talking with one another! 
What a difference from other coffee places :)

They have once a month evening painting classes taught by Tommy Vinci.  I've been to 2 of these and they were fun.  They are the kind where everyone paints the same thing but everyone seems to paint to their own inner Van Gogh which is part of the fun of the class. You get a drink and a baked good with your class fee -- I like the Serenity Tea which had a very smooth flavor. 

Over all this is a real plus to our community and I encourage you to drop by and give it a try.

By far my favorite coffee place. The service, food, drinks and location are just perfect. I first saw this place on Google Maps after heading to work at 2am and seeing that everything else but GJC was open 24 hours so I head over there! I quickly get attended by a employee and he recommended the OG if it was my first time there, if I didn't want that then they'll do their best to accommodate what I was looking for. Not wanting to be a hassle I order a OG and boy was it amazing! Just the perfect amount of coffee and sugar to wake me up. Over the past few months I've tried most of their menu still being impressed how good it is. Easily one of my favorite coffee shops.

After reading a few yelp reviews I knew I just had to stop in for a specialized cup of  Joe.  Man! I am so glad the GF and I paid GJCS a visit!  This is what a coffee should be!  Not the sterile, industrial environment  of other corporate coffee joints, but a place where the atmosphere compliments the caffeinated cup of choice you are enjoying.  I did not meet THE Grouchy John on my first of many visit to come but I say to you, well done sir!  First, The coffee is outstanding!  Second, there is a multitude of conversation pieces situated all through out the establishment. From books, wrestling masks, art, your java partner, to Star Wars paraphernalia there is much to talk about.  Third, free wi-fi, so you can hunker down if solo with any wireless device. Fourth, the TV playing any number of things Netflix has to offer.  This is sort of drive for me and I don't care!  The comfy chairs, couches and old/new school ambiance make this a place worth visting!!

Came here with a group of friends yesterday to work on a project and we really enjoyed it. The the drinks were great, customer service was nice and the ambiance was welcoming . Would recommend over Starbucks or madhouse (:
First tine and live'n it.  Great coffee and socializing I had to have a apple fritter and warmed to perfection.

Love the atmosphere. The place was buzzing with people. Trying to find a seat in the early afternoon was tough but we managed to find a spot on the couch sipping java and having an intense conversation with a friend.

I adore this place. It's modern, has an abundance of options of specialty drinks, and the staff is more helpful and friendly than any other coffee place I've been to.  They are good at making suggestions and the blended drinks are awesome.  I tend to study here and every time I've been it's been a calm, comfortable atmosphere.  They even have a punch card to earn free drinks and a full bookshelf to borrow from:).  This is definitely my happy place to relax, study, or meet up with people to chat.  Also, if you like Star Wars, you'll enjoy a lot of the dcor here :).

As if good coffee isn't enough, have you seen the cool art work here?  My kinda place... (happy face)

03/20/12
Had a dream about the cappuccino at Grouchy John's last night, so guess where I was 1st thing this morning?  Perfection!
Grouchy johns not only has amazing coffee but also has some of the best service in Vegas. They make you feel at home while you sip on some amazing caffeinated goodness.
Great coffee, although the lattes are rather oversweetened (just order half syrup and it will be perfect). Love the feel of the shop. Very eclectic, nerdy design.

This is a great coffee shop with an awesome "neighborhood" vibe to it. The decor is definitely down to earth and inviting. There are several lounge areas and couches, book cases full of books to indulge in, board games and interesting wall art. The staff was extremely friendly and took the time to help me decide on my first choice of coffee. I opted for "Evil Monkey" which was a delicious blend of chai, espresso, and banana syrup. I could settle on Evil Monkey being my regular drink at GJ's and be extremely happy, but I am thirsty to sample their other creations!  They also offer several different milk options including almond which was great for me. I wasn't blown away by the cupcake I tried, but I picked based off the novelty design on it, not by what looked the most delicious. A 12 oz specialty coffee and a cupcake came to $7 and change.  I am a fan!

I've had several of the coffee drinks and not been super impressed, but they were all decent. I really enjoyed their tea though. An added bonus is they don't have the long line that Starbucks has in the morning normally. So if you are in a hurry and need a decent cup of coffee I'd recommend Grouchy John's.

Love this place! I work in the same plaza as GJC & I come here about 3 times a week to grab lunch / coffee and it's not only the coolest coffee shop in town, but one of the tastiest as well  I always get the chicken chipotle wrap, it's huge and comes with chips only about $7 .. sometimes it's a little busy but it's obvious why.. they're amazing ! Great coffee, delicious food, good prices

This is pretty much my favorite coffee shop ever. They also have some awesome non-coffee drinks like smoothies and lemonade. I want to try everything on the menu but my love for the Suicide Smoothie (strawberry, mango and peach) keeps foiling my plans! Everyone here is really friendly and the atmosphere is super cool so why go anywhere else?

Cool place with a lot of cool art! There's also a little store you can purchase from, and they have books everywhere that you can read. 

The coffee is good here!!

I cannot tell you enough how much I LOVE coming here. Such a fun atmosphere, I can play board games with friends/family/kids while enjoying a GREAT cup of coffee. Everything is so unique and delicious, I suggest this coffee shop to everyone I know and my Real Estate Clients always thank me for the suggestion!

I love grouchy John's! I feel like they have such a good selection of drinks and varieties of milks. My personal favorite is the Butter Me Up with almond milk. If you get it cold, go blended. I also love their breakfast oatmeal and the sandwiches. Super cozy spot to hang out and study at. Service is always nice as well.
love Grouchy Johns for the eclectic look that perfectly matches its unique coffee menu. I have a mobile job and this is my go to brainstorm spot. Love love love grouchy johns

Great local joint! I am used to studying at Starbucks, but decided to try this one per a friend's recommendation. The vibe is great and relaxed, much different than big chains. I got a frozen mocha, it was ok. The workers are friendly and you can tell they really care about their customers. I recommend checking it out next time you crave coffee.
This is my favorite local joint for coffee! Love the nerd stuff inside the store and the drive thru is open 24/7!

These guys are on their game!!  Great drinks(white chocolate mocha is awesome) and a nice environment to sit down and hang out for a bit.  Walking around and asking how the drinks tasted and offering up some ice water, nice!!  No wonder all I've ever heard about this place is Great things.  I'll be back!!

I don't understand why this place is so highly rated. I always order drive thru so that's basically my experience here.
I stopped coming here 3 years ago because of the inconsistency with drinks. Then the last straw was the customer service (it's hit or miss). I decided to try it again after a 3 year hiatus. Thinking maybe I would have a better experience and coffee! I was wrong. They do have a couple of hot drinks that are good but I'll stick to Mad House. Just my preference.

Stumbled on to this place looking for things to do in Vegas.  Since I'm known for being grumpy and coffee is life, and being a big star wars fan, this seemed like the perfect place for me.  The "grouchy John" drink was awesome. Makes Starbucks look like an absolute joke. Would definitely make this my go-to place for coffee if i lived out here.

They have a lot of flavor  
I got grouchy johns signature   
It was so good !!  Hopefully this coffee shop is next my house :( 
Casher she was nice and friendly 
And great things they do have drive thru !!!!

Love this locally owned business.  After just a couple visits, the team knew me by name.  I only get a chance to pop in once or twice a month, but it always feels great when they recognize me and remember my drink.

Fun coffee shop atmosphere, awesome manager (maybe part owner?), and great regular crew too.

It's my second visit and the cashier/barista was different than the first time but they both have consistent service -- which offers great service! I tried the honey boo boo (hazelnut and honey). It tasted like roasted nuts, and my breath smelled like that too! Heavenly!!! Nice environment to study as well and cool artworks around. Definitely will be a regular customer every time I do business in the vicinity!

Cute shop, friendly baristas. Only thing that's a turn off is their tip jar that says "just the tip please (not the shaft). Classless... Also their food selection, especially breakfast sandwiches are rather disappointing.

This place is fantastic! I love the art on the walls and the feel of the shop. It's perfect for a caffeine craving and the people are all really nice. I highly recommend stopping in. Not only are they nice but they remember what you ordered last time.

Grouchy John's is the first coffee shop I've been to in Vegas and each time I pay a visit, they never fail to impress. When the Pumpkin Spice latte is not in season, I always get a dirty chai over ice with soy or an Evil Monkey (bananas, chai and espresso) with soy--both drinks are a must try because they do chai right!

Some pros and cons...

PROS:
-amazing and friendly staff; customer service is definitely their forte.
-two lobby areas, a lot of space to sit down and study, read or just chill with friends.
-FREE WIFI
-tons of books and board games available for their guest.
-a drive-thru that is manned efficiently making it easy for people on the go.
-GREAT coffee and specialty drinks--they never disappoint.

CONS:
-they are located by schools, so when so is in session for the year and its 3PM, the coffeeshop is crazy packed super busy; a little distracting when you come here to work or just relax.

I love me a good local coffee shop. Sometimes, coffee shops can seem too hipster and intimidating, but Grouchy John's is the very opposite. 
Great service from JJ! He really creates a friendly, happy, neighborhood atmosphere. Either he or another barista usually come around every 45 minutes to an hour checking up on everyone and offering water and refills. 

Also they have almond milk! My favorite order is their honey latte - just enough flavor to complement the espresso but not so sweet you can't taste the almond milk. They also offer a bunch of frappes and creative concoctions for those so inclined. 

If the drinks aren't motivation enough (which they totally are!), Grouchy John's has free Wi-fi, TONS of books to browse, and you get a couple of free starbursts with each order. 

My Vegas/Henderson go to! Great place to spend a weekend morning, or afternoon, or evening! Anytime really. With a drive through, there is really no excuse not to stop by for a latte. 

I think they started to introduce some quick and easy food items to their menu (in addition to the pastries, muffins, and bagels), so I'm excited to see what else they will begin to offer.
Nice people & Love the brewed coffee. Hubby and I try to swing by at least once a week to sit back and relax before we start our day.

There is not much more that I can say about this place, except it is amazing.  The same staff has worked there for a long time. It is like a family atmosphere. They treat their customers right. The coffee is great. They have different types of milk to offer, such as almond milk. The selection is a wide variety of different coffee and tea. They have great frequent customer cards they will stamp each time that will lead to a free coffee. And best of all, they give starbursts at checkout. I highly recommend this coffee place.
Really cool coffee shop, I only drink regular coffee. This place is comfy and has couches to relax and read and an outdoor patio with tables & chairs.

Love it here! Exceptional coffee, the bulletproof coffee is a really nice treat for the bold and brave. It's rich, creamy, and feels like a strong bearded distinguished gentleman is giving you a warm hug and telling you your beautiful...sorry I'm not sorry, that's how I felt!

I visited this location for the first time on Thursday January 3rd after 4pm.  After the first day back to school, I was ready for a coffee pick-me-up by early evening.  I don't often go for fancy beverages but one of the specials sounded great.  The girl asked how I wanted it, which confused me so I asked "do you mean like with milk and sugar?" In a condescending tone she said "no,how do you want it?"  After a couple back and forth like this she finally said "hot or iced?"  I figured it being a winter drink it would be hot and didn't know iced was an option (they have a ton of options-overwhelming). Not once did she crack a smile or exhibit any type of patience.  She certainly got the"grouchy" part of the name down!  

Fun interior but the customer service would have made me uncomfortable to stay. I apologize for not being a skinny-latte-with-soy-milk-no-foam or whatever the hell people order type of person!
Should prob change the price sign on the drive thru menu since they've raised their prices.
The coffee is better than Starbucks and they have a food truck that will do events. What's not to love about this place??

I love this place! The atmosphere, costumer service, and especially the coffee :) Grouchy John's is like no other coffee house I've been to. Defiantly better than Starbucks coffee. The decor is a modern art gallery theme, and it gives such an awesome laid back vibe. Their customer service is top notch, everyone is so friendly and once in awhile they go around to check on everyone to see if anyone wants a cup of water or a free donut :) If you just want to hang out, there's a whole bunch of books and board games that you can borrow, plus free wifi.

The coffee is really smooth. And if you're like me, who likes sweet but not too sweet coffee, I suggest getting "Grouchy John Frappe or Latte" it has white chocolate and amaretto (almond flavored). If coffee isn't your thing, they also got smoothies and teas. 

Over all this place is great! Clean, friendly, and laid back environment. Be prepared to forget about Starbucks.

A great place to study with lots of tables and chairs. Some days are a tad bit loud since people do meet and hang out there with a huge party. All the employees are so nice and always asking if I want water while I am studying there. They have lots of selections to choose from for even non-coffee lovers. Their pink donuts are to die for. Maybe it's my childhood memory of Homer Simpsons eating a pink donut that they are just so irresistible. They currently have heart shaped pink donuts in the season of Valentine's Day which is cute. My go to drink is blended Rushmore, and the strawberry smoothie taste delicious. Definitely a place to check out when you're in the area.

I love this place. Good coffee, good atmosphere, and friendly workers. It's like one of my sci fi friends was a secret coffee connoisseur. Plenty of board games, art, and books around for all ages. Seating is plenty but I'm sure it gets full in the mornings (Came mid afternoon).

My husband ordered an espresso and it was good and smooth. I ordered a Grouchy John latte, hot. Delicious and had the right amount of coffee ( Chains version always taste either too sweet or the coffee is bitter). It's true their menu is vast and may even seem a bit inconsistent but this isn't starbucks. I like walking in a coffee shop and knowing there is something new and not just a seasonal thing.

Great coffee shop. They offer delicious drinks and pastries. The girlfriend always tells me to always stop by to grab her a cookie butter me up. Which is amazing. If your tired of Starbucks and coffee bean, come swing by this place. You won't regret it
Such a great coffee shop! Staff is very friendly and helpful and the vibe is wonderful. A great place to chill out and enjoy a fantastic cup of joe.
As a coffee addict and cafe lounge enthusiast, this place is by far the best of its kind. Everything from service, to drinks, to pastries are top quality. Found my go-to work area.
Really fun and confery place. I love the difference here. Very relaxed and easy to 'adult' ;) Sometimes you just want to be in the big girl crowd. And not have drama around. Love it here.

How can I not love a nerdy coffee shop?? I love everything on their menu and I love when I run across their cart at events. Board games, books, great coffee, and awesome art awaits you here. It's awesome.
friendly....friendly... friendly...good mocha.,.good bagel sandwiches..customer service is crazy good..
I love their coffee. I haven't been to the actual shop location but have tried their coffee from their food truck and have yet to be dissapointed with any of the flavors i've tried.

Was looking for a new coffee place near by.. found Grouchy John's.  It so fun, hip and has really good coffee too...  The place was full and busy on the Sunday we were there.  There was still plenty of comfy seats to settle in and enjoy a book, and coffee.  I had the Butterbeer coffee.. It was  different and very tasty.  Butterscotch and coffee with a touch of salt.. who knew?? I'm telling you you gotta go check this place out  They have a very good variety of teas, Italian sodas and coffees
Great coffee, great atmosphere. Good wraps too. I think I'm addicted to the dirty chai. Love that they have books you can read (or borrow).

Coffee here is very good! I had the curious George which wasn't all that great just because of the over powering banana flavor. But the coffee it's self is very good. My gf got the mint mocha frap and that was also very good, the dirty chi was a little strong but also good. Like I said just the regular coffee is great!

Whenever I'm in the area I always make a very conscious effort to drop by, no matter the time of day. Grouchy John's coffee is just that great. Their drinks are definitely some of the best in town. While I've only tried a few of their specialty espresso drinks, it's enough for me to return to get my caffeine fix. There's something for everyone. 

Quality is on point and prices are fair. Service is also simple and efficient. All of these are the standard things I look for in an establishment, but GJ's does it exceptionally well whether you're just dropping in or staying for a while. 

There is also plenty of space and seating to accommodate the patrons that bustle on in during the morning/lunch hours. 

They also do have a punch card, so don't hesitate asking for one if it's your first time!

This is my neighbourhood coffee spot...well about 3miles away but worth every journey. From their ever friendly and helpful staff to their meticulously hand crafted menu this is a great place to have coffee and hang out! Personally my favourite is the OG, but their holiday drink is delicious and there really is something for everyone!

My original review was for the truck when that was all they had.  The shop is amazing. Geekery, games, comfy chairs, and incredible coffee.  Service is fast and friendly. Coffee and smoothie options are many and varied.  A great place to hang out with friends and have breakfast.

Gosh,  I love Grouchy John. This place is a lifesaver for coffee lovers like me.  Work seems to enjoy taking me back to Las Vegas, over and over again. I had forgotten how many times I've been back in the past 12 months, but I have to say, finding a decent cup of really good coffee on The Strip is zilt, nada, zero!! So I decided to walk The Strip and asked the locals where to go and get a good cup of Joe! Everyone said, go to Grouchy John!

It did not disappoint.  My first sip of their cappuccino, I was in heaven!! It was smooth and so good! I also enjoyed their funky wall decor. I also bought their delicious pastries, and I even got a chance to chit chat a bit with the locals.  There is also a nice outdoor area where they even provide a water bowl for your pooches.  With so much of my work travels to Las Vegas, Grouchy John, is the place for me to get away from all the hustle and bustle on The Strip!! I will definitely be hanging out here when I come back again for work!!

Until then, be kind to one another and Cheers! ~ :p

I am a coffee fanatic and I can tell this coffee shop is no joke. I came to visit this place here and there and now I've taken the time to write my review. 

The place is spacious and wide with numerous seating and the layout of the art pieces were very neat and colors just matched the calm relaxed surroundings. This actually feels like you can come here, sit down (outside patio seating available) and sip on some warm delicate coffee. 

This place uses pure arabica beans all the way not no robusta like Starbucks, the quality of the coffee is rich, sweet, and earthy--just how it should be. If you want to come down and have a cup of joe, this place surely ain't your average! I'll definitely come back to try out the other lattes and espressos!
 A+

Love this place!  Cute local neighborhood coffee shop w/books, board games, and speedy drive-thru!  Always great service!  My faves are Nutella frap w/almond milk and Southsea Magic Tea w/lemonade (half-half).  They also have a stamp card! :D
Love this place!! Great coffee shop to try something out of the box, usually I get the same things at any other place, but I like to try new things here. And it's always delicious!!

this will easily become my number one study spot from now on. their menu has a variety of drinks and food to choose from and can complement any mood. i came in today around 1pm, which is when the nearby school releases their students. grouchy john's offer two different atmospheres; one side is more for those looking to get some work done and the other is for those looking to socialize. the students of course are there to socialize. they remained on the other side of the building. from time to time they would get loud, but not too obnoxious to where they interfered with my readings. (i prefer noise while i study) my friend stopped by to check it out. it is safe to say we will be back this weekend.

HOLY MOTHER OF ALL COFFEE'S! I have been here a few times now and I love this place. Not only is the service here great..the staff is so friendly the coffee is fantastic. The flavors are endless and you can get any of them hot, cold, or blended. I also love the atmosphere here..I'm a Star Wars fan. I live in the far Northwest side of town and actually drove to Henderson just to grab a coffee here on the weekend. Luckily, I work down the street. So glad I found this place.

I have been looking for a cozy coffee shop where I could read a book and enjoy my coffee, so I've joust found it! I spent almost 4 hours at Grouchy Jonhs' today and absolutely loved it. Bagel with avocado and tomatoes was delicious, as well as the chai tea latte and coffee. The staff is also very friendly and accommodating. Atmosphere is awesome with all the artwork on the walls, lovely decorations, books, comfy couches and all!  Will definetely be back again soon.

I love this place for studying and smoothies but today I came in for relief from 113 degree weather.. I ordered my smoothie as usual and when my friend asked for a water they said they won't give him one? I didn't know it was that much pain for a water cup. I won't be coming back. I'll stick to Starbucks for now on.

Lisa H especially turned me on to this place: I finally made it by myself and as soon as I stepped in the door, I wished I had more time to spend here. 

Coffees, teas, smoothies, and juices coexist peacefully together on the menu, and the dining room has shelves of books, newspapers, and games, just in case you don't have a device to take advantage of their free wifi. Basically, it's your best friend's living room, if your friend knew how to make a million drinks and had a pastry case handy.  
In short, this place has everything you could need to spend hours in a coffee shop with friends or solo. The staff are so friendly here, they'll probably end up your friends within a visit or two.

The Grouchy John is their namesake coffee drink for a strong and delicious reason, but if it's too late in the day for caffeine just ask for their Shirley Temple of Doom- a blended matcha green tea drink with maraschino cherries. Part dessert, part smoothie, all uniquely tasty.
Better coffee than frikkin Starbucks. Support the local business y'all. Great service, smiley faces, and a great place to meet and make new friends.

My sister and I affectionately call this "Grumpy Johns!" I love this place for many reasons. First off, it is refreshing to visit a business where your expectation is to recieve grumpy service. No pressure or feeling slighted if the counter attendant scowls and delivers service without a smile:( However, this is not the case, for they do smile here and seem genuinely glad for your business.

Next, my coffee connesuier insticts have confirmed that these beans and the expert preparation are first rate. EVERY soothing sip of my mocha et al. has been sublime. NOT the case at your chains.

Third, a drive thru. Enough said.

And lastly, the selection of seating choices and games and books invites one to leave behind the bustling frenzy of life and linger for awhile.

Love these Grumps!!
Went thru drive thru & the girl helped me out with everything , she is really kind. I think her name is randi

Most down to earth coffee shop I've even been to. Owner John comes around and asks if everything is okay. He even brought me a cup of water without me having to go get it. I love their frozen coffees and iced coffees. So cool they have a punch card so frequent users can earn free drinks. Positive community feeling with board games and art work. They even have a drive through!
Grouchy John, Angry Joe, what is everyone so annoyed about? It's only coffee.  Need more variety of desserts and coffee is average. And more variety of names apparently! lol
Nice little cozy coffee shop. The staff are friendly and energetic. They offer breakfast goods, pastries, and donuts. The Nitro Cold Brew is delicious! I will be visiting again before I leave town!

I don't know who Grouchy John is, however, everyone here was super nice to me. I had a frap to go. The little Star Wars decor touches made me smile. There is some seating inside but this was a grab and go situation.

Coffee done right! Dropped in for a quick pick me up before my boyfriend and the family headed back to LA. The service, selection of beverages, and overall environment are beyond what I expected from a small coffee shop. We decided to order an Iced Black-eye (iced coffee with two double shots), an iced Almond Roca Mocha with an added shot, and a blended Curious George( blended combo of coffee, honey, milk, and banana). Being our first time there and having an amazing menu to pick and choose from, the service from both associates was awesome in assisting us to pick from the selection. The flavor of the coffee and not having an overpowering sweetness from the ingredients included was very pleasing. Ive found that with most corporate establishments (not to say I don't appreciate a good Coffee Bean here or there) is the coffee itself gets lost behind all these added syrups, powders, or blatantly is not produced as rich as it could be, but Grouchy John's did it just right. Needless to say we enjoyed our selections beyond our expectations and the overall vibe and environment is very welcoming. I have to say if I was a student this would definitely be on my list of places to relax and study without the fuss and fight for a table or outlet. Thank you for the coffee, great service, and we look forward to enjoying more of the menu on our next Vegas trip.
Great place to read or socialize and enjoy some wonderful coffee.  Cool independent drink recipes and a killer atmosphere.  All around great experience.  Stop in and support.
Good coffee and breakfast sandwich.  Was hoping John was really grouchy but alas he was very nice.

Before I would have given this coffee shop 10 stars if I could, but over time it has gotten less and less perfect. The owner is fabulous...he makes sure you know he sees you and he thanks you for coming back. I used to love the bagels, they were moist and fresh and have showily gotten worse. Now everytime I buy one hoping for the latter they are dry and bland. Also, I love the maple bars and cheese danish and EVERY time I come in they are out.....literally always. Why not order more ? They are clearly in demand. Also I have voiced my concerns about the bagels and such and they look at me like....yea we don't really care. Soooo.....before......they would've tried to make it right or told the manager but now it's kind of just nonchalant......however these aren't issues if you aren't a frequent flyer here :) the coffee is always amazing! Hopefully they will get it back together and spread the love because this place used to be where I would go on a bad day.....and still go for homework :)
If you haven't come down here, do it. Great atmosphere on top of great drinks. Coffee is actually good. Staff is very friendly. Always my go to coffee place.

I really enjoy coffee shops like Grouchy John's. There is a special connection that the owners of spots like these have with coffee and it shows. Grouchy John's is definitely a spot that I would probably be at all the time to study and have a great coffee if I were in still in college. I guess that really shouldn't stop me because I guess one could say I could write up reviews and still have a great coffee. Alas, I digress...

As I mentioned, it is a great spot to study or do some computer related activity because they have wifi, coffee, access to outlets, and snacks.

They have almond milk which is a bonus because I drink way too much soy milk from other coffee spots that don't offer it. 

I get the iced almond milk latte with an extra shot of espresso. Delicious. Unfortunately I tend to kill it before I even make it to my desk at work - then this John gets grouchy also.

Really cool, fun and laid back place. It was a nice chill spot for myself and an old friend to catch up. We sat in a quiet corner away from everyone just so we could be loud haha! Had a great afternoon and the coffee's not too shabby either! Loved the fun art on display, which I think was for sale. Overall, really cool coffee house. Reminded me of New York, where I'm originally from.

After exchanging rental cars at the airport, I decided to look for a place to sit and have a cup of coffee or tea. Luckily I found this place- because that morning I had one of the best cheese bagels I have ever had. Instead of coffee, I decided to forego the caffeine for a smoothie, and it was awesome! 

You know it's a great experience when the intended 10-minute stop turned out to be an hour of respite with a book, bagel and smoothie.

One of the best food trucks in Vegas and it don't serve food -- just coffee drinks and smoothies.  

Wouldn't know much about the smoothies, but I have a serious caffeine addiction and Grouchy John's Coffee does a great job with espresso drinks and coffee.  First, the black coffee is great.  Grouchy John's uses coffee beans that are medium roast (not French roast or burnt like Starbucks beans).  After they grind the bean down, they brew up a strong tasting and flavorful cup of joe.  Thumbs up.

The espresso drinks are great too.  The honey latte is my favorite, offering a sweet steamed milk drink with a sweetness falling between a mocha and a latte.  The honey provides a nice sweetness, but not so much that the taste of the espresso is drowned away.  Love it.  The mocha should be celebrated as well--for those nights when you want a hot chocolate, but also need a pick up--it's delicious.

Finally, the truck offers great customer service.  The guys running the truck always seem to be in good spirits and crank out the drinks quickly.

My fav little coffee shop in all of Vegas/Henderson!!
The staff here is so friendly. The whole place is very clean and open which makes it very comfortable.

The coffee is great!!! Every time I'm here it's so perfect if your drink is jot theh will always offer to make it right!
I love that they are using local products from their beans to their bakery items. It's nice when you get great service and great coffee in the same place.

Re review.... Manager had offered to make it right for me. I feel thats great but never a true review that way. 
I have been in there 3 more times since, this place deserves the stars and has renewed my going there. I was seeing a patient over there and dropped in again the other day... All is great! Sorry for the harsh review the first time and will start frequenting again more often.

Grouchy John's is without a doubt the place to go. If you want a selection of coffee then this is coffee shop to go to. The customer service they give is phenomenal and always friendly regardless of the time you go. This place is 24 hours and for people like myself this helps me with my unpredictable schedule. The quality is amazing and has never disappointed me. They are so much better than Starbucks. This will be place I'll go to no matter where I am in town.

I drove 20 minutes to check out this place and it was well worth it!  It was truly refreshing to see something different from your run-of-the-mill coffee shops.  Looking at this place from the outside, dare I say that this place used to be one of those large chain coffee shops?  Dun dun dun...

Anyway, once I walked in, I realized that this place isn't a chain.  The decor is chic which non-corporatey furniture and looks very homey.  Service is excellent and I was asked if I've ever been there before.  They were patient with me while I perused their menu of non-corporatey drinks.  

I ordered the Almond Roca Mocha latte, iced (since it was 100 degrees outside).  It truly hit the spot - woke me up (but not like "jolt") and it also hit the sweet craving I was looking for. 

If sweet isn't your thing or if you're looking for super strong coffee, then I'm sure they make something for you to.  Oh and they have a drive thru if you're in a rush.

I've been coming here for years now. This little place is my business meeting stop, with many of my friends using it for the same reason. Great location, great place to enjoy coffee, and the staff is fun yet professional. Don't go to the impersonable green monster, if you want some nerdy ambiance, great coffee, and some very nice people to help you, try Grouchy John's Coffee.

Of the coffee places I visited this week, this was definitely the most colorful, not just in interior design and menu variety, but in the clientele. No one can touch the old socially open 'underground meets hipster' vibe of the old Roma and Copioh hangouts, but Grouchy John's will get you closer than any other Vegas coffee spot will. They have a ton of seating in the back room, while the more limited front of house seating provides a socially accessible setting. They have a ton of books, games and art to look at while you're there. The coffee is cheap and good, but the food is not cheap: It's a lot to pay for decent but basic food options. Still, for coffee it's a neat spot to see a variety of locals and art.

Definitely try the 'Butter Me Up' cold or hot!!! I am craving one as I write. Tomorrow I am making the trip to have one (or 2). And they have a couple of books I have been meaning to read. Tomorrow is going to be a relaxing day at Grouchy John's. I wonder if they would notice if I moved in?

My favorite coffee shop in Las Vegas.
Delicious drinks, amazing service and the atmosphere is great!
I don't go anywhere else.

Not to shabby! Had a hot Latte with sugar free almond rocha syrup and a banana nut muffin. The one thing I love is the large selection of sugar free flavoring to choose from. Really laid back, comforting vibe with friendly staff and comfy seating.

I'm a sceptic by default if I see glowing reviews. But I'm curious and have been dying for proper espresso. You either get it or you don't. The freshness of the coffee beans are as important as the blend or the machine that's pulling it etc. 

Well....these guys use LOCALLY ROASTED ESPRESSO beans. The espresso shots are incredible. They are are truly perfect. Flavorful, rich, gobs of crema (which comes more from the freshness of the beans than anything else). If they served them out of the trunk of a Buick I'd still be a regular! But then the coffee shops insides are super cool too. Looking around for a coveted outlet, for example, I found (next to a worn in/comfy leather chair) a.....wait for it....power strip. Outlets galore!!

Well done, guys. This place truly "get's it." Cheers.

I'm from out of town, and wanted a coffee from a local shop, and away from the strip.  Found this gem. 
This coffee spot is awesome.  The service was to notch friendly, and the coffee was great. I ordered a matcha green 'grinch' half sweetened (I think that's the name) sooo good.  
This is my coffee spot.  I'll be back!

I wanted to like this place, heard a lot of good things about it. But they got my drink wrong prolly cuz the guy at the register stared at the TV screen behind me the whole time instead of listening to the order. Waited forever for a remake and not even a quick "sorry"
The barista had her long wispy hair hanging down to the counter, how can anyone work like that? It's unsanitary and a miracle it didn't end up in my cup 

The place itself looks cool and funky
Great coffee and excellent service. Pastries can be a little stale but ok if you ask them to warm them up a bit.
Love this place! I come here whenever I need a relaxing place to study. They have great food and all kinds of drinks. The workers are very nice and helpful and I love the environment.

Love the people, the service, and most of all the options to customize my drink.  This is my go to place after a morning workout or if I need a quick pick me up.  Huge perk: everything is customizable and there are a bunch of sugar free flavor options that hold up to the taste test.  Plus, you're a night owl or get moving before the sun wakes, the drive thru is open 24 hours.
Only thing needed when one has a h/over is coffee!! Pretty much the same price as new York so no complaints in that dept. Fresh, strong and definitely woke me the hell up!!

Per John: not the the grouchy one, "it was so good, I'd drive out of my way to get that coffee again"

Good strong coffee, not bitter. Excellent!!! I wish there were more breakfast choices so I could spend more time and money there.  Love this place!

With a name like Grouchy John's, you can't help but be curious; but don't be shy! This staff is the exact opposite of grouchy. So helpful in navigating through an exotic menu of non-traditional coffee, tea, and smoothie beverages. Going with a on tap nitro cold brew, I love this coffee shop and will be returning whenever I need my morning fix.
Always a nice place to hang out or catch up with some work. Their coffee is great and the staff is always friendly

Grouchy John's is the Cheers of coffee shops. They are super friendly without being overbearing. I was pretty blown away that they remembered my husband and I on only our second stop in! I love that they have a big room with tables where you can work with people and not feel like you're being too loud and that they have a ton of board games. Can't beat coffee and monopoly. They also make bomb breakfast bagels. I will go well out of my way to go here, even though there's a starbucks a minute from my house. They make great coffee and great food, are welcoming and cool, & treat people well. They truly get what makes a loyal customer base.

I love their coffee and have stopped drinking Starbucks because of them (you'll realize how bad the bucks really is). Drive thru is great and walking in, it looks like a cool place to plop your laptop if you have some stuff to take care of. If you live close, it would be a shame not to at least try this place. LOVE small businesses, they're the ones that get it right!!
Love this place! Delicious coffee and a fun hang out! My favorites: pumpkin latte (fresh pumpkin) it's absolutely delicious!

First time visiting, everything was a little dirty and a bit sticky. The drink I ordered basically tasted like drinking maraschino cherry juice straight out of the jar. For the large selection of flavored coffees they make, I unfortunately ordered the gross one. Maybe I'll be back to try a different flavor.

i'm a coffee snob and i'm ok with that.
i don't drink coffee because i need to, i drink it because I LOVE COFFEE!!!
i have a deep appreciation for coffee and all of the heart and soul that goes into brewing a perfect cup.

i am not a patron of the green mermaid, or starsux, as i call them.
bitter and burnt does not a good cup-o-joe make.
i don't care how convenient it might be because there's one on every corner in every town.
like i said, i don't drink coffee cuz i need to, i drink it out of pleasure and starsux does not please me by any beans...means.
every other coffee joint could disappear and i STILL would not go to starsux.

grouchy john's, on the other hand, puts me in the least grouchy of moods.
i don't know the details, where they get their beans, what type of machine they use to brew, etc., but whatever it is that they're doing, it's all right in my book.
what i do know, just by drinking my delicious latte, is that they care about what they create, where their ingredients come from and how their clients feel when consuming their goods.

i always order a soy latte...PERIOD.
no extra this or that, easy on the blah, light here, heavy there, blah, blah, blah.
when you have coffee, you should be able to taste the coffee, not mask it with other crap.
gj's coffee has hints of nutty, rustic flavors and is as smooth as they come.
perfect crema on the espresso as well.
the temperature at which they serve the beverage is also just right.

i would follow this coffee cart wherever it goes!!!

BUT...
now they're opening up their own shop at 850 s. maryland pkwy @ wigwam!!!
yay!!!

I love this coffee shop, the staff is exceptional and they are endlessly  friendly and personable. They are open to my large groups of friends that accompany and they do what they can to accommodate. The coffee is good,  though the flavor balances tend to tip towards sweet which isn't my personal favorite.
What a fun coffee shop. So nice to go to a place that makes so many coffee choices and fun snacks. I will be going here from now on!!!
Think of Starbucks, but with coffee that doesn't suck. Small coffee house, with a drive through. Large menu with every combination you can think of.

I am very shocked I have not written a review for this coffee spot. I am the caffeine loving mama! Lol Anyway I have always loved their coffee, blended drinks, even their wraps are pretty bomb. But when I go here 3xs in the last week because I'm craving their blended coffee - my problem, not theirs lol. I also live in the other side of town, so that's how you know this is one of my favorite coffee spots. I always pull up through drive-thru, they are always helpful, patient when I'm indecisive, and pretty quick. I haven't had bad service...Yet! Everyone's always friendly, I love how they give you a couple of Starbursts with your order, the blended coffee is always blended right ( you can taste the flavor of your coffee throughout ). I love their wraps because if you get everything on the sand which they have chopped green peppers in it, and I love green peppers!! I'll probably be back this week lol.

I came here to meet a friend for coffee and catch up, the geeky decorations dragged me in and I loved the place. 
Ordered a Serenity blended (duh firefly is the best) and was blown away what a great drink. 
My only complaint, I need a location closer to home and if you are looking for staff I would be more than happy to apply.

JJ makes the best blended coffee drinks and is the nicest guy you will ever meet.  I can't do too much caffeine and he doesn't have decaf but he's able to modify the recipes so they are low caffeine, which is essentially decaf.  I haven't gotten the shakes off of one of his drinks yet.  He also makes fruit smoothies so there is something for everyone.

I was on the way out of Las Vegas and looking for some coffee and found this place on yelp.  We decided to try it because it had many great reviews.   Everyone in the group I was in was pleasantly surprised and enjoyed both the coffee and the food.  I would definitely recommend this place, awesome!

Great service. Great combos for drinks. Little of a rush at check out but doable. Good atmosphere in front of establishment but back if front is full not comfy needs redone for sure to better match front of place.

Bulletproof coffee.  SO good.  You know those See's candy Caf Latt lollipops?  That's what it tastes like, except better.  Man, I wish I lived in Vegas (not really)...but being mostly paleo/GF is so delicious in this neighborhood!  We live a few hours away, so we do visit Grouchy John's whenever we're in town.  It's hard to make bulletproof coffee that good at home.  Their other drinks are so tasty too!
Staff is warm and engaging and the atmosphere has that chill curious coffee shop feel. Lots of fun and yummy drinks. It's hard not to go here every morning- I have to limit myself to once a week.
The coffee has great flavor. The drink options are creative, and it is a fun place to go to.

I know am the last yelper in Vegas Valley to review Grouchy. Better late then never right!? LOL! Shout out Suzy H for the suggestion coffee and conversations.....knowing that never been Grouchy my beast partner recommended new spot for me! Talk about everything hip, cool, NON corporate/chain, and above all PERSONALITY. Right off the top before walk in the bright yellow color, the mobile trailer sits outside, the character that comes with the name/logo, and knowing only ONE location. The moment you open the door thinking myself SO much going on inside coffee shop is the last thing think walked in. Talk about hippie or woodstock feeling for me. The local artists (I think local) works all over the walls (not just one style from painting, size of the artwork, bold big colors, or think the coolest original artwork seen in any business second room completely covers one wall) not only original but great way support local community. All the different boards games anyone can pick up and play game. The books not just handful but few shelves of book from kids books to adult books. I would think like the board games community style just make sure put them back. The furniture nothing uniform in the place most part different style and sizes for all groups of coffee drinkers go hang out. The names of the drinks are very creative! Not that the place not modernize still have your widescreen televisions keep you entertain, pretty sure they have wifi, and lots of outlets plug in electronics over coffee. Not forgot about pastry they have display with few options not super big but sell bagels, cookies, and other stuff. Not sure if they make them on property but they were looking good. The workers are AWESOME. I love not only super friendly, explain everything cause talk about options, and just feel all positive vibes. I think about coffee more then coffee for me but more like place relaxing, chill, and place read great book or great conversation with family. Grouchy without doubt epitomize that feeling for me. Why without doubt deserve five star rating. Just wish the place was closer on my side of town. =(( 

Evil Monkey was not evil but heavenly. Not even sure all the things in it but saw chai that sparks my interest. I was really happy with my choice. They have stamp card program too.

Trying for the first time, got the Grouchy John: white chocolate & Amaretto with almond milk....hubby got apple cider with caramel & cinnamon...got the little one a chocolate pull apart donut.....delicious coffee, for realz!

This place is great! It's on the east side of town so it's a little far for me but worth the drive. I got the A.R.M. (almond roca mocha) last time I was there and it was delicious! It was a little sweet but not overly sweet, just the perfect amount. 

The atmosphere is cool. They have a little nook in the corner that's filled with books. I didn't get a chance to check it out but I will next time I am there. There were plenty of little tables available for studying. I came during finals week so it was busy but not too crowded. I sat at one of the loungers and just relaxed for a while. The chair I sat in was a cute little leather sofa. From what I remember, it was a bit old with some tape on the arms but it was still super cozy! Definitely no complaints on my part.

Also, make sure you check in on yelp and give them your punch card cause they'll give you an extra punch! And a starburst candy :)

We stopped by this local joint to grab some breakfast before heading back to California and upon entering I was totally diggin the artistic and comical space. I can imagine locals chillin here with their laptops or friends playing the various board games over a large cup of joe. But I was here to sample their other menu items. My friend and I split a croissant breakfast sandwich with egg, choice of cheese and bacon and it was awesome. It was Freshly made and devoured in minutes. Yum.

I don't drink coffee but my friend said that the bulletproof coffee was solid. I would definitely come back on a future trip.
Best spiced pumpkin latte in the valley! I'm not sure what they use but it tastes like real pumpkin and not a sugary syrup like other coffee shops.

I tried this place when they had a truck on campus. I liked it, and would try it again, except that now they don't ever open their cart until after I am at my office. I show up to campus at around 7:45 and always see them setting up which is a bummer. A few times they have been open but I had already got coffee because I couldn't count on them to be open. I would appreciate it if their UNLV truck had like "set hours" lol.

Best coffee shop in town, hands down. At a close second is Sambalatte. 

I really love Grouchy John's because their staff really goes the extra mile to take care of customers.  If you're hanging out in the coffee shop, the employees will walk around once in a while to check on everyone, sometimes even giving free coffee refills and providing ice water. You really feel like you're in someone's home when you're at Grouchy John's, especially since there are so many awesome books and board games around to keep you busy if you're looking to spend your day or evening hanging out and sipping coffee with friends.  

This place also has amazing donuts, but you have to get there early enough or they'll run out! 

The coffee is great - my favorites are the Grouchy John's Latte and the Cookie Butter latte. Also, they have a wide variety of cold juices and smoothies if you're not in the mood for caffeine. 

I like to sit here and study, people watch, read, listen to music, or just relax on my day off.  Locally owned coffee shops beat corporate coffee, always!

Growing up my entire life I have always lived by a Starbucks so I never really believed in going to a smaller coffee place especially since I don't even drink coffee! It wasn't until my best friend started going there and making me get her tea did I start wondering about what made this place so special. I took a sip of her South Sea Magic and I instantly fell in love with this place.

Unlike most places where the tea taste is expected with the traditional black or green tea with the 1 flavor note or if you're lucky, maybe a blend of a mint for a little bit of a fresh taste. Grouchy John has a more complex blend. I have no idea where they get their batch from but even their Sencha Tea which is a darker green tea that is popular in Japan tastes amazing. 

Since I live a few blocks away from this location, this is a spot I visit weekly. Great sitting spaces if you want to chill and get some work done. A very unique coffee shop/comic book/library decor. And of course the #1 perk is that the drive thru is open 24/7.

I have had a few mishaps coming here but overall service is great and the teas will make me come back every time.
The atmosphere is great and the coffee is amazing, Christmas in a cup is highly recommended. The only bad thing is that there isn't more of these places around.

I'm so mad at myself for not asking about the butterbeer here! I wanted to try it but missed it on the menu, and ended up getting an iced almond roca mocha when the barista suggested it. 

The almond roca mocha was way too sweet for me, and I think it also has amaretto in it which I am not a huge fan of. All the syrup drowned out the espresso flavor, which was a bummer. I would definitely ask for less syrup in this one. My boyfriend's suicide smoothie (peach, mango, strawberry) was okay but nothing amazing. 

Our barista was pleasant. If I come back again, I'll try either the butterbeer or a more traditional espresso beverage for a better coffee experience.

I love the menu. Christmas in a cup is my holiday treat of choice. I love that they ask if you'd like it made with almond milk they even offer my dog a treat every time she comes with me in the drive through

I've been eyeing Grouchy John's for awhile now just haven't been able to cross the street.  I always play basketball at the park across the street from here. But it's usually hot outside and not feeling coffee.

I love the artwork which is for sale.  I wonder if I can put my art work up too.

I like this place if you CHECK-IN you get an extra star stamp on your drink card if you buy a drink. Sweet only a few more then I get something free I think.  They have board games to play and books to read and seems like a pretty cool environment. They even have free WIFI

The first time I was here I needed to wake up a little and could've used a good coffee drink. Instead I noticed that they make something cool and because it was once again 100+ outside in Vegas during the summer I had to get some cold.  Went with the Strawberry Banana Smoothie with whipped cream on top which was delicious. They were fast at making it. 

The customer service was great and friendly, I enjoyed the environment.

I came back again cause I really needed something to wake me up and it was COLD outside.  WHY CAN"T IT JUST BE 75 DEGREES YEAR ROUND WHHHYYY. NM. LOL.  I'm no expert coffee drinker or orderer but I do drink coffee enough to say Grouchy John's Coffee pretty damn good. Plus you can't go wrong with extra stamp per drink with yelp app check-in.

delicious coffee  i had the iced caramel mocha and it was awesome !!!! I will definitely be coming back .. the environment inside is super cool and fun .. and they even have board games to play while enjoying your coffee !!! Definitely recommending this place to all my fellow coffee lovers !!!!!

Service here is amazing.  Staff always greet with a smile and help with any suggestions or recommendations.  The atmosphere is great for socializing or studying.  Lots of seating and fun art to look at.  Check this place out!!! The drinks are amazing!

We moved here in May and anyone who knows me can tell you the first thing I look for in a new place, whether it's on vacation or in a new home city is the coffee shops. Grouchy Johns is certainly my favorite from what I have tried so far. I generally only drink iced mocha's or iced coffee especially when it's hot out. The mocha is very good, especially with an extra shot to tame the sweetness of the Chocolate they use. I would give an immediate 5 stars if they used Ghirardelli as its by far the best for a mocha but the syrup they use is good enough to satisfy my craving a couple times a week. The pastries are always excellent and I love their bagels. They also have a great variety of drinks with unique names to mix it up. I always try to support the local joints especially after having worked for the "big chain" for a couple years when I was in college.

I love this place. I have strategically gotten my coworkers addicted to Grouchy's, so that I have an excuse to make an afternoon coffee run.

I am not big on hot coffee, so I usually stick to frappes. They feature a signature drink every Monday for half off, which is a really good way to try things. My favorite is the Butter Me Up, but all of them are amazing. I've honestly never had a bad drink.

I have recently been trying to watch my sugar, and if you're in the same boat I highly recommend the Skinny ARM. It's seriously amazing.. it doesn't taste skinny at all. 

Their service is always excellent whether you go in and through the drive-thru. My only complaint - there's not one by my house.

Such a great neighborhood gem! There's nothing better than having your favorite caffeinated drink in a perfect place. Don't know about you but coffee is everything to me so I like to drink mine in peace. The atmosphere in this place is like no other coffee shops and I give credit to the reputable owners who do an amazing job promoting a fun and friendly atmosphere. As for variety just ask their friendly staff for their specialty and you won't be sorry!  Now stop what your doing and head on over and support a local small biz!

This place has become my preferred coffee joint in Henderson.  I do all my business coaching here because it's quaint, quiet and comfortable.  Big selection of coffees and teas, goodies and smoothies. My favorite is the Earl Grey Cream tea and lemon muffin!!!!

I love their Salted Caramel Latte! Their pricing is fantastic too since I get a medium and upgrade with Almond milk for about $5. Try to order something remotely similar, non-dairy at Starbucks and you're looking at a $6-$7 drink. I like Grouchy John's because it's local and I like to support my local Vegas community.
Great vibe, free wifi, good coffee and outstanding customer service. I'll be back next time I'm in town.

Such a fun little coffee shop! I would bet you a nerdy guy owns this place. (I'm pretty sure we'd become best friends, if we ever met. Who doesn't love coffee and star wars?) They have a good variety of coffee and smoothies on their menu. The service was awesome! We had our order within minutes. I got a blended Jedi (which is white chocolate and coconut granita) it was so insanely sweet! I have quite the sweet tooth, but it was almost too much for me to handle. My friend got the O.G. (which was similar to a blended salted caramel mocha) that one was just the right amount of sweet with coffee. Overall, this place had tasty treats, accompanied by great service. I'll definitely be back to try more of their menu the next time I'm in the area!

I've been coming here for a long time and since they've expanded the food at both of their locations has been subpar. Everything is either too bland or icy. Whenever I go to either location I've had my order messed up or I've needed a drink remade because it's bland. I love coming here for the nostalgia but I honestly can't say this is a five star coffee experience anymore.

Not as Grouchy as they want you to think, Grouchy John's has some damn fine coffee with a great atmosphere. As the photos show, the inside is bright and colorful; it's a really nice change from the typically muted look of most coffee shops. There's plenty of pop culture related (mostly sci-fi, but especially Star Wars) art adorning the walls. Again, a nice break from what you see at a lot of coffee shops in Vegas. If you're a nerd like me, you'll probably get an extra kick out of it. They have a TON of books and board games, there's a TV with the news on (it's muted and closed caption). It's not too noisy in here so you can get work done pretty easily if you feel like it, but it's also laid back enough to hang out with some friends, split a tasty pastry and play a game.

I haven't tried any of their more unique drinks yet but I can tell you they make a mean dirty chai latte. I usually get it with almond milk. Their regular coffee is great, and so is the espresso (I guess that's obvious, since it'd be hard to make a mean dirty chai without some equally mean espresso). The presentation of the drinks isn't anything fancy, but I've never given much of a damn what the cup looks like, especially when the coffee is good.

There's also free wi-fi, friendly service... basically, I think it's my current favorite coffee shop and I feel like I should go more frequently.

So this is kind of an interesting spot for me. I came here because I was in desperate need for coffee, but of course, not all coffee is created equal. 

I came here at an odd time, the bagels were amazing. Definitely great to get one to go if you're on your way to the range or somewhere else a little far out where you're not going to find much good food, but the coffee is just so so. You really get that homely atmosphere here and people are very friendly, you can customize pretty much ... all aspects of your breakfast so go nuts!

Conclusion? Not really great for coffee but breakfast is amazing!
Always such great seroat the Wigwam & Maryland location.  Everyone is welcoming & helpful. If not for our mutual friends The Bindues, we may not have learned of this place! Awesome people!!!!!

Definitely my new favorite coffee shop. I'm not a coffee snob by any means, but I do like a foofy drink once in a while. I tried the Mint Mocha frappucino (though I don't know if they call it that) and my wife had the carmel one. Both are excellent, reasonably priced, and if you check in on Yelp you get double stamps. With double stamps it takes about 5 trips to get a free drink - far better than Starbucks.

I'll definitely be back and love the location and how easy it is to get in and out of. A well deserved 5 stars!

Theeeeeeeee Best coffee!! They setup a little truck outside of Tenaya Creek. I hope one day they will have one coming to San Diego. The staff was super nice. I had the iced americano excellent and the nitro coffee was even better, friends had the Grouchy John sooooo super good & I normally just take my coffee black. Thank you staff for making our delicious coffees!!!! everytime I come to Vegas. Worth the drive

Grouchy John's is my absolute favorite coffee shop! The coffee is fantastic and the environment is fascinating. They have Star Wars themed names for their drinks and more. I haven't been there in almost a year because I moved to Texas but I still have yet to find a coffee shop as great as Grouchy John's!
I love this place and their coffee flavors selection BUT  MAN, It took them 30 mins to make my Breakfast Sandwich. Just simple Egg, Sausage, Spinach in a Croissant. Very disappointed.
Definitely better than Starbucks! nice and cozy. The owner was so helpful and kind definitely will be revisiting soon!
Everyone is nice: Star 1. The coffee is hella good: Star 2. Books to read: Star 3. Wifi to use: Star 4. Great for Star Wars/Superhero fans: Star 5.
I love this cafe! The food and drinks are reasonably priced, they taste pretty great, the atmosphere is calm and friendly, and the staff is very nice as well.

First time here today! Ordered the Rushmore based on the counter girl's recommendation and it was wonderful. Really like the nerdy ambiance and all of the art on the walls. It was very busy too. Honestly though I'll probably never came back. Barely sat down to drink my coffee before it was announced the owner of the bar close by was going to start towing cars near and around the building. Parking lot was full so lots of people and myself left. Too many places out there parking isn't an issue.

YUM! Loved the drink, loved the service. Had the pleasure of meeting JJ and having a really good pumpkin latte, hot. They use pumpkin puree for this drink not  flavored syrup (yay). It was the perfect temperature and not too sweet which is great for me because I don't like added sugar or extra calories. This stop was a win for me.

Ordered the OG because, salted caramel is the business the biznaz! For a hot drink, it wasn't hot enough. It felt like the way most coffee shops make hot cocoa for kids. I wanted to take it back for more heat but we already drove away. It was really good flavor wise. Salted caramel flavoring stood out perfectly, however, the drink itself was more on the super sweet side for my liking. Next time, I will ask for less sweet. 

We also ordered a small mango smoothie and my husband liked it. He said especially because it tasted like it was made from real mangoes with real mango chunks. Love the convenience of the drive-thru and we got our drinks pretty fast. Will return!!

On vacation, this was the place I visited most! So good and felt like home, since I live in Washington and am a barista as well. I converted family members to stop going to Starbucks and only go here! Yay! Grouchy John's, thank you for delicious breakfast and great coffee. I'll definitely be back when I visit again!

Nice friendly and quick service! Best coffee in town.
You get what you order, and a smiling face. Not like those chain coffee shops that seem miserable to be there and can't get your order right

Just have to reiterate how great this place is.  I'm there right now.  It has the best espresso, friendliest and most attentive team, and fastest WiFi of any cafe I've tried in the Las Vegas area.   

Most businesses distinguish themselves in just one area, but somehow Grouchy John's manages to be better at everything, all at the same time.

This is by far the best coffee place in Las Vegas and probably one of the only reasons I miss living there. I wish they could relocate to Illinois, because I'd be there every day. The coffee drinks are all amazing, I've never had one that I didn't like. During the "fall" I had them make me an iced pumpkin spice latter with cookie butter in it... Amazing (obviously) and It was WAY better than any over-sweet, syrupy Starbucks drink. Next time i'm in Las Vegas, this will be the first place I stop at!
Nice place, lovely staff and the best coffee in town! I'm in love with their Butter Me Up. 5 Stars!

It's a small shop, as in there isn't much seating inside, though they do have outdoor seating. However, the atmosphere very laid back. You don't feel like you're being judged like the moment you walk into a Starbucks. Plus, the menu is fantastic. I drove all the way from North Summerlin (Lake Mead/Buffalo) just to try a drink called Shirley Temple of Doom based solely on the name alone. It's matcha green tea with maraschino cherries. Totally worth it. I ordered it iced and it barely lasted 5 minutes. I'm definitely going to return and try other drinks.

If you're looking for a quality coffee shop with people who care about the coffee they make and the positive experience they provide, this is the spot!! I've been a customer for 1 1/2 years, and have never left disappointed with the service or quality of my drink! And try the oatmeal...its to die for!!
Love this place, great games and library.  Great local art.  Oh, the drinks are awesome also.....  my favorite is Evil Monkey,

Wish I could take Grouchy John's back to Vancouver with me! We went because of all the great Yelp reviews and were not disappointed. Loved the staff and coffee. I actually work for Starbucks but really am not a fan of the iced coffee, so I like to try out new places if we travel. Next time we're in Vegas I will be back to redeem my punch card! :) 

Thanks for the caffeine high, guys.

When I was in college, I liked to consider myself a coffee house guru given that I had tried just about every single one in town within driving distance; and though Grouchy John's was about 15 minutes from my house- one of the furthest- I kept coming back because it was easily the best. Customer service was always grand and staff was always knowledgeable of their menu and able to make good recommendations. For me, some of the signature drinks like the Grouchy John are unfortunately just too sweet for my palate, but with a very wide variety and a willingness from staff and ownership to please, it is easy to find a beverage that you'll keep coming back to. And if you do not like your drink, whether it was made wrong or you just discovered it's not for you, they will remake it or give you something else to make you happy.

So for me, I recommend the Butter-Me-Up Late which is made with cookie butter but to me tastes like cereal milk if you're into that kind of thing. Also I love the Jedi and for a break from coffee, they make a superb apple cider with caramel and cinnamon add-ins if you like. Pastries, cookies, bagels, etc. are also delicious, but sometimes when they bring in merchandise from other shops in town it can be overpriced- but this makes sense considering the change of hands. That aside, this is one of the only places I know that really does cross-promote other local shops and bakeries in a wonderful way and Grouchy Johns seems to be the most involved in the community with their Thursday night networking (I forget the official name), clothing and toys drives, and more. Also, love the decor and their displays you can buy especially from local artist Tommy Vinci- very cool.

I would easily recommend this place to anyone. I used it primarily as a study ground, alone or with friends. The only thing is it is busy a lot of the time because it is really popular, so if you go there to study either bring headphones or adapt to a "white noise" environment. My only complaint is that I wish it could be open later more often for the night owls among us :) Maybe some day!

I figured since my initial review was in 2012, and I still visit this place on a weekly basis, I could update my 5 stars, to another 5 stars of course. 
Serving you caffeinated happiness in a cup is the same management team of John and JJ, as well as a bomb ass staff of baristas who I just adore.
