I can't imagine anything negative to say about GJ's. Even if you don't like their coffee, they will go out of your way to find something that pleases you. Smoothies, Italian Sodas, even super strong bulletproof coffee. 
They also have pastries and sandwiches. Oh and ART! Lots of cool LOCAL art! Basically, if you have not gone, GO! Thank me later.
Had my first Grouchy Johns Latte with almond milk and have to say I am not disappointed. It's so good. Great coffee, great people, and great atmosphere. Plenty of room. This place is huge!
I love this place, best coffee house in town and they have almond milk!! The Grouchy John Frappe with almond milk is the best.
Delicious cup of joe, excellent customer service. 21st century feel to the establishment. Book galore, awesome paintings and memorabilia. Definitely a great experience!

I LOVE this place! This is the kind of coffee house you see on tv and wouldn't expect to find in Las Vegas. I love all the art on the walls and the nerd theme it has going on, where else can you get a Shirley Temple of doom (drink) while sitting next to an mini AT-AT walker? (No, really) If you haven't been here yet, you definitely need to stop by.

There is a reason why this place has been named Best Coffee Shop and I will give you three reasons why.

1. The location itself is just too cute! Art work everywhere, couches, Wi-Fi, and a large room with board games you can play with friends! How fun!!

2. Their drinks! They have tons of fun drinks to try and as a non coffee drinker, I was impressed by the variety! I ordered the "Shirley temple of doom" which is a matcha Green tea smoothie with blended maraschino cherries and it was delicious! 

3. Their employees! As soon as I walked into the coffee shop I was greeted with a warm hello and then when I was trying to decide what to order they were patient and provided some suggestions which was super helpful!

I really love this place and will most definitely go back!!!

When I was on vacation we came across Grouchy John's when we were hunting yelp for coffee shops. It just happened to be close and not a Starbucks. Which is what I look for when I travel because I prefer to support independent local businesses. We went through the drive thru and I fell in love with the names of the drinks and the clever approach right away. A clever marketing hook doesn't mean good coffee but it can explain the cost of the bill. Well, Grouchy Johns is different.

This coffee is pricy for the right reason.... It is amazing! 

Just go if you haven't been because my words won't do it full justice. I am pretty snobbish when it comes to coffee and I will say- wow. Great beans, full flavor and better than just right. Please- just try this place once and see if you agree.

If your needing a quality coffee drink in Vegas this will be your place.  It's nice, comfy and they pulled a ristretto espresso that was worth drinking.   And...everyone was so friendly for a place called grouch johns.   :)

What a fantastic coffee shop! Not only are they unique and delicious. (I LOVE myself a good, strong coffee. And they do not dissapoint) but their drive thru is 24 hours! 

But your real gems are your employees! Specifically Feaven! I had a 5 hour drive to Utah that I chose to do at about midnight, and Feaven gave me a heavenly experience! I always ask a million questions and she not only answered them but had such positivity and genuinity to her. Long story short she was wonderful and so was the coffee and pastry  (cinnamon roll!!)

Great coffee...and I am a true coffee snob.  I don't often go for the froo froo drinks.  I'm a black coffee or Americano purest and like the taste, aroma and feel of a great cup!  
If you indulge in a bulletproof style fat coffee... you'll find it here.
My daughter and son-in-law say the froo froo drinks rock too!!!
This place pulls shots on an old classic machine.  Not your push button coffee shop prototype.  
Friendly staff and fun decor.  
My favorite in Vegas!!!

I love love Grouchy John's coffee!! I get a mocha cappuccino half sweet. They always make it perfect. Lots of foam, yum!!! Make sure you get a stamp card and have them stamp it every time, so you can get any free coffee you like!

I've been all over the world deployed in US Navy and have had Coffee in at least 12 countries, and none hold a flame to Grouchy John's! My wife and I seriously love this place! Come ready to explore the menu!

WELL DESERVED 5 STARS!

I just moved in from California and my cousin wanted to show me around. She told me about Grouchy Johns and how it all started as a food truck.
*not many drink food trucks around turning into stores so this was interesting.

Walked in and was definitely noticed by the workers and was greeted as i came up to the register. The pretty lady informed me about all the new deals coming up and the top 5 most popular drinks.

I was in a dilemma so she kindly and patiently helped me out.

I ended up pursuing the Nutella Blended.
It tastes heavenly. Just like diabetes. 

Kind guy who made my drink brought it out and walked it to me.
A + ON CUSTOMER SERVICE.

the setting was comics and STAR WARS. love love it. 
the art was amazing and it had seating and comfy couches all around.

Definitely a new spot for me to come to again when i just want to get away from the house or just be around to study or hang out :)

LOVE IT!

My typical drinks:
-Black currant iced tea
-Black Guatemalan coffee
-The Grouchy John blended drink

Grouchy John's is what a coffee shop should be. The coffee & tea is fantastic, amenities are very inviting, and the staff is very friendly. GJ & JJ are community oriented, passionate about the bean, and just overall great guys...why wouldn't you support them?
We came here for my brother's book signing. The coffee was great! They were very accommodating and the staff was friendly. Great place!!
My daughter and I went through the drive thru this morning, service was wonderful and coffee was even better. Wish it was no my side of town but alas it's not.

Was visiting some friends who live nearby and Grouchy John's is walking distance from their place. So I figured, why not give it a try?
Upon walking in, you are greeting by lots of awesome decor around. Mostly Star Wars decor, but also a bunch of other awesome stuff too. They also have a lot of paintings on sale.
Their iced brewed coffee was awesome, and I'd definitely come back again.
Good cold brew. Was in town for work and they're the only place in Henderson I could find with cold brew on the online menu. Super friendly staff, cool art on the walls.  I'll be back next year.
I've developed an obsession with the Jedi.....I love white chocolate and I love coconut.

The espresso and coffee are really good. Everyone seemed to like the other drinks too. They are super nice and the owner stopped by our table later to make sure everyone was happy and see if they needed anything.  They have a lot of seating and it's cool they have board games and books.  It better than Starbucks and i really like to patronize local businesses.

I randomly stumbled onto Grouchy John's Coffee Shop one Vegas trip and it was by far one of the best Vegas trips ever, in part, due to this establishment. And now every time I'm in Vegas, I try and visit The customer service is on point: the baristas are all pleasant, quick, efficient, funny, and full of fun-filled personalities. You know they care about their service when the owners are back their making drinks and serving them, asking you if it's to your liking and offering to remake or alter it if not.The drinks: AMAZING. They have very basic items and very intricate drinks as well with quirky names and delicious flavors intermixed into the meaning of the name (if you put a bit of thought into it). Although I haven't tasted too much of the food, the wraps that I have eaten are also delicious with types ranging from breakfast to lunch, all complemented by a side of chips. If you're a Star Wars fan, look no further because this place is literally brimming with the a force of awesomeness. Overall, the atmosphere is light and positive, inviting and too enticing to resist. Personal favorite: THE SITH. It's a lovely dosage of espresso mixed with dark chocolate and coconut and just the right push you need to wake up in the morning. Don't knock it until you try it and when you try it, keep trying it. There's a reason they received the award for best coffee shop. Go check it out and see why!

The staff is friendly and the service is quick!
I like the flavor options at Grouchy John's, they have flavors like "Butter Beer" & classic flavors as well.  The offer breakfast options as well. The muffins are large enough to share, my boys will usually share a banana nut & a blueberry muffin. The bagels are all delicious.  My only complaint would be they don't have larger sizes, I would love my coffee to last a little longer :)

First of all let me put the disclaimer that I am rating this establishment a solid four stars because I have only been here once.  But, I am a huge fan!  Today was my first time coming here and went inside, instead of the drive through.  What a cute little coffee shop!  There are numerous books/games to play all around this little shop.  There is interesting art work adorning the walls.  Oh, and I love the names of some of the drinks.  Saw one that was called the Honey Boo Boo!  Service was top notch, very friendly, and so quick!  Prices are on par with Starbucks I feel, but don't quote me on that because I hardly go.  I wish this shop was closer because I would frequent it quite often.  I love the little mom and pop type businesses so this place gets two thumbs up from me.  I will update my review when I make it back over here and try the drive thru.

Grouchy John's truly has amazing customer service and the coffee is great too! I am a student at UNLV and almost every morning I stop by their truck to get a pick me up. What I appreciate about Grouchy John's is the quality and taste of their coffee compared to the larger chain coffee shops on campus. The staff takes the time to explain the numerous beverages they offer. In addition, there is a stamp card system which rewards you with free drinks. I recommend their Americano for only $2. I will definitely be returning to their truck next semester, and look forward to visiting their stationary location.

Vegas needs more shops like these instead of starbucks! 

Orange creamsicle ice tea yummmmm!!!

I'm so happy that Grouchy John's finally has it's own store. It's a definite bonus that it's right down the street from my house. I plan on spending many Sunday mornings hanging out with friends and drinking great coffee!

I usually get a morning coffee but the smoothies are excellent. If you're feeling adventurous, just let John create a custom drink for you. Trust me it'll be tasty. You'll also get a chance to name your own drink and get it up on the menu!

Grouchy John's is also very active on Facebook and Twitter so if you have any questions or comments, you know you'll receive a quick response.

As a bonus, if you have an iPhone you can download Square's Card Case app and just pay with your phone!

I'm on a mission to create my own custom drink so be on the lookout for "The Shewchuk"

After a long drive from California, I needed some coffee to keep me up. The pictures of all the cute star wars figurines attracted us. The staff is really nice and as nerdy as the decor implied. They even recognized my Sailor Moon T shirt. The coffee is really good and quite strong. Plus their flavors feel pretty authentic as opposed to the sugary syrups at Starbucks. Left here with a nice coffee buzz.

Today was my first experience at Grouchy John's physical location. The staff is very pleasant and ready to help you make a decision within a moment of getting there. I tried a medium size OG (salted caramel and vanilla) iced coffee. I think it was a bit sweet for my liking, but it was said to be a favorite amongst customers. The staff asked whether I enjoyed it or wanted something else, but I kept my drink cause the sugariness was enough to keep me alert during my stay.

I played a few board games in the back of the shop on some nice round tables. The rest of the customers there were doing some type of personal work on laptops or were in study groups. They cater to a very young crowd of college students. The colors of the venue pop with bright orange. The place is clean, the bathroom could be a bit cleaners, but everything was really pleasant. 

The atmosphere is just right for study groups. The staff checks in on the groups regularly and offers water and refills. I know they care if their guests are happy. I'll let you know, I'm definitely happy. I hope my board game group continues to come here.

Everyone at work brags about this so I had to check it out. They have drive through, which is a huge convenience in the morning. They have an extensive menu with any delicious concoctions. Most are flavored coffees that come hot, iced or frapped. I'm more of a purist when it comes to coffee so the over the top menu didn't really call my attention. I ordered a hot soy vanilla latte. It was good, but a bit sweet. Lacked the coffee flavor for my taste. Overall good experience and will visit again soon.

Such a cool vibe and the staff are sooo nice and informative about their many coffee and smoothy options! :))) Don't know how I haven't been here.. My new coffee place! Tried the almond roca dark chocolate mocha (sugar free and with almond milk). Amazzzzing! Also the Yoda green smoothy.. So good!

Though my husband and I don't live close to grouchy johns we try our best to visit on days off together...we enjoy the atmosphere here, they're very laid back and friendly...JJ always remembers us even though we don't frequent as much as most of their regulars...I love that they offer almond milk as regular milk doesn't always sit well with me and I'm allergic to soy...not only do they have awesome service in the shop I love seeing how they impact the community on Facebook! This coffee shop is definitely community driven and focused!

Great place to relax, study, or do business. The staff is very friendly and the atmosphere is great! The coffee menu in my opinion is a little on the sweet side but overall, they have a great selection. I'm now a regular and the amenities and hospitality are beyond great!
Every time I come in they are always fast and good at getting my food/drink as soon as possible.

Free wifi, great food, good service - it can also get a little cramped but it goes to show a prospering and effective business that has clearly sustained itself with a solid reputation!

From where I live, I need to WANT to go there but I've made the trip a few times specifically to visit grocho =)

I think Grouchy John's just keeps getting better every time I go. Or maybe I just enjoy everything so much. For a while I was stuck on Iced Mocha Lattes but after the trying the Honey Latte, it is my new favorite. I'm so bad too, I usually order a coffee and a smoothie each time I visit. I'm Longing for their special the MPC (Mango, Pineapple, Cherry) to make a re-appearance but the Strawberry Banana is keeping me happy for now. Which is weird cause I don't really like bananas. The last sojourn to where they were camped out on Goldring I brought some of my office with me. I ordered two different iced coffees. The special that day was a Matcha Green Tea and Kiwi smoothie. I sooo wanted to try it but I was not feeling the vibe for green tea that day. My clerk told me it was very light and refreshing. Oh, well maybe next time. They hand out candy with every drink order, as if I really needed any more sugar ...

I really love this place. The coffee is fantastic. I get the Chewbacca blended coffee....i love me some cookie butter! The atmosphere is awesome. I love the decor, there's local art all over, it's cozy and the staff is always so friendly. There's also tons of seating space. The only downside here is its the after school hang out for hs kids....a lot of them don't even have a drink, they're just there. My boss and I used to have meetings here but it eventually got annoying so we found a different, more quiet coffee shop to meet. But otherwise I really like this place....

Surprised at myself for becoming such a regular here and have yet to write a review, but I love love love love LOVE Grouchy John's. All time favorite coffee shop in Las.... anywhere! Everything here is all about the locals and I love it. I never fail to come here before work, after work, sometimes gotta drink a coffee before bed. The interior feels so homey and is super colorful, but most of the time I do go through the drive-thru (which is open 24/7), and later in the night a barista, Randi, always helps me out and is super sweet! She never messes up my order and is super quick and we always have a nice little convo. If you come to vegas, or if you live here, TRY THIS PLACE OUT!

This place is great! They have amazing coffee, specialty drinks, and a great atmosphere! I love everything about this place and will continue and get my morning and afternoon coffee from them again and again! Also the staff was super friendly, even checking on me at my table when I go inside. It makes places like Starbucks seem really cold and uninviting. Definitely go check it out if you can! It's great!!

If they are grouchy, I'm just evil.  Plain evil.

J.J. has to be the coolest barista I've ever run across.  

With so many delicious choices, I keep finding myself staring slack-jawed (and drooling) up at the menu unable to make a decision.  J.J. has saved me every time, making recommendations and promising to swap it out if I'm not in love.   To date, there has been zero swaps.

I love this place.  It's comfy and fun....with fun cookies, fun art, fun forcefield activators by the register, fun games, fun books, and fun drinks.  I have a new favorite coffee shop in Vegas.

Today's A.R.M. was delicious...can't wait for tomorrow.  

Sorry Sunrise.  Sorry Beat.  I've been grouched.
New favorite study spot! Great atmosphere, wonderful employees (JJ is fantastic with drinks and customer service!) and their drinks are perfect every time.

I think Grouchy Johns needs to scrap the bakery goods they have now and go a little more upscale.  The current stuff looks like it was from a grocery store.  They need to get more sophisticated with the baked goods and cold non-coffee drinks.
My favorite coffee spot. Great drinks, friendly staff and yummy pastries. Caffeine and Canvas event are a blast.

I like to visit local coffee shops when I'm out of town and found this little treasure trove during my last visit to Vegas. 

I went with my three sisters, so each of us ordered a different drink. From the four drinks I tasted, you can't go wrong with anything you order from the menu. It really just depends on what you're feeling that day. 

The customer service was great. Everyone was very friendly. They even offered me a stamp card for the next time I'm in town. I declined the offer, but would definitely go back.

As for the atmosphere and environment, its hard to describe... They had artwork for sale, and memorabilia, and games, and book. I went for the coffee, and stayed for everything else they had to offer when you walk in.

Just a couple sips into my cappuccino and I have to say, it's pretty tasty, especially for an area not known for its coffee. They use locally sourced beans roasted in nearby Boulder City and the staff are super friendly and knowledgable about their product. Try them out if you're ever in Vegas. Besides, the name of this place totally rocks it :)

Ok, I know I recently reviewed them but this place just keeps getting better. Today I went by after taking the dogs for a run at the park. I had to add this little factoid of information. They give your dogs a treat. One of my 4 legged friends stuck her head out the window and they gave me a treat for each of the dogs... and yes I got another starburst while waiting. This place deserves all local business, they are absolutely getting the coffee scene right.
Great place to enjoy a cup of java. The owner was so friendly and answered all my questions about the roasting process and where their coffee beans come from. Highly recommend this coffee joint

Great selection and quality! People are very friendly and take their time explaining to you the selection they have. And they have great personalities! Super chill and laid back.  I feel like I'm back in the Haight and Ashbury in SF.
Good Coffee!  Friendly staff!  The Vegan blueberry muffins are delicious!! My first time here and I throughly enjoyed my time here!

They have good items and are very friendly, but I won't be stopping there often anymore. I was at the end of their drive thru line at a complete stand still for 8 minutes before I decided to leave, along with the 3 cars in front of me! Happens way too often unfortunately. They have to lose a lot of business because it isn't efficient at all. Too bad

I was a groupie when it came to their food truck and would run and grab a cup of coffee when I was near their location. I always had a cheerful personality greet me and the coffee was always spot on. So of course I followed them on facebook and was doing my happy wiggle dance once I found out they will have a permanent place to call home. It took me awhile to actually make my way to their location since I live on the far NW part of town and rarely go into their neck of the woods. So one cold rainy day I was doing my errands and I got a wild notion to make that voyage and endulge in some caffeinated happiness. It sucks to look forward to something for so long, drive way out of my way to get that same love I received in the past to be treated like I was a annoyance. It wasn't a busy day at all otherwise I would let it go...no smile, no greeting, just looked right through me like I shouldn't be in here. I asked questions regarding the popcorn for sale...simple question..."what flavor is this one?" He gave a nice glare and told me the flavor is on the bottom of the cups and walked away :-/ ummm it's not very clearly mark I'm sorry to be such a pain in your of so busy day :-/ I moved out of state now so most likely I'll never come back. Hopefully they go back to the warm greetings I was use to before. Hopefully it was just a bad day and I happened to be on the receiving end. Either way my voyage left me kinda bitter that day.

If I could give Grouchy John's more stars, I would. Let me tell you why. 

I have been to GJ's about 5 times. My fianc and I were lucky to stumble across this gem of a local coffee shop on our way home from a weekend Vegas trip. 

The atmosphere is awesome- think your neighborhood coffee shop- laid back, lots of games, comfy seating, and cheerful and unique decor. 

The drink menu is huge- lots of creative drinks ranging from coffee based to tea to smoothies. Everything that I've ordered has been fresh and flavorful, whether it's just a plain black coffee or a house special drink. I personally love to order a plain coffee, a latte of some sorts- try the one with amaretto with soy milk- and the yoda- a green smoothie that is full of fresh fruit and veggies. Yep- three drinks in one order. 

The best part of GJs is the service! We always make a point to stop in on our Vegas trips. The baristas are always extremely friendly, genuine, and ready to help. Drinks are freshly made and complimentary starbursts accompany them. Even though we aren't regulars, John remembers us! 

One weekend we had to make a last minute decision to drive back to Phoenix because we couldn't find a place to stay. We decided to stop by GJs on the way home to get caffeinated for our 4.5 hour drive. We walked in 10 min before closing, the chairs were up and the floors were being mopped. I could tell the kitchen was just about clean and shut down, but John greeted us like we were regulars and invited us to place an order.  On top of that, I had a free drink from my frequent buyer card and he deducted the most expensive drink. He chatted with us while he made our drinks and treated us like old friends. 

All of these interactions and experiences lent me to want to give GJs a high review. I remember wanting to give them a stellar review after my first visit and I am even more impressed that they keep exceeding my expectations! I wish I could go more often!

This neighborhood coffee joint is absolutely fantastic! Not only is the service friendly and attentive (unlike the name suggests, ha) but the coffee is great as well. They have a large variety of coffee concoctions and smoothies. They have pastries and it's all from local pastry businesses. I visit them regularly. They also have special events (like Caffeine N Canvas) that are super fun and affordable! Visit!
Awesome breakfast sandwiches and the chupacabra coffee was the bomb. I loved it. Great local coffe spot. Highly recommend it.

Been there three times, and I've always enjoyed a tasty cup of coffee. They get the temperature right, and yes, I would like a refill, thank you!  

Once took advantage of their board games, but usually just sit in a comfy chair. 

If I lived closer, I'd be there every day!

This place is awesome! It's a refreshing change from the norm for me. I ordered the "Butter me up" which was a delicious cookie butter, honey and vanilla coffee. I liked that they were able to make it light on the sweetener too. I also ordered their cheddar bagel, it was fresh and doughy--more yum.

The only negative for me is that their biggest coffee cup is 16oz. No biggie, I'll order 2! Lol 


The decor is fun! There's dozens of outlets to charge your gadgets. There's board games, books and cool art that's for sale. I liked the seating too, there's high tops, couches and hidden nooks (perfect for antisocial people like myself :-) ) ..ohh and free wifi! What's not to love? 


The staff was upbeat and friendly. They were more than willing to describe their favorites and told me their top selling specialties to help me pick my poison ;-)

I got a club card with extra stamps for the yelp check in too! ---oh I will be back!
Best coffee in Vegas. Great staff. Very inviting atmosphere. What else can you ask for?

Went to Vegas Streats event last weekend a El Cortez and then the week before went to the Filipino Festival and had it there too.  I had the iced latte which was good and the strawberry smoothie.  It was decent. But I am going to try next time one of their specialty coffee drinks or something instead of going the "safe route" with my iced latte..  =P  
With that said. I will be keeping an eye out for this truck and for a cup of coffee. =)

OMG absolutely OUTSTANDING!!! On my way to work decided to stop and get some coffee. OG with low fat milk and no sugar added. Definitely will be back! By the way their protein powder muffins are amazing!
This is my all time favorite coffee shop, their butter me up coffee drink is LIFE. Also, their PBM drink is awesome too. I prefer these to be iced coffee drink.

Not impressed at all. The place was very dirty, unorganized, dust everywhere. The staff wasn't friendly. The coffee is pricey but not good. Ordered an Iced latte with coconut milk couldn't drink. It did not even tasted like a coconut milk. The chocolate banana nut muffin wasn't fresh.

I really enjoy this coffee shop. They offer free wifi and plenty of space to relax or study. The staff is also very attentive and friendly. I took the kids there so I could catch up on some work and since the coffee shop is also a Pokmon stop, the kids were able to stay entertained. They always have some local artwork displayed and they have several books available to read, as well as board games to play with. Their smoothies and fraps are unique and delicious. My favorite is the Yoda. I am definitely a regular customer here.

Coffee served with care.  Grouchy is about an antithetical a name as I could come up with for the owners and staff of this coffe shop (albeit, I have not seen any of them before their morning brew).  John and JJ are fantastically friendly and entertaining, and this family friendly atmosphere that they've created seems like a great fit for the neighborhood.  Don't expect to find the too-cool-for-school brooding hipster barristas that ignore you here.  If you're looking for that vibe, go elsewhere.  But, if you want a great place to chill, play a game (they've got plenty), read a book, snack on some locally made munchies (they support local cooks and bakers), and generally improve your outlook on life, here's your spot.

They take pride in the quality of their product.  No overly burned coffee here!  I find the sweetened drinks (mocha, etc.) generally too sweet, so I order half sweet.  I don't remember the name, but there is a fruity-floral aroma black tea that is some of the best iced tea I've ever had in my life.  Grouchy definitely brightens my day.
I love that they are now at Canyon Ridge church on weekends, they have a great grinds, the coffee is so good, get a jolt of energy.   woot woooooooo

Grouchy John's is your one-stop shop for all things coffee, plus iced, blended, and specialty drinks, smoothies, pastries, wraps and some breakfast items. I just so happened to be in search of a smoothie and this place popped up. How convenient that this eclectic shop was Star Wars themed. They also have plenty of comfortable seating near the front and a quiet back area with a bookshelf filled with comics. 

I ordered the *Yoda* 20oz. smoothie because how could I not? I opted to add honey versus the agave. This was $6.75 and had kale, spinach, pineapple, strawberry and mango. The presence of kale may have sounded questionable, but the smoothie was delicious! The addition of honey may have helped mute the bitterness from the kale. What a neat spot to discover. As a note, I didn't realize it at the time, but they seem to have a Butter Beer Latte on the specialty menu... wish I had noticed that!

Perfect Sunday breakfast. The croissant sandwiches were on point and the espresso was tasty and strong. The people who work here are also quite lovely. I will definitely come back next time I'm in town.

Try the Nitro cold brew!

This is the best coffee shop in town. The employees are amazing, seriously I love them, and the owners are the best people. The combinations they have come up with for smoothies and coffee are unique and delicious, I suggest trying the Grouchy John as a frappe or latte, it's amazing. 

If you want to go inside and spend some time there, they have board games and comfortable couches! Which is fantastically unique, and fun for you and friends. 

Star Wars decor? Amazing.

Remember to tip your baristas! They work hard to make your coffee perfect, which often times isn't the easiest job with the picky coffee drinkers.

After a few visits I must say that I am seriously disappointed with the misrepresentation in the name of this establishment; there are zero grouchy people working here, not even John himself!  Oh my heck, Good-natured John?!? Get it together.

Other than the above gripe, it's a great place to grab a coffee, tea or high-brow double caramel decaf macchiato with precisely three fourths of an ounce of goat milk foam; all while reading Fifty One Shades of Grey (you heard it here first) or stalking your ex on the FaceBook.

If you are into Star Wars, famous works in a paint-by-number fashion or tattoo-esque art, the walls in Grouchy John's will keep you occupied for hours.

Best coffee shop in town! I do not drink coffee often but I wish there was one closer to me on the west side. Every time I am on the east side of town I have to make a stop here. The menu is amazing with my favorite being the original Grouchy John when blended. The staff here is always friendly and we love bringing our pups through the drive thru where they always get a treat as well. Support your local businesses!

Love this place!! They have a good selection of flavored lattes. I haven't tried their hot coffee, but their iced coffee is delish! The employees are almost always super nice and welcoming and they have a stamp card! This is amaze! If you check in, they'll give you 2 stamps (for each drink you purchase!!!!) Seriously.. you could earn a free drink in less than a week! This is my go to coffee house!

Love the Honey Latte....delivered with good, fast service.  Cool vibe inside...  Only thing I don't get is the starburst candy they give with the coffee.... It must have something to do with the whole Star Wars decor...

Delicious food and drink. 
Great selection. 
Friendly, sincere staff.
Cool decor, and chill ambiance. 

Nothing else needs to be said- just go and ENJOY :D.
Best dam coffee in the valley and it's 24 hr drive up service is amazing! The location is well thought out and it's very refreshing to stop in and reload on caffeine! Or catch up with friends!

"Why you so grouchy?" 

This place is great, the coffee is tasty and the workers here are so friendly! During my visit they walked around at one point and asked customers if they needed coffee refills or some water. I've never witnessed this at a coffee shop before. 

I was for only here a couple of hours, but along with my coffee I did order the "Yoda", "Mmmm, healthy you are". This was a very tasty and much needed beverage in this Vegas heat. Spinach, kale, pineapples, and mango; this amalgam may give you the "force" to make it through the rest of your day. 

This place also has a full food menu, many other chilly drinks and according to their website they do host events from time to time. Since I was only here here between meetings, my time was limited. I will be back soon to try some food and possibly the "Lando" smoothie. 

Grouchy? Not even close!

What wonderful service and delicious drinks! Nice decor and you get your stuff fast! Everything is reasonably priced, and the entire place seems a lot more welcoming compared to most coffee shops. Be sure to get here early though because the lines stretch out, especially on the weekends. One of the new baristas (very nice hair) makes such good lattes I would date him if I liked boys! This is the only place that deserves a good tip from my wallet!
First time here and I wasn't disappointed. There coffee was great and so was their oatmeal! A place to come back to.

FUN!  with Great Service!  :)
Their caffeinated happiness options are many and not the usual "run of the mill" combinations.
You can totally get adventurous with your coffee here... or you can just grab a cup of Joe at their self serve station and hit the road in the matter of minutes.
Their coffee is top notch... not bitter and has great flavor.
I totally suggest following them on Facebook since they post daily and have in-store events frequently.  Plus it's super entertaining to see what is going on, who is doing what and what the specials are going on or what's coming up.
They also have a mobile truck that goes to various locations and events around  town.... so you might see them out and about.
SUPER nice folks here.
And they love Star Wars... so they are tops in my book even if they didn't have great coffee. :)
Love this place! Really great coffee and staff.

Coffee's great, environment is nice and comfortable, but the bathrooms are YUCKO!!! I've been coming for a while because I enjoy the coffee and quaint atmosphere, but just went into the bathrooms today and they were nasty I understand we don't like to clean bathrooms, but that is a MUST in a public place.

After checking out two coffee shops, that were closed, right before landing to this one, i was finally gratefully to end up here. 

Coffee. I ordered the latte and shortly, the honey latte.  Both were fantastic!! i could really taste the coffee and the sweetness of the honey was definitely complementing the coffee and not overpowering it.

Addition. I ordered a nutella banana muffin, which was delicious! it was not heavy, but it was essentially a muffin with nutella frosting...nice combo.

Service. The two baristas were very helpful and generous with their  information. also, the place does have wi-fi, which helped me kill time for about an hr.  The cashier also lent me a pen when i asked for one. There were charging outlets and surge protectors everywhere, it was definitely conducive for using electronic devices.

One of the best coffee shops in the LV, if not the best! A small boutique, with lots of character and local love.  Barsita's are very friendly and a great representation of the company overall.  I highly recommend stopping by and grabbing a cup... relax on the patio... read a book, play a board game... listen to the awesome tunes... it's well worth it!

This is a very cozy shop. A nice surprise to be honest. They have lattes, hot tea, smoothies, oatmeal, bagels, and much more. The pastries didn't look that great , but the coffee was decent. I've ordered the oatmeal with almonds/honey/cinnamon twice. The cafe has a deal (2 for 1) if you're  with the  Las Vegas Runners group. The colorful room in the back is very comfortable and has enough chairs and tables to accommodate 30-40 people. The restrooms are in the back and there is a side door to exit. This cafe is a short walk from the Desert Bloom Park.
I love Grouchy John's! Their coffees are delicious and creative and service is always outstanding.
Better than average coffee. Unique flavors and tasty. Like many food trucks, a friendly staff and good customer service. Not epic, but definitely better than average if you happen to be around them.

Im a Starbucks fan but i tried this place today for a change. I love the pastries, coffee and staff. They have more variety "uncommon" coffee which i'll try one at a time. It is interesting. Ill definitely come back here.

I really love this place. The staff is really nice and have great customer service. Need to expand their locations. I'm a big coffee lover. My favorite is the Jedi with almond milk. Keep it up with the great coffee.

This place is super chill and great coffee...I love their Americanos but the Nitro is awesome too.   Comfy chairs and great place to work or just hang out! Its definitely my go to for coffee plus you can't beat the staff!!

I went in expecting good things, and left less than impressed. 
The seating area was very pleasant, with numerous couches and chairs. Choice of music was fantastic! Not very often you hear Modest Mouse while drinking coffee.
However, the coffee was not as impressive as the environment. I ordered a cappuccino, and my friend ordered an iced coffee. The cappuccino was incredibly hot! The milk was noticeably scalded, over-textured, and poured quite sloppily. When the coffee had finally cooled enough to taste, it was fairly standard, though it had a very strange, almost salty aftertaste to it.
The iced coffee was okay. It was not very strong-tasting, however.
I love that they brew Colorado River Coffee Roaster beans, but technique really needs to be elevated to capture my business from quality coffee shops like Sunrise or Samba Latte (which also uses CRCR beans, and effectively so). Grouchy John is allowed to be grouchy if he still puts enthusiasm into his coffee prep. Otherwise, it doesn't work.

This little coffee shop is a locals dream. It's not a chain. It has character. It has great coffee. They are original and their menu is vast. They display local artist work. Be sure to get your stamp card - buy 10 get one free. They have been known to double stamp at times !!! With each coffee you can expect a starburst and a smile. I love the OG with almond milk - hot or iced. Mmmmmm. 

I highly recommend repeatedly visiting this cute little shop. You won't be disappointed.

There's free WiFi here and a drive through, plenty of seating and outlets and a quiet atmosphere that's perfect for studying.

Lots of star wars decor and even drinks on the menu are cleverly named. I was greeted right away and the cashier (I think Robert) explained everything to me and told me to take my time. 

+1 for having unsweetened almond milk ($0.40 extra) because not a lot of places use unsweetened. 

They can make any of their specialty drinks iced, hot, or blended. Hot comes in 12 or 16 oz and I THINK iced and blended comes in 12,16 or 20. Extra shots of espresso are $1 each. I also like that they have smoothies as well for $6.85.

Drinks here are on the sweeter side.... like super super sweet. I got the honey booboo which has hazelnut and honey in it, with 4 instead of 5 pumps of hazelnut and I couldn't drink more than 4 sips without taking it back and asking for an added shot.  The drink was good, but too sweet for my liking. Robert ended up making it half sweet for me which was nice of him. He even offered to make any drink on the menu for me but I said I liked what I ordered and just wanted it half sweet. While the new drink wasn't amazing.... (I'd probably order less honey and 3 pumps hazelnut next time for some flavor), I appreciate the fact that he was so nice about remaking my drink.

There seems to be a lot of regulars here and the cashiers remember their drinks! Love how friendly everyone is and how it's not a crazy hectic atmosphere. 

If you like your drink on the sweeter side, this place is perfect for you. If you don't, just request is less or half sweet and adjust your drinks to your liking.

Great as always, always coming up with new drink ideas!! I love the expanded room.  Staff is always friendly & remember their customers (even if it's been months).  
I still drive past other coffee places so I can get my Grouchy Johns!!

Tiny spot. Reminds me of a comic book shop. Great little dig. Nice window. Friendly staff always reminded a little a little of the big bang series comic shop/powe rangers juice bar. But without the comics haha.

Good coffee. Lots of seating in the adjacent room. Very quiet. Like a library or reading room, none of that starbucks music blasting your ears. Baked goods are fresh, not a large selection, but the basics are all there. Plenty of parking.
Good coffee and friendly staff. JJ always remembers me even if I haven't been by for a few months. Glad they expanded into next door - makes for great meeting place!

This place blow Starbucks and other chain coffee shops out of the water. 

First it's the staff. It's a small group of baristas that are amongst the friendliest and nicest you will encounter in any type of customer service role. They remember their regulars and always have a happy demeanor, even if the shop is insanely busy. Oh! They make great coffee too.

The menu has all the typical coffee shop norms. I especially like some of their more creative flavor combinations like "The Sith" which is mocha and peppermint, or the "PBJ" which includes REAL peanut butter along with banana flavorings. They also have some food options including healthy wraps, and the normal pastry selection that is to be expected.

Decor is nice and inviting. This place is huge in the Vegas tech scene. You'll often find developers working hard on their Mac's, while some film guys discuss their latest project they're working on. They have a ton of books and games that you can grab up and enjoy, as well as a tv playing something geeky on the AppleTV. Plenty of comfy seating.

If you're looking for good coffee, great service, and a cool place to hang out that ISN'T regurgitated Starbucks, this is your place.

P.S. I've met the Grouchy John, and he's FAR from grouchy!

Today i got the honey boo boo. I am a sucker for hazelnut with my coffee. I got it blended per the baristas recommendation. I liked it for flavor but it overlaps the coffee. If you are looking for that taste of joe in the morning i dont recommend getting an ice blend. It's a cute spot with lots of artistic flare and that homey book reading feel. It's a great place to study with plenty of seating and nooks. The staff was all very nice and accommodating, they were all very lively for 8 in the morning. I enjoyed my visit.
Great customer service, a welcoming environment. They have a great selection of beverages, I absolutely love this place.

By far, the best coffee shop in Las Vegas...
 We just moved into the area, and normally we would go to Sunrise, but Grouchy Johns has THE best COFFEE! The service is efficient and friendly. I swear I go their like 4 times a week. The breakfast bagel sandwich is the best!!
 I love the non pretentious, non vegan vibe at this joint :)

Me and the significant other we're having the munchies for smoothies one night then decided to go to Grouchy John's. We previously visited in the past for coffee and promised to be back for the smoothies. The Ackbar is my paborite one, but only from night shift crew member because visited during the day and my smoothie wasn't as awesome from night shift Ackbar. And also I wish there was a bigger size for the smoothies!

Me and my hubby we're looking for a place to eat bagel and coffee for the drive home... we seen on yelp they had Einstein bagels which all had to stars and were like na.. so we going grouchy John's a decided to drive out of our way to try it. It was so worth it. I got Carmel macchiato & jalapeo cheese bagel.. simple but so good! My hubby got same bagel as breakfast sandwich with egg avocado cheddar cheese sausage and tomato.. I took a bite and it was oooo sooo good.. they offered me a stamp card when we paid and my hubby was like why did you that? I'm like because if they good we coming back they were beyond good & very quaint spot everyone was so friendly which I love.. only one thing I noticed if you check in you get extra stamp. I seen it after when writing this review. So long story short of your contemplating coming here don't trust me when I say do yourself a favor and give this place a try. It better than your chain competitors!
Place is super cool- Love the Vibe - lots of Fast Pace employees make the difference ! Grouchy must only be John cause this place I feel is the Anti-grouch lol

Thanks to Yelp, I found a coffee shop that serves Almond Milk! I really liked my Vanilla Almond Milk Latte. Will be coming back when I have more time to peruse the bookshelves filled with sci-fi and again, try not be tempted to run out the door with all the cool Star Wars toys they have as dcor.

I like the vibe of this place and the staff is friendly. Only thing is, I love strong hot coffee. I admit I am an addict. 
I hit Grouchy Johns and I asked for the boldest roast they have. I was told the French roast is really strong. I love French roast coffee and ordered a large to go.
I get in my car only to discover the coffee was really weak and barely warm. When I got back to the office I had to zap it in the microwave.

Too bad, I wanted to like the coffee here, its right next to my office. I just keep going to Starbucks.

Where do I start? Really cute nerdy decor all around the coffee shop. I really liked my coffee I ordered. They have lots of space to sit. The people that work there are super nice. I'd definitely go back.

Yo, this is the spot. Bulletproof, done right! I'd be here all the time if I lived anywhere nearby. We drove 20 minutes from the strip to come here and it was totally worth it. We're leaving tomorrow and we're going to come back, even though it's out of our way. Love.

My husband took me to Grouchy Johns for the first time yesterday and oh my goodness was the aroma amazing!! Brandy, now in my book Employee of the year, suggested what the two of us might like and we are now officially hooked!  Go see Brandy and spoil yourself! I will never go to Starbucks again!

Got the OG, it was awesome! Service was great, cashier was really helpful & nice! Quick & the interior of this place is nice and calm, perfect place for paper work, homework, etc + GREAT coffee! Highly recommend

As a newbie to Grouchy John's I had the Almond Roca Mocha Frappe (blended).
It was delicious!!!  As a long time Starbucks customer, I am now a convert to Grouchy John's!!!

grouchy Johns is the bomb dot com. Started going here a month ago now we go at least once a week. They have every drink you could concoct and aren't stingy with the punch cards! For every time you go in, you get TWO punches. I said TWO PUNCHES! If you have a dog they also give them a treat and if you're REALLY lucky they will give you a starburst. So far I've only been lucky once with that. PS you have to try the Honey Boo Boo, no pet pigs come with that.
Great coffee and treats! Great atmosphere! They even have painting classes. Love the books and games to play. One of my favorite coffee shops!

I had high hopes for this establishment, especially since there were so many good reviews on yelp. So here goes my review:

Food: didn't get to try the food. When it comes to coffee shops, I strictly stick with coffee. On this particular day it was pretty warm out so I wanted a cold drink. I was super excited that this place offered almond milk so of course I had to go with it. Their menu is short and to the point. I ended up ordering a flavored latte with almond milk. Unfortunately my drink ended up being so sweet I couldn't even drink half of it. The taste of the coffee didn't really compliment it either. Wasn't too impressed with the drink in the end. 

Ambiance: LOVED the decor of this place. There's so much lounge seating, cool and modern art, and even books and games to entertain yourself with! Also, there's a television but it was turned off when we were there. I'm really digging the Star Wars vibe going on here.

Service: service was alright, nothing really memorable. The guy at the register neither ignored us or helped us. Since it was our first visit there he could've been more attentive. 

Tips: My rating went mostly towards the shop itself. It seems like a cool place to hang out and chill with friends. I'm not a big fan of their drinks and I think I'd rather go elsewhere to enjoy a cup of coffee.

Wow waked into this place and was instantly taken back to my childhood through all the cool little Star Wars toys sprinkled throughout the shop. The coffee here is excellent (yummy caramel macchiato) and the pastries are served warm. Definitely a place I'll be coming to frequently!

One of the best coffee shops that I've ever been to, by far. Why? Its not just the product (which is pretty good) with Grouchy John's many coffee blends, pastries and other snacks. Its not just in the amount of space it has (front area can hold around 30 people, while the back room area can hold double that). And of course, its not just about its proximity from the Las Vegas Strip (5-7 minutes, depends how fast you are driving). 

For me, Grouchy John's is all about the spirit of its employees and patrons. This coffee shop is like one living, breathing organism that takes after its owner- one enthusiastic, professional yet sassy & pissed off mofo that wants to show you who's your daddy when it comes down to exceptional coffee & good quality customer service. And even if you don't even drink a coffee, you'll feel a pretty good vibe here that will make you want to stay here a while and spend a few dollars more. This is such a place!

Seeing Grouchy John himself (usually wearing a Brooklyn hat with a small scowl on his face) can be slightly intimidating at first, yet when you see how he takes care of his customers, you'll get an impression that he truly cares about you in addition to the brand. I tried a recommended iced coffee blend that was so strong that I took the first sip at 9 AM in the morning in Vegas, and the last sip at 9 PM in Denver, CO after driving all day completely amped up from the amount of caffeine. And all for a few bucks. Now if that's not good coffee, I don't know what it is!

Grouchy John's is now one of my go-to places when in Vegas. Come get some!

Stopped in for a lrg hot Sith and my daughter had a med Iced Mint Mocha.. Ahhh perfect compliment to a lovely All Hallows Eve! Our first time there but wont be the last. My daughter is in love with the art by locals artists ... her being a young artist daydreams of seeing her art on coffee house walls and in museums one day. Awesome shop kudos for the AWESOME (and Superior) alternative to starbucks
The girls behind the bar were awesome and very friendly!!! We will be back!

This place has a nice vibe to it. You are surrounded by awesome colorful pictures everywhere. The shop has 2 rooms so if you don't want to sit near the counter you can go into the other room. It is a good place to study or a good place to chill with friends. They do have board games if you want to play with friends. Along with their coffee their smoothies are really good too!

It's hard to fine a unique coffee shop when Starbucks dominates the world coffee industry, but Grouchy Johns is the exception. In the drive thru they give you candy as you wait, while on the inside is a hip little coffee joint.  Location within is a library of good books and local art and excellent music. If you want a break from the "status quo" then check this place out. The staff is amazing and treat every guest like family. 
They offer a large variety of excellently crafted coffee beverages with a large options of mixers (almond milk,soy etc...). You get your coffee exactly they way you like it!  If out like coffee and are near grouchy johns check it out. You won't be disappointed.

This place has amazing customer service. One time going through the drive thru I was given the wrong coffee. I took a sip before I realized it was wrong, still tasted good (and I had a kid in the car) so I didn't go back to complain. ONE MONTH LATER - I went inside to order and the first thing the cashier says to me is "I'm so sorry I messed up your order!" I could not believe she remembered! She made my drink for free that day to make up for the mix up before. It's not like I'm going to stop coming to this coffee shop because of one wrong order! They have amazing iced coffee!

If you want to be like the cool kids, definitely make a stop at Grouchy John's. I felt immensely cooler just by stepping inside and seeing their decor and patrons. This definitely reminds me of a coffee shop I would come across when I lived in Downtown NYC. Funky music comes out of the speakers and eclectic art hangs on the walls that you can actually buy if you're interested in picking up some artwork with your coffee. 

As for their menu-they've got a wide range of flavors and concoctions that I'm sure will satisfy your tastebuds. My best friend did get something with Nutella and her only complaint was that it was a little too thick. I really appreciated that they had almond milk as an option because not all places will offer that. 

I definitely enjoyed the ambiance and could see myself just hanging there getting some work done, sipping on some coffee.

This coffee shop is right up my alley, they have SO many different flavored coffee choices. You can order any of them either hot or cold. They even have some different flavor combinations I haven't seen at any other coffee shops. 
I only stopped here once on my last day in Vegas..I really wish I woulda stopped more. If you're staying on the Strip they are a little out of the way of the Strip but totally worth driving to. Better than any coffee place you'll find on the strip.

I go here more often now because of a class that I'm taking recently. Learned that they are exhibiting art for the local artists of vegas. Nice! A coffee place with a sense of purpose aligned with the community. They have books free for the customers too read. Oh hey serve good food and coffee too  iced coffee one free refill

With a name like Grouchy John's, you'd think the service would be a bit grouchy as well, right? Completely wrong. John is amazing and knows what good customer service is. After a quick lunch at Slidin' Thru HQ, we decided to get some half-priced off drinks (with Slidin' Thru receipt) at Grouchy John's. 

John was helpful in answering any questions I had. "What ingredients go in the smoothies?" "How sweet are the smoothies?" "Is the Chai Tea Latte less sweet?" I decided to get the Iced Chai Tea Latte (with non-fat milk) on the impression that it wasn't too sweet. With the receipt, our Iced Chai and Iced Coffee came out to $3.25. Talk about a great deal! 

John handed us our drinks, along with two complimentary gummy candies. Who knew that small candies could make me so happy? I handed John $3.50 in hopes he would consider the $0.25 as a tip, but he returned the quarter back, saying we paid a quarter too much. That's an honest man!

As for the drinks? The Iced Coffee was nice and refreshing. The Iced Chai needed more spice and less sugar. Other than that, it was a refreshing drink to have on a hot summer day. If you see this truck around, make sure to stop on by!

First timers! Always meant to stop in but only got the chance to do so today. The guy who took our order was super helpful to us newbies...not only did he give us time to look at their drink cheat list, he also gave us his recommendations and the popular concoctions too. 

I has the Butter Me Up Frappe which was like a honey and graham cracker goodness in a cup. My brother got the Nutella, which was good as well...drunk on chocolate. 

The ambiance was super fresh too with Star Wars deco, board games and misc art that is dope enough to buy for your own place.

Definitely coming back!

This place is the best. Such a friendly staff and great experience through both the drive-thru and in store. With a cute little local feel. Also the coffee is fantastic every time. They give out loyalty stamp cards as well as starburst out to every customer. Love this place.

This place is walking distance from my house and even if it wasn't, this place would be worth the drive. The people are especially friendly and the shop in general is just a cool, casual place to hang out. My only small word of warning is that they seem to make the sweet drinks very sweet. Far sweeter than Starbucks. So I would recommend you order your drink half-sweet.

Funky cool place with a broad coffee and drink menu to satisfy coffee lovers and haters alike.  Really friendly staff plus pastries and other snacks would make this place dangerous for insulin levels if I lived close.  No doubt they can easily satisfy a sweet tooth   

The cappuccino foam wasn't artisan smooth but the shot was solid with a taste that blended with the milk pretty well.  

Space for cranking on email for work or arguing with friends over the merits of George Lucas's edits to Star Wars.   The StarWars and other SciFi stuff kicks up the fun character of the place even more.

As a bundle this is a solid 4 stars if you come in and get the experience.
I love Grouchy John's. Their service is great. Their bagel sandwiches and lattes are the best in town.

I came here on a trip from my home state (Beautiful Arizona) and now.. I don't like to be pretentious but this cold brew was HOGWASH! 0 flavor notes. It took me a cool 30 minutes to power halfway through this thing. Best coffee in Vegas really got me good, I'm calling Nev Schulman from the hit MTV show "Catfish" because that's what happened here. I came to meet a beautiful man of a drink and left with a 4'11 receding hair lined hobbit of a "man". Yours truly, Terry! :/
Ok coffee, nice cakes but poor selection. Too much comic sans font but a good at-at walker.

beautiful go-to tea spot for me so close to home! usually go through the drive thru for a quick south sea magic tea. one of the best black teas i've ever had and service is usually always friendly. my boyfriend loves most of the menu and i love the service quality and tea! definitely recommend going to this particular location for quality and service. sometimes when they are busy, i notice the service is not as detailed.. but, for the most part, they get the order right with a smile and give us a handful of starbursts with pickup! most coffee branches like starbucks have become a little lackluster for us because the big business mentality makes employees stop caring for service quality standards. but, good job grouchy johns!

I love this place is great it makes you feel like you are in a different part of a city .. Plus the coffee is so so good I love they have boarded games and a great staff love love this place I'm a Starbucks person for years and I only go her now drive 20 min to get there coffee
Love the atmosphere. Wi-fi, board games in back room, books, and cozy chairs to hang out.

Perfect little coffee shop.
As a Seattleite on vacation, this subbed in nicely.
Geek themed decor!

Finally found a small Coffee Joint that I love!!!! Since moving To Vegas from California, it's been hard finding a coffee place that I like. I drove past there and figured I should try it since it has a Convenient drive thru. I Got the Grouchy John Ice coffee!!! Delicious!!! My New Go to when I want some coffee...and to top it off they are so friendly.

Best place to get coffee by far !!! Beats Starbucks that's for sure !! If you haven't tried Grouchy Johns yet, try them today !!! You won't be disappointed, and I can guarantee you will switch your coffee place to Grouchy Johns after your first experience there !!

Officially my favorite coffee shop in Vegas. They have a wide range of delicious iced and hot coffee, and special half price coffee every Monday. The walls in the shop are decorated will cool art that's for sale, and there are couches and tables to sit/work at. The staff is also super friendly and knowledgable about the different coffee. Just don't go there around 2:30pm because the place is packed with middle school kids! Lol

This place has really great coffee. I love the Mint Mocha Frappe! Its really minty and chocolatey and they use great coffee! The espresso cupcake I had was really yummy! 

I am excited for more. I originally met the two owners when they were on their trailer. They still have their coffee trailer and will still take it out for events. It's parked out front, outside of their coffee shop. There are so many people in here, you can tell they have their fans. I am definitely one of them and will be back again and again!

It's nice to have a good cup of coffee without having to go to  "S" word.  We really enjoyed our specialty coffee.

We didn't have time to sit down and enjoy the atmosphere, maybe next time.

A coffee shop who actually has Almond Milk! The vibe at this spot is awesome. Not loud like a starbucks. If your looking for laid back place to work or just hangout I would highly recommend this place. I will be a regular customer her for sure.

My favorite coffee of all time! The staff is awesome, the place is quirky and comfortable and the coffee is insanely good! They have so many drinks to choose from and they are all equally good hot, cold or blended! My favorites are the Blended Dora, the grouchy John, the butter me up and the peanut butter mocha, however I've never had one I didn't like.

Finally a coffee house that can compete with the big corporate chains. This south side location seems a bit isolated but it's actually with 5 mins of the Strip, the freeway, and other restaurants, bars and shops. What's great too is the park across the street. You can walk there! Woah... Is this Vegas?

The coffee drinks are creative and tasty. I first discovered Grouchy John through their coffee truck at a special event downtown. But their brick and mortar is way cooler. There's actually books and games for people to sit, play, read and socialize. 

I'll be a regular here for sure! The sugar cookies from Tuff Cookie are very cute. Any little girl- and at least one big girl (me)- will love these.

Grouchy johns is that place and JJ is that dude. There is a few coffee shops I frequent in town and this is one of the best. The customer service is A1 and the same goes for the coffee and JJ, who is one of the owners, is present 99% of the time and will remember you and your name no matter how long it's been since the last time you walked in. I love this local spot.

I actually come here for the ambience.  It really has a Berkeley type vibe, which is important for me because I just moved here from the Bay Area. The staff is always pleasant, and the selection of drinks are hard to choose from because they all sound appealing.  I always bring friends from out of town here to sit and chat. 
I  love how this is a very big cafe with room in the back if you want more isolation. Grouchy John is definitely my go to cafe when I'm in the Las Vegas area.
Coffee isn't bad, but not as good as I hoped. I haven't tried to hang there and work, but will next time soon...

My favorite Coffee shop and the owner is so nice I've ran into a couple times around town. My go to is the grouchy Job  frappe with almond milk. This drink makes me happy. I love the atmosphere in this shop and the stamp cards are great too. So good to see a local business flourishing!

Thank you, Grouchy John, for making this world a better place.

Hidden away in a quiet neighborhood on Maryland off of Windmill, I would have zoomed past this gem without giving it a second thought if it weren't for my buddies' raving reviews. I like the fact that Grouchy John's has a drive-thru for those that are in a hurry. 

Small, quaint and homey is what I felt when walking in. There's a lot of books and board games so there's stuff to do if a cup o' joe won't cut it. Personally, I walked in with a mind set of getting some work done. And that, I did. 

They have your typical coffee drinks. And then they have their specialty drinks. I ordered the ARM (Almond Roca Mocha) with soy milk. YUM! They don't do the whole latte art thing here, just some good java in a simple paper cup. 

I was there for about an hour and a half and about halfway through my stay, a barista came around to check up on all of us and asked if we wanted a cup of water. Little things like that really make the difference between a regular coffee spot and an awesome one. 

I always have some work to do and you can bet your dollar that I'll be back here to do so!

The coffee is great the atmosphere is very Star Wars and these people really care about their clientele. John is not so much grouchy as he is not that talkative. If you like Star Wars, are a fan of comics and coffee, then check this place out.

A coffee shop experience. The staff is genuine & they bring the drink to you. Lots of comfy seating, free wifi, books, games, art, and football on occasion. Great place to relax or get some work done.

Great location. Cute, small and unique sitting area. This place is a great hangout.
But when you need to get in/out quick they have a drive-thru also. I love this adorable family friendly place. I wish they had more locations.

Grouchy John's is my favorite coffee shop in Henderson or Las Vegas. The staff is really friendly, the service is speedy, and my coffee is consistently good. The drive through moves pretty quickly, they offer a stamp card, and there are smoothies and vegan milk options.

Found this spot looking for a local coffee shop! Love the art and the environment, great coffee, and I loved the service. 

While we were standing in line wondering what options to get (so many options!), one guy asked if we had visited before. This opened up a conversation to introduce us to our options and how to order.

Great spot to chill and be inspired!

I was meeting a friend at this location's parking lot just to pick something up from her. I hate making people wait so we're usually very early. This gave us time to go in and get a little something to eat and drink. Everything was delicious.

The ambiance I have to say was the best part. We love how vibrantly decorated the place is. There is so much art, some are on sale too. They have a wide selection of board games that a group of people can sit and play for a while. they also have this really awesome indoor mural against the largest wall in the back room. We even asked a bunch of teenagers if they would mind letting my daughters sit in front of the mural so they can take a picture (the oldest is new to Instagram).

First time getting coffee at Grouchy John's and won't be the last. Thanks fellow Yelpers!So much nicer than the chain coffee shops. We used the drive thru which by the way the sign says "drive thru open 24/7" which I am so happy to see.  We ordered iced coffee and  hot caramel vanilla machiatto. Both delicious and made right. The employees are super friendly. They saw our dog in the back seat and offered him a treat...nice touch!
Excellent shop in the community. Coffee and delicious drinks served by people who care...what more could you want?

I went to Grouchy Johns on a blind date. The date was a little awkward, but the coffee and the shop were on point. It is a small little place, but it is booming and able to compete with the Starbucks machine. 

Drinks - The coffee is always fresh and strong. I am a boring person and like my coffee black, but I have been pleased with their iced and hot versions. They have a large selection of frappes, but I have never ordered one. They look delicious though. 

Ambiance - It is more of hang out then just a coffee shop. They have board games, books, and newspapers. You could spend a day in there! The staff is friendly and quick (as long as the line isn't too long). The outdoor patio is nice. It is shaded, so on the hot days, you won't be frying like an egg.

Randomly stopped by the trailer at Vegas Street Eats and found their service and coffee charmingly delicious.  Based on their recommendation, I tried the Salted Caramel Latte.  Lovely first impression.. so glad they are located on my side of town - I've integrated their stop into my before work routine.  

Yep, that delicious.

Rare are the moments in life when I can walk into an establishment and just feel like "yeah, this place gets me."  Oh Grouchy John's, I couldn't have created a better shop myself.  

A pearl in the desert, this shop offers a place where people who are both athletic and nerdy (an odd combination, I know) can feel at home.  The menu boasts different healthy juices, smoothies, and coffees for those looking to get their java buzz on.  The walls are covered with paintings of Daleks, Storm Troopers, and other Sci-Fi stuff that I'm pretty sure is created by local artists.   
  
I always order the Yoda because STAR WARS and also because this chilly, green blend manages to make kale delicious.  How do they do it?  I think the secret ingredient is The Force.  Yes.  That must be it.

This is an extremely fun menu with tasty and very customizable options. The staff wants you to have a great caffeinating experience (and their Instagram is really fun to follow!). 

There are two rooms where you can set up shop for your meeting or workspace; while both are decorated with pop art, they're different enough. They also have a nice patio area that's dog friendly (and a great place to watch sunsets). I'm a happy member of #grouchynation.

This is my first time here! Very nice and comfy place! Super service! Books and games and a large back room
To play cards games! Excellent place for families or to hang out with your friends!
I loved my OG! yummy! Will definitely come back and bring my friends! Love the Walking Dead pics!
Best coffee shop I've ever been to. Consistently remembering my name and order really makes me want to go out of my way just to say hello. Great interior, would live here if I could!
This is a fabulous coffee house! The baked goods were delicious and their variety is almost endless for drinks. Even non coffee drinkers will find plenty to drink there

Yup, this wins at coffee.

Once upon a time I was trying to get home and couldn't because there was traffic. So I decided to take an alternate route. As I was driving, I see the store coupled with "Drive Thru" and thought that I might as well give it a go. The interesting thing here is that on Mondays, they pick out a random specialty drink off their menu and make it half off. On this particular monday, they chose the "Grouchy John Latte" which comes with white chocolate and amaretto. Initially I was hesitant because I had never tried or heard of amaretto at that point but I decided why not. And well, what could I say, it was love at first sip! I pretty much drank the entire thing (I couldn't sleep that night, but it was worth it!). And ever since that day I've been going and trying out their stuff. The drive thru can get a little busy so I recommend you also check out their interior, which is nicely decorated and full of Star Wars themed stuff! Another thing they do: they give out stamp cards so if you purchase 10 drinks, you get number 11 for free.
Great stop when you're on the go! Piping hot coffee and good thrifty service as oppose to a global competitor a few blocks further away!

Great place, people and coffee! I love the stamp card (double stamp with foursquare check in & starburst) allows you to try new drinks and finding something else to love about this place! So addicted.

If you follow them on fb, you'll see a post every Monday of which drink is 50% off that day! Great way to try something a little more adventurous than just the usual.

FYI They no longer sell GROUCHY JOHN COOKIES.  The baker that used to make them moved away. :(

When I lived in the 89123 area, I was here every day. They know how to make a good cup of coffee, and if you're not happy they're willing to make it right. I'm so excited about their second location near my downtown home. 

Originally the shop was half of the size it is now, but they bought the space next door and expanded! It's the best place to study and close to UNLV if you're itching to leave campus. 

They change their flavors with the seasons and I'm a fan of their Christmas/holiday flavors. The only complaint is that when I do opt for a hot drink, most of the time it comes out too hot and burns the integrity of the milk (yes there is such a thing). I can't complain because it seems like Sambalatte is the only coffee shop in town who has gotten the milk temperature right, but I digress. On hot summer days which is 80% of the year here in Vegas, I get an iced O.G 1/2 sweetened with almond milk! So delicious and it wakes me up instantly. Happy to be a part of the Grouchy John Nation!

The overall place has a great vibe. Took my dad to grab some coffee and since he was a veteran they took care of his drink. They even took the time to ask how our visit was when we made our way out. If I could give this place more than 5 stars I would. Ps. There matcha shake was great!

I tried Grouchy John's coffee shop for the first time yesterday and I have to say that I was very impressed! I ordered the Butter Me up and it was nothing short of amazing:) I really wish these guys would open a location on the NW side near Aliante because I would get a different drink every day and I'm sure that they would also get a lot of business from other military families!
Friendly geeky atmospher friendly service and personal want to make your stuff correctly even if they mess ip amd redo makes this place quality and service at a 10 star level.

I have been living in Vegas for almost 10 years now and this is my first time at Grouchy coffee. My first impression is this place super hipster, a little bit busy, some weird arts on the wall, and a good place to study. The coffee is average.

I've heard about Grouchy John's for years and use to always see their mobile truck at events but never tried it until today

I'm halfway through my coffee and I love it!

I ordered a hot Grouchy Jonhs and it's delicious. 
It's got subtle hints of both white chocolate and amaretto that surprisingly don't make the drink too sweet.

I usually like my coffe black so I'm actually excited to try that next time haha

Today was my first time visiting, was on my way to work so I used the drive thru, which is awesome in itself for a small local coffee shop. Will definitely be back soon!
I LOVE THIS PLACE! it's got such a cool vibe and the staff is super super friendly. coffee is always amazing too! i think i found my new favorite place!

4 stars because the coffee is good, but not great.  I went twice and found the drive thru service was much better then the in store service.  In store service was slow, even on a slow day and the guy at the register had to ask multiple times for the same drink a hot americano.  I gave it a 4 star because on the long drive home I stop in the drive thru and had excellent service.  I got the hot coffee and it was much better then the americano.
Awesome place for coffee and to relax.  Very cozy and lots of outlets for all your needs.  The coffee is best I've had in Vegas.
Tried coffee a couple of times and I didn't think it was as good as everyone says. Too much flavor and not enough coffee.

This place is unbelievably amazing. Let me start by mentioning that I am not a coffee person, but my boyfriend ordered the Twinkie coffee, I tried it and loved it. I ordered the Italian coconut soda with whipped cream and it was absolutely delicious. The people there are AWESOME and the atmosphere is on point.

Super super duper friendly cafe!

Had bookmarked this place before my trip to Vegas and was glad I did!

When I used to live in Vegas years ago, I always felt there was an absolute lack of coffee shops. 

This time around, there is a actually a variety of shops open in the area.  

When we walked in, it was empty. The staff (and I believe one of the owners) immediately greeted us with a warm smile and a cheery "Good Morning.". These may be simple things to do but I have been to many a shop where this is not the norm!

I had already made up my mind that I wanted one the grouchy cookies but the owner pointed out that they also have a variety of doughnut's (SCORE!) from KD's doughnuts (a place I had also bookmarked).

He recommended the blueberry doughnut which I also I got. My lil bro went with a chocolate glazed doughnut. I chose the Grouchy latte which was white chocolate and almond syrup. 

The blueberry doughnut was an amazing surprise!  It was moist and delicious and went perfectly with my drink. My brother enjoyed his doughnut and polished it off before I even noticed. 

Not only do they have quality products here and friendly staff but they also do some other awesome stuff.  They had an area dedicated do donated items for kids in need of back to school supplies. And let me tell you, it was packed full of items. How awesome is that???

They also have a book/library program. The owner saw me eyeing the books and explained that I was welcome to take it and bring it back whenever I was done. He also said that I can do a book swap where in I could bring books from home and take some books I wanted. I almost wanted to cry because I DON'T LIVE HERE!

Grouchy John's-good on ya!
Near our daughter's neighborhood. If it was an easy walk, I'd be there way too often. Enjoyed a steaming, soy latte.

Everything I have tried in this place has been insanely delicious!from drinks to muffins to breakfast sandwiches, everything tastes like heaven! Plus it is a cool place to hang out with friends, relax, study, or play boardgames! And mondays they always have one of their drinks half off, which is a plus! And also every day after 5pm every drink is half off!!get caffeinated friends!
LOVE IT. So good. Runnnnn away from Starbucks people for crying out loud and run TO Grouchy Johns!!!

Absolutely love this place. Best drinks. Best menu and make sure to see Randi! Shes the best barista! Always so sweet and hard working  favorite drinks of choice are Twinkie and Jedi! The best everrrr

I absolutely love this place, the staff is so nice and friendly and the coffee is delish not to mention the food is amazing.
