The drive through always runs fairly fast even when your sitting in a line at 7 am in the morning not like the other main stream coffee shops where you wonder how many hours will you have to wait for a cup of coffee. The coffee shop is so cute and inviting as well, the couches and chairs are so comfortable which is extremely inviting to pull out a game from their wonderful selection, read book, or study for school.

Grouchy John's is perfect in every way. First and foremost their coffee can't be beat. It is amazing. The BEST coffee I have ever tasted. Second, they had little things that I really enjoy like Truvia and almond milk. That really should be enough, but GJ's keeps giving. Their parking lot is easy to get into and out of. I love the coffee shop, the feel, the view of the city. I enjoy my mornings there and when they're open late, I'll stop in just for fun. I've brought colleagues, family, and have had business meetings there. I enjoy the artwork on the walls and finally, but definitely not least of all, I enjoy the chit-chat I have with JJ and the rest of the folks at Grouchy Johns. Now, have I mentioned that before stopping in here, I really didn't get or enjoy the whole coffee shop experience. That all changed with my visit to Grouchy John's. The place is great. Try it out.

This place is really great and the staff is very friendly and welcoming ! First time coming here and I was extremely pleased.. tbh I'm mad at myself that I passed this place a billion times to and from home and never came to check it out before now. I will be returning often :) thank you grouchy johns for your amazing drinks and awesome customer service
Hands down the best coffee around! Jay and his staff are some of the nicest people you will ever meet. Try the Evil Monkey!!

Best coffee house in town! I love that they offer almond milk. All of the staff are super friendly and nice. They are always teeing to help me find the perfect drink. 

I also love all the retro books and the new expansion looks great. If you check in to social media they'll give you an extra stamp towards a few drink. 

This place is definitely worth a try.

I feel like the outcast here since I'm not a huge fan. I have been a few times. Tried an iced tea (yum), a latte (so so), chai (little flavor), pumpkin muffin (delish) and an apple cider (so overly sweet I threw it out). The service is great, despite the Grouchy name. They do offer wifi, have a stash of books and games, and a comfy seating area. I have such mixed feeling about this place since my drinks haven't been consistant. Seems like I usually love what I go here and order, but from other places that are always on the mark. I haven't ordered anything here that I wasn't sure I would like, but their drinks are really hit or miss for me. Might give it another go round since it is right outside of my neighborhood.

Interesting ambience with old games, comics, Marvel posters. Plenty of seats - great for studying or working. Coffee was good but nothing special. Not many food items to pick from but muffin we got was good.

This is another one of the elite coffee shops in town. Between them, Sambalatte, Sunrise Coffee, and The Beat-- you really don't have to rely on Starbucks or Coffee Bean for good coffee and a great study environment.

The custom coffees are well crafted concoctions. I went with the Grouchy John, which contained banana syrup, almaretto, and was made with almond milk. My girlfriend had one of their other delicious concoctions-- this place can do no wrong.

The place is fairly spacious and is an excellent place to study or just unwind. Of course, the free wiFi will also encourage you to make a trip. And you'll probably see Grouchy John himself behind the counter helping to make your drinks and asking you how things are going. 

If you are one of those coffee foodies or if you just want a nice, mom and pop owned place to study, this is where you need to be.

So I made my way back over to this place today and my experience was really good.... light years better than my last experience. Service was fast and the girl working the drive thru was really nice!!! Yay! The carmel mocha latte still fantastic!!! Yippie
Amazing coffee, awesome atmosphere and very friendly staff! My favorite is the Butter Me Up or the Albino Monkey. Support local business and stay caffeinated!

What a little treasure! The coffee was wonderful and I always appreciate a great iced coffee! Thank you for having almond milk too. I ordered an iced decaf almond milk, you guys do it right.

I love that you have two sitting rooms, and the front one is eclectic and fun. The tables are very close together so if you are going to tell a juicy story you may want to wait. Room two was larger. Both rooms were filled with people and they were all plugged in, it is great they have outlets to keep everyone charged with coffee and electronics. There is a little part of me that would like to unplug everyone and interact with people but that seems to be everywhere.

There is outside seating and I saw a filled water bowl for the four legged friends!

There's nothing like starting your day off with a hot, delicious beverage from a mobile coffee truck that doesn't deliver side a grouchiness with your order. 

I started my Monday morning off by ordering a Caffe Latte for myself and a regular coffee for a co-worker, whom I excitedly dragged with me to the truck. I ordered my Caffe Latte without any sweeteners or other flavorings, and I enjoyed the little jolts with each sip I took and all the frothiness that settled around the inside of my cup (mmm!).  My co-worker said the coffee wasn't bad, but hands down did he prefer Grouchy's over the brew in our office. 

After confessing to the cool guys who were manning the truck that I've been waiting for their arrival ever since the previous week (sound stalker enough?), and that I've never tried Grouchy John's Coffee, they gave me two stamp cards and stamped one card full with happy face stamps! 

Aside from the fantastic service, the caffeine buzzes, and stamp cards(!), I must note that I also enjoyed seeing a small Darth Vader figurine by the tip jar (the truck's "guardian" as I was told), as well as a few items on their menu with titles inspired by characters from Star Wars -- this created a stir of excitement among some of the predominantly IT employees who were present, including myself. I'll have to stalk the truck again to try those Star Wars titled beverages next time and write an update on this review. 

Grouchy John's easily receives 5-Stars from me.  Now, go forth and try Grouchy John's Coffee! May The Froth Be With You!
OMG My Fav New Place!!!! Butter Me Up is my new fave!!!! Cookie spread in my coffee??? YES Please! Everyone is SO nice here too!!!

The entire crew at Grouchy John's is amazing. They make you feel so welcome and appreciated. The service is top notch. The decor inside is awesome. Their drinks are so original and delicious!!! They have everything you can think of. I highly recommend this place to everyone.

This is my new favorite coffee shop! Wonderful staff and such a cool atmosphere inside. Being from the east coast, I love boutique type coffee shops like this and they are certainly hard to find in Las Vegas.
This place is amazing, cheaper then Starbucks more variety of coffee to choose from. I always get the "Jedi" Frappe.

At first I gave them 4/5, but I realize that they're really my favorite coffee spot in town. They're always so kind, welcoming, and on it with my favorite drink. My favorite is the Chewbaca! Trader Joe's cookie butter + dark chocolate is my go to! 

Part of the reason why I'm giving them 5/5, is because during finals week, I took a timed test online, and didn't realize that I would be going over their hours of operation. However, they didn't kick me out, or anything! They let me finish my exam, and were really nice about it too! I really appreciate companies/employees who empathize. 

Some of my other fave things: the pastries (ask if they can heat it up, if you prefer it that way), and the breakfast sandwiches! SO GOOD! I love the croissant breakfast sandwich with sausage or bacon!

After having become a regular here (and not just because i live close) i felt compelled to update my review. What puts this place over the top is the service. Few examples:

You brought your dog? Here's some biscuits. 

You want to sit outside? Go ahead, we'll bring everything out to you. 

You forgot money? No problem, just get us back next time. 

You want to know about our bean supplier? No problem, let's talk. I can put you in contact with them too if you want more information. 

These are just a few of the ways that grouchy's is outstanding. 

Oh, did i mention the coffee is excellent and cheap? This place is as good as it gets (as yelp's '5 star' definition demands).
Great atmosphere and coffee. The service is amazing. I love the new room. J J and his staff make you feel right at home. My favorite drink is Rushmore. Tyler is awesome.

This is the best coffee I've ever had!!! Only problem with them is you will start hating other coffee places! The staff is so nice, gives you starbursts and always stamps my coffee card! I've gotten like 10 free coffees with the stamp card :)

Killing time before a late flight out of Vegas, I found this spot @grouchyjohns on Yelp! and made the trek to far south Vegas to visit. Glad I did. Very unique spot. Extremely well staffed even during a slow time on a Saturday afternoon. Very friendly service. Free wifi and ample seating. Very comfortable place to hang out. They also have munchies from donuts to smoothies. The "theme" is Star Wars and other geeky stuff. Lots of books on the shelves to read if you forgot your own. The coffee was good, but not craft quality. Still, glad I found this place to hang out on a Saturday afternoon.
Simply amazing coffee shop. The atmosphere, coffee, breakfast sandwiches are to die for! This is a hidden gem! Absolutely amazing, stop by to try it

Came here because a friend recommended it to me. She said the original grouchy johns which has amaretto was great. We got it and it was delicious. Although I tried it a few weeks later with soy milk and it was even better! The place is cute inside and student friendly for those who want a quiet but sociable place to study or do work. Prices are the same as Starbucks. I like it.

I've found myself on the east side of town more often than I would like recently thanks to my kid's after school activities. Luckily, the original location of Grouchy John's is close by. I'm a fan of the Star Wars motif and love all the local art that adorns the walls.

Their blended drinks are great, but I don't want to know how much sugar is in them. The Jedi (white chocolate, coconut) and Chewbacca (Trader Joe's cookie butter and dark chocolate sauce) ones have been my favorite so far. For less sweet options the bulletproof coffee (fresh-brewed coffee blended with MCT oil and grass-fed organic ghee) or the nitro cold brew are great options.

The place has stuff for non-coffee drinkers, too. My kid loves their strawberry smoothie and the suicide smoothie (strawberry, mango, peach) is my go-to order when I want something non-caffeinated. 

If you need something to eat they've got a case full of bagels, muffins and pastries. Most are decent, if not spectacular.

Wifi is available as are board games and books to fill your entertainment needs.

I finally made it over to Grouchy John"s. It's a shame that they don't have locations around town, but they do have a truck that pops up different places. The truck can usually be found on Sundays in the church parking lot at Lone Mountain and Jones. The stamp card they give you works at the location on Maryland Pkwy as well the truck wherever it should roam. I will make a point to stop at this location when I am on this side of town from now on, but most likely I'd visit the truck on Sundays since it's closer to where I live. 

There isn't a grouchy vibe inside, it's a happy one! This is a place that is kid friendly and they have a variety of board games and stuff to do while you enjoy your drink. I was even given some Starburst to snack on while I waited for my order and this happened inside as well the time ordered in the drive-thru, cute! 

On the menu I saw several tasty looking drinks. I've had both hot and iced drinks and really enjoyed them. The "Grouchy John" is white chocolate and amaretto. I would suggest trying that your first time or you could go funky with the "Curious George" that's banana and honey. They have a little something for everyone here flavor-wise and prices range from about $2 -5 each drink though some of the all natural smoothies and a couple other drinks are a smidge more. Sizes are 12, 16 and 20 oz. 

 They also have smoothies, muffins, donuts, bagels and oatmeal on the menu. I was told by the girl who helped me that the donuts were brought in from Carl's. I know Carl's has a following, but I personally find those donuts to be overpriced and just average tasting. These are the same brand donuts that you find in most 7-11 and other convenient stores and markets around town since Carl's Donuts has deals with several places to sell their donuts. It would be nice if they got them from a mom and pop place since we do have a few really good donuts places, but it is what it is. I'll gladly stick to the coffee!

A friend of mine recommended this place, since you come in you can smells the the delicious of the coffee. 
The concept is super nice with books and wonderful art and and entertainment for kids.
Staff amazing if you are in a hurry it has drive true.

So ok... I have never actually set foot inside the coffee shop. Why give it 4 stars? Because the coffee and service that I experienced just at the drive thru warrants that rating.

I first tried Grouchy John's at a food truck festival at Silverton and liked it then. I tried it again about a week ago when I had an appointment at that side of town and just happened to drive past the coffee shop. I had to go again because it was calling my name.

The service I received at the drive thru was amazing. They were super friendly. And they gave me some Starburst while I waited for my drink! 

I will definitely have to come in sometime instead of their drive thru... I know it will bump up this review to five stars.

What can I say...Yelpers are right!  This is such an awesome coffee shop.  The shop is cozy and quaint, with a mixture of board games, star wars items, and local artist's artwork.  The guys at GJ are so friendly and helpful.  I enjoyed coming to this coffee shop.

On to the coffee, they are DELICIOUS!  You can order the drink hot, iced, or blended.  I had the Grouchy John hot and blended on two different occasions and they both are yummy.  I love the amaretto flavor in this cup of goodness.  I must say though that the hot tasted sweeter than the blended.  Either version, they were still yummy in my tummy with the right amount of caffeine and sugar kick.  I have also had the Almond Roca latte blended and it was very balanced.  Not too sweet...just right.  We also picked up the best cheese danish I have ever tasted, which is baked by Bread n Butter.  Oh boy, even someone on a Paleo diet must cheat once in a while to taste this melt in your mouth cheese danish with a crispy flaky tart shell.  Oh so good..

I also love the concept of dropping $2 in the bucket, fill up a cup with hot coffee, and leave.  I noticed this on the first morning I visited this coffee shop.  

Additionally, the stamp card is a plus and when you check into GJ, you get DOUBLE stamps for each drink, which is a super duper yelpy plus :)

I can confidently say Adios Starbucks...Hello Grouchy John!

Went to Grouchy John's the past two mornings. I do not normally stray from black coffee, espresso or a standard latte (which I had Friday morning) but decided to have an OG with an extra shot on Saturday. It was sweet, vanilla goodness!!! The coffee is excellent, the staff friendly and the atmosphere fun.

My husband and I went to Vegas for a weekend trip and decided to Yelp some coffee shops.  We ended up passing by this place, so we made a U-turn and walked in.  Love this cute coffee shop!  They have shelves and shelves filled with books you can read or borrow and bring back.  The coffee is unique (they have special mixes) and the owner is very down to earth and friendly.  He gave us some tips for breakfast and I must say, they turned out to be excellent suggestions.  =)  Grouchy John's also has tons of board games and free wifi with couches to lounge around.  We came back a second time over the weekend and used the yelp coupon.  The guy behind the counter gave us 2 stamp cards fully stamped for our next visit to Vegas/Henderson!  I love that it's not crowded and you can stop by in the middle of your day to hang out and read a book or play a board game and talk to the workers.

I confess, I'm addicted.  As a coffee shop enthusiast, I absolutely approve of this place on flavor, atmosphere, and service.  They have tons of creative specialty drinks, but even regular coffee with milk is enjoyable.  Local artwork fills up the walls and gives off a rad vibe that just gets you staring at all the pieces.  My most favorite part about Grouchy John's is the type of crowd it brings in.  There's a wide range of people that I've noticed coming in mid day during my lunch breaks; from elementary school kids to work professionals, to newspaper reading elders, and everything in between.

PS.  They have a drive-thru!  There aren't many non-commercial coffee joints in Vegas, but I sure am glad this one exists.

I love love live checking out unique coffee shops all over the country. This may be my absolute favorite. They remember your name after just once or twice. 
There are games, books free wifi, the artwork is local, outstanding, and colorful. 
The staff is the friendly of old Vegas!! 
In fact this place reminds me of Vegas in the old days when everyone knew everyone and even liked them!! 
The coffees are genuine article!  They get the orders right!  
This place Has a Mello yet vibrant atmosphere, always come back!!

I love how passionate they are about their customers! The drinks are always tasty and pastries always look so delicious! They have great artwork on every wall, so if you're staring off into space... You literally might be! 
I've been to the class they have one a month with the local artist who does some of the artwork inside Grouchy John's and it was great! 
Did I mention John isn't so grouchy? Lol!

But, the best part of all is that they acknowledge my dog Malice every time we peek through the drive thru! Thank you!

An update for everyone. I love this place! I am so crazy on the quality of coffee especially simce I love black coffee. Unlike the Starbucks chain, the coffee is always fresh and never burnt. I brought my boyfriend and his parent from CA here. They loved it. The customer service makes the experience more amazing. They offered to make us a fresh batch which was awesome to know they value the quality of their products. Grab it to go or hang out and play one of their board games thet have.
Best customer service and healthy natural options...  I stopped using starbucks and when in Henderson love to stop for a great cup of coffee :)

The best little coffee shop in Las Vegas! 

Ever feel like you're just another dollar sign at Starbucks? Stop throwing your money away and support this small business by having the best local brew they can make you! Not only do they make you feel welcome, you can tell you are by the friendly smiles and environment, cool wall art you can buy (they support local artists and have Coffee & Canvas nights you can sign up for) board games and books you are more than welcome to use and a tasty funky named drink menu. 

I love their almond cookie tea and almond milk lattes. Yes, that's right they have almond milk! They also sell Manbakes and Bobs Red Mill oatmeal along with other pastries, fruit and sandwiches. 

I love that this place and you will too!
Red Velvet Bagel!  What can I say.

Love the staff love the coffee! 

May I recommend a 16 oz iced red eye with OG flavor (1/2 sweet!) more coffee, with just the right amount of sweet. Mmmm. 

Enjoy coffee lovers!

I LOVE this drive-thru! Their selection is varied-smoothies, coffees, coffee specialty drinks to die for...everything tastes amazing. The staff is friendly and the line moves quickly. By far my favorite coffee spot. Try the dirty chai or the Butter Me Up. Delicious!

The husband and I love it here! The coffee is fantastic and if you like something fancy and fun, the chewpacabra is tasty, spicy, and great! This is a great place to sit and read a book or get some work done. They have several used books to choose from and it also has cool artwork all over the walls that you could buy.

Finally made it out to Grouchy John's brick and mortar location.

This has got to be one of the coolest looking  coffee shops simply  because they got Star Wars stuff inside!
Perusing the menu, they even got items named after Star Wars  characters. Can you say SUH-WEET!?!?

It was pretty packed when we got  there, but  after searching high and low,  we got a little table right below the  AT-AT. Continuing the Star Wars theme,
I ordered a Jedi which was pretty good, but flavor wise seemed to be missing something. Service was great though...Oh, and the artwork on the walls and expansion through the hallway were cool too!

I'll probably give Grouchy John's another shot if I'm in the area, but I'm not in a hurry to return though. ALOHA!!!

Shaka Meter : \uuu/  \uuu/  \uuu/  \uuu. 3.75

I really like this place because it's built for people using laptops. Lots of plugs (even outside!) and small tables for people working. The coffee is pretty good and there are things to do if you just want to hang out with friends (like games). The only thing I wish they had is more food options. It's mostly just pastries.
Really good custom coffee and or blended drinks with nice employees and quick reliable service

Thank the coffee lords for Grouchy John's. These guys always seems to be conveniently located at Vegas events or 0.1 mile away from my house on Fridays. GJ coffee is always tasty or potent enough where I can enjoy the nourishment of the beans, not just water, some sweetener, and blackness. I would say prices are fairly reasonable for getting coffee that has care and... love lol. My favorite is the signature Grouchy John's Frappe which is white chocolate and amaretto flavoring, now if I could only convince them to give me real amaretto :). 

Other notes:

- The guys are nice, friendly, and probably care about their job a whole lot more than your barista at Starbucks. 

- Drinks come out fairly quick and efficiently, don't think I've ever waited more than 5 minutes for a drink. 

- You can text order drinks ahead of time at (702) 608 - 5195

- You only need 5 stamps for their stamp card!

- Sometimes they do contest on twitter (@Grouchyjohns) for free drinks. Even I won once. 

Creepy note:

I had a dream weeks ago that Grouchy John landed into heart of UNLV and grew its roots into the core of UNLV's soil making it a permanent resident nullifying the need for Starbucks, Coffee Bean, and Einstein's... sadly it probably won't happen. Thus I will have to continue chasing Grouchy's around when I want some tasty coffee.

When traveling, we are always on the lookout for local coffee shops that are not Starbucks. 

Things I like about Grouchy John's: Love the name, love the fact that they're not a corporate chain. The employees are friendly and appear to enjoy their job.

What I didn't like was the coffee that we ordered and the lack of seating. My babygirl's soy latte was piping HOT! Almost as hot as my Americano. The flavor wasn't bad, although temperature control would be a useful lesson around here. My Americano on the other hand was good and well made. I would order that again in a heartbeat. 

As for the seating, there was a good amount, but they were busy. Can't blame a place for being popular. There are a few outside tables but who wants to drink coffee in the desert heat?

The interior appears to be a redecorated Starbucks. With lots of reading material on the shelves, it has that local coffee shop flair. They have a drive-thru window which furthers the former S'bux impression.

I applaud them for not being just another chain, however their drink menu is pretty much similar with a host of sugary frapps and just barely considered coffee drinks. No V3gan pastries on display either. So it's basically the same thing to me. The reason Starbucks is successful is consistency. I can get a tall soy latte from any ol' S'bux and it'll taste pretty much similar no matter where I am. 

If I were local to Vegas, I would consider visiting here more often. Perhaps it would grow on me. Then again, Sunrise Coffee is vastly superior in ever facet, so I doubt even the frequent buyer punch card offered here would lure me back for more.

I was enjoying salted caramel latte with blueberry muffin a lot on my first visit. Salted caramel latte tasted very creamy but a bit of too sweet to me. I would enjoy it more if I had it with some salty sandwich. Blueberry muffin tasted very delicious. Everyone here seemed very friendly and nice. Deco is kinda cute. They also carry pastries from Bread & Butter and KD Donuts & Kolaches.  And, they offer free Wifi !! Overall, I liked this new coffee shop spot a lot =)

Love this coffeehouse! The quality of the coffee served here is definitely high! It's very smooth. They have a tremendous variety of coffee drinks. So far I like the Grouchy John the best! 
Great place to hang out, check your email, or meet up with friends. 
I'm hooked on this place and I'll be choosing this over Starbucks when I'm in Las Vegas.

LOVE THIS PLACE.

situations where Grouchy John's might save your life (from an average Vegas local and/or tourist girl perspective):

"why did we get back from the club so late last night? and somehow I gotta force myself to be energized for round 2 tonight?! i already paid for a $60 ticket to see kaskade but wanna nap so badly..what do i do?!"
``````SOLUTION: GROUCHY JOHN'S

"dang it, just binge watched all of Orange is the New Black and totez forgot my philosophy paper is due tomorrow..."
``````SOLUTION: GROUCHY JOHN'S

"FUUU my mom wants me mop the floors but im food coma'd from AYCE SUSHI?!"
``````SOLUTION: GROUCHY JOHN'S

"HOW AM I GONNA SURVIVE EDC WEEKEND?"
``````SOLUTION: GROUCHY JOHN'S. lots of grouchy john's.

"one of my false eyelashes fell off - i KNEW i shouldn't have used the glue from the $1 store! Wait, we gotta be at the club ASAP before guest list closes!! But i look too ratchet to go INSIDE!"
``````SOLUTION: GROUCHY JOHN'S DRIVE THRU (yes you read that correctly they have DRIVE THRU)

"Starbucks is BORING"
``````SOLUTION: GROUCHY JOHN'S

Prepare your body for the plethora of flavors they offer (horchata/almond roca/banana/just to name a few...). Trust me, you will be perplexed by their offerings.

My recent favorite: THE CHUPACABRA! Try it if you like chocolate with a pinch of spiciness!

Workers are nice, board games inside are abundant, free wifi...what can i say? This place is a nice unpretentious cafe that could be anyone's cup of tea.

...or, ya know....coffee.

I love being part of the #GrouchyNation! 

My love for these guys started back in probably 2013, when I caught their food truck at First Friday's every month. To be able to develop a relationship with a couple of guys at a coffee truck is super rare, but these guys take pride in getting to know there regulars. 

From there, I would travel far and wide from the southwest side of town to Grouchy John's for a delicious drink and friendly service. I got my entire FAMILY hooked. 

But what's not to like?! Incredible staff, DELICIOUS drinks like their Butter-Me-Up (made with cookie butter), and a comfy chair to enjoy it all. Plus, they are so supportive of artists, so you'll always be surrounded by cool stuff there.  

Just, do yourself a favor and pick up some of their "Caffeinated Happiness" today.

Why yes, I will take a gallon of Grouchy John's coffee back to San Diego, thank you very much! This stuff is good, real good. My fave is the hot Grouchy John which features white chocolate and amaretto, two of my favorite things on earth! One of my beloved drinks is an amaretto sour so the more amaretto, the better. Be warned, their drinks are rather sweet so request reduced sweetness if you can't roll with that. They also have these super cute stickers with their logo which they will give to you upon request. I got a handful and I'll be giving them out and spreading the Grouchy John love. The drive-thru is super speedy and their menu is quite varied. Their menu is Star Wars inspired with drinks named the Jedi, Sith, Yoda, and Lando. Being a total Star Wars nerd, this is a winning selling point for me.

A little bit disappointed. Never once met a grouch at Grouchy John's;)

Seriously though, had lived a block away from this place for about 2 years and never came here even once until a few months ago. Always drove by and figured it was just another boring coffee shop.

It is everything but "just another" or "boring."
I fell in love with this place, now I stop by for a caffeinated treat as often as possible. 

I don't want to spoil it for you, so that's all I am going to say. If you live nearby, or pass it on your commute, stop in and see for yourself.

Strongly recommend going inside, at least for your first visit. Check out the interior, but more importantly study the menu and find your happy drink :)

it's a very nice place, especially if you are in the grouchy mood ;) Very friendly staff. I only wish they would offer a coffee mug, instead of going for default option of to-go cup. At the same time, it could be that people in Las Vegas are not too "green"...
I like the atmosphere here... Lots of art and books. The menu can bet a little overwhelming! They have a lot to choose from. Love that their breakfast sandwiches are made to order!

Love this place!  It's my go-to for studying and getting stuff done.

The baristas are helpful and generally friendly, and the owner/manager dude is awesome sauce.  

I really like the vibe here.  Comfy couches and chairs, artwork on the walls, and very little coffeehouse snobbery.  The customers are mostly regulars, and it just feels right.

If you live near here, definitely hit up Grouchy John's.  You'll like it.

grouchy johns is my go-to place for a mid-day pick me up!!! not only bc its super close to the house tho, they are always super friendly and my coffee is consistently perfect each and every time!! my last couple visits ive been helped by an awesome kid named max... just thought id give him a shout-out!! keep doin what ur doin grouchy john!!!

Love John and JJ. They and their staff are always so friendly. HAPPY to see a food (coffee) truck turn into a full blown shop. ALWAYS amazing to see local small businesses succeed and move forward in this City.

The shop is so fun. Lots of art work and games to have customers stay and enjoy more than just their coffee and/or tea. Great that they, also, have a drive thru and right in a neighboorhood that I frequent.

They can make anything iced (iced almond cookie tea sweetened with beet root OMG), their wifi is super fast, their service is friendly, kind and patient, and there's plenty of sitting room spread over 2 large living room type spaces. They even give you Starburst candy when you buy a drink! Drive through + free refills + they will remake your drink for ANY reason = Grouchy's is everything BUT grouchy ;)

This used to be Saxby's and I was utterly disappointed when I found out that it was replaced by Grouchy John's.  I've got say however, that Grouchy John really delivers so I'm not at a total loss after all.  This is one of my favorite local coffee houses!  Very comfortable atmosphere and really delicious brews.  Their staff is also super friendly; customer service is always on point!

LOVE Grouchy John's. I wish it was closer to home! Their OG is my go to drink.

I had never been inside until recently, always drove through the drive through. GO INSIDE! Their shop is really cute, and you can see all the food they offer. 

The staff is also very friendly. I started following them on FB and it is pretty cool how involved the whole store is with the community.

Love this place!!! They have an amazing atmosphere and awesome art work all over the building. The staff is always friendly and personable even when I go at 1:30 am. Great staff great coffee open 24 hours what more can you ask for?

Love this place. Love when I go here and they bring your food and drinks out to you! Nobody does that at a coffee shop. And although the guy didn't remember my order. He made a real effort to try to remember and that's something I like. 
I'd recommend you check them out!!

Get your Bulletproof Coffee Here!!! Yum!

This one of the best coffee shops in the city! Great coffee, ambience and now more than enough space.

A small but cool coffee shop.  I was not overly impressed with the coffee but it was better than a Starbucks.  Lots of books and even board games.  Plus a beautiful view of the city from one side of the shop.  A nice place to just chill with some coffee.

So disappointed! This is usually one of my favorite coffee places, but I just went through the drive thru & got a honey iced latte. It was so burnt, I had to throw it out after 2 sips. I hope this place isn't going down hill :(

Great coffee in a super-cute spot. My wife's cappuccino was well-made, and my coffee was good. Free refills on the drip coffee is always nice. 

Lots of room to study and work. They definitely have a geek vibe, that this Star Wars fan can appreciate!  If we lived in town, this would be our regular spot, but since we are driving back to Phoenix, we will just have to swing thru on our trips!
Good coffee, great vibe, i stop every week on my way through town and each time it is worth it.

I would drive an hour just to hang out here for a little. Whenever I check out a new unique coffeeshop in a different part of town I always find myself driving back to Grouchy John's to spend the remainder of my day. I don't know what it is about this place but it is my #1 pick for coffeeshops in Vegas.
Good coffee on the grounds (pun intended) of Canyon Ridge Christian Church.  Brilliant place to park!

A great vibe with all of the Star Wars themed paintings and figurines without being cheesy.  The coffee is delicious and you can tell due to the # of regulars I see walking through the door.  Today I had the Bullet Proof coffee and a side car of their house espresso.  (Colorado valley roaster, I believe)

Grouchy John's is the best place to get coffee in town. Hands down. I'm a total coffee fanatic so I should know good coffee when I taste one. 

 John & J.J are one of the most friendliest & amazing people in the business. They certainly know how to prepare coffee like it's nobody's business that's for sure. I love coming in & seeing the Grouchy John & his crew's (far from grouchy) contagious  smiles.

So far I've tried their almond roca mocha, evil monkey, lemon ice tea, hot spiced cider & blended fruit smoothies. I like their creative coffee concoctions. It's like drinking a delicious dessert that really perks u up. After work, I go there for their chamomile tea & tasty pastries. I also appreciate  how they provide soy milk & almond milk to substitute for milk. A major plus for us lactose intolerant people.

There's a warm inviting feeling when u walk in. This place has a great set up & better seating options than most coffee shops I've been in. I love that cozy sitting area w/ couch & big arm chairs where u can just relax after a long day at work. They also have cool board games & free wifi if u just wanna hang out for awhile drinking your tasty beverages. There is a positive vibe you can feel when you come here. I will definitely be coming back real soon. No doubt.

The portable cart was parked outside one of my favorite comic shops ALTERNATE REALITY for Free Comic Book Day 2015.  The themed drink names were definitely a hit.
 I ordered the Shirley Temple of Doom and it was delicious. 
 I wanted to try everything. If I run into this shop again I will use my frequent stamp card, for sure.

LOVED IT!!

Absolutely A-1 coffee shop! Very comfortable, inviting place with a very homey feel to it; to the right of the counter there's some pretty cool art displayed on the wall, as well as bookshelves packed with many books to choose from if you want some good reading to go along with your coffee. The staff is fast, attentive, & as friendly as can be, & as far as the coffee? Not too sweet, not too rich, but a perfect balance of the two! Great selection, great prices, great staff, & just an overall awesome coffee shop! The flavor of the coffee alone is enough to keep you coming back for more, & the welcoming feel of the shop overall is just an added bonus! The only regret I have is that there isn't one a little closer to where we live, but it's honestly worth the minimal travel time. If you haven't tried Grouchy John's it's definitely worth your while to check it out & pay this coffee shop a visit!

I love this place and service. The only issue is seating. There is just not enough. I love their Chai tea for sure. Pricing is a little under the mainstream popular coffee house but I'm all about supporting the local business.
I've been coming here for years and have always received the best service and coffee! Randy helped me today, and everyone was so nice as usual. Definitely my favorite spot in town!
A coffee shoppe with Star Wars/comic book decor and drinks like "The Jedi" and "The Sith"???? I have found my people and they are Caffeinated!

Great coffee and excellent staff.  Randy at the drive thru was awesome helpful and very patient with my six drink order.  I visit my family from California and make sure to stop for a drink every time I visit.

Nice staff and unique selections. Free parking and a nice atmosphere to surf the internet. Books to read and hang out with your friends. Indoor and outdoor seating available. Convenient drive-thru too.

I stop by this cart on the way to the Tasty Bunz truck that posts up by my 
work on a weekly basis.

The guy running the spot is very nice and whips up your drink pretty quick.

My usual is the Goruchy John namesake frap w/o whip. Its pretty damn good. I have also tried the fruit smoothie(although I do not remember what Kind please forgive me) and it was very good and creamy as well.

All in all...hes got a good product, and the fact that it's mobile just makes it better IMO

Friendly staff, great ambiance, lot's of seating for computer nerds like myself. I only with they were open until midnight instead of closing at nine! Somewhat frustrating when the kids get off school and swarm the back room, but kids will be kids.

This coffee shop is about the people and about the community. Everyone is friendly. They are star wars fans and dog fans. Some of their drinks could have a little less sugar and a little attention to make sure that there isn't coffee on the drink but these are rare occurrances and just reminders to keep this place at its best. This coffee is well made and you can tell by the color of it. They keep the coffee local, the art, the pastries. This coffee shop will always be Vegas and always be a place that cares about its customers - without question.

7 months after my first visit to Grouchy John's and I'm still very impressed!

 I go at least once a week before work and enjoy my experience every time. Customer service is excellent. Coffee & donuts are incredible. Shop is always clean and inviting. 

The owner is a great person and truly knows how to run a business. He cares about every single customer and takes care of them. He simply does an awesome job of running his coffee shop. 

One of the best, if not the best coffee shop(s) in Vegas.

It's my first time here and so far the staff is super friendly and quick at orders... the place is decked out in nerd inspired art and has a library and board games for the customers to play... oh and btw their coffee is amazing!!!

I've been here a few times to get work done and just enjoy being out of my house. I work one of my jobs from home, so having the opportunity to get out of my bed that has my body permanently imprinted in it from laying in it with my laptop within typing range is perfect.

Most recently I went at like 8am on a Sunday. I try to avoid going all the way back out to my house whenever possible, so I had a couple hours to kill between an airport run and a yoga class. I was a wee bit hungry so I bought something called "ManBakes" which I guess are a local product with a really unfortunate name. ManBakes sounds disgusting, and not just in an anatomical sense, but also in a sexist sense. MANBAKES? Come on. Gross. Whatever though, that's not the task at hand.

What's awesome about this place is that when you're inside, you forget that it's perma-summer. I come from a land of four seasons, and this "Hades April-September" and "Light Autumn September-April"  business of Vegas doesn't quite do it for me, but I feel like when I'm in Grouchy J's I could look up from my computer and see snow falling on the ground, or blossoms forming on trees, or something whatever. 

Staff is also super friendly and gives you two stamps without proving you checked in on Yelp. Their straight-up drip coffee is fantastic, as well as their other foo-foo drinks that I like to have when I want to nullify a workout.

One of the best coffee places I've ever been.
Amazing coffee, best selections ever. 
I love that they have multiple "milk" selections.

They have great coffee and great service.  They are very cheerful in the morning and always willing to make a suggestion.   The drinks are priced better than SB.  They are a local business that uses local businesses for their coffee and pastries.

Why would anyone get coffee at a cafe named Grouchy Johns?! Anyways, finally got the chance to give this place a try since I had it bookmarked for awhile. My first impression when I got to this cafe was the atmosphere. It felt like I was in a game room at friends house or an attic that was converted to a cafe. The cool thing about my visit was the friendly and helpful baristas. I was thinking they were going to be a group of Grouchy Baristas that hate their job, lol. However, it was the complete opposite and was a pleasant experience.

Onto the coffee drinks, I got the Honey Latte and it was surprisingly good. It had Vanilla extract and Honey mixture that paired well with the espresso shots and milk over iced. I got the chance to try out the Mint Mocha and that was okay. I do like that this independant coffee shop has a good amount of seating and divided into 2 sections. The main room has sofas and tables kind of seperated in sections with local artwork, game boards and reading materials throughout the caf. The other room is more like a bright classroom/conference are for group studys and meetings. So your bound to find a large portion of students thoughout this caf. A great place to grab a coffee and hangout or study.

2017 Yelp Review #19
The matcha green tea with almond milk is the best! I haven't found a place that makes a matcha green tea better yet.

What a great place to grab a cup of coffee, hangout, read a book, internet surf and meet new people!  I knew about this place because a close friend always checks in here on yelp. I do not live close, but luckily I am house sitting her home and I get to experience this great place!!  They have a wide variety of drinks, from coffee to smoothies. My favorite part is that they serve almond milk and have a natural sweetener and I do not have to get splenda!  Did I mention this place was a lot cheaper then starbucks where you get crappy coffee!?  
When I come to Grouchy John's I usually will sit for a few hours and read my book, I even watched a movie on my computer the other day.  They did not mind me staying awhile and even came around to ask if I was doing okay and filled up my coffee! They have bookshelves filled with books if you ever forget yours or even finish yours while you are there and want to start a new one!   Great place, great staff!
LOVE the Albino Monkey!!! White chocolate banana coffee with an add shot of espresso:) The service is always great!

First and definitely not the last time visiting here! Least to say, I was very pleased  Great coffee and breakfast sandwiches! I recommend getting the breakfast sandwiches on croissant  

I would highly recommend this neighborhood coffee shop over Starbucks any day

This is it, we finally found our coffee spot. Coffee is GREAT! Espresso is nice and mellow, doesn't bite back. The selections and ADORABLY named flavor parings (The Sith, The Jedi) make this place fun - the service and genuinely nice and happy employees make it a fixture. 

I have not tried a pastry yet, they look amazing but incredibly heavy for an early morning start. Board games and books on the shelves, comic book art and signage on the walls. 

There are frequency cards that we'll be taking advantage of in the future, and the drive-through has very fast service. If only it weren't more than 5 miles away from our route, but it's a sacrifice we'll have to make for a great morning coffee!

I'm way overdue on this post. I LOVE Grouchy John's Coffee Shop and visit it every chance I get. 
Don't let the unassuming exterior and convenient drive through lead you astray. Between the furnishings -- a comfortable cross between a cozy den and my college dorm room (e.g., board games, plethora of books, Star Wars memorabilia, leather seating) -- the super friendly and personable staff, the locals (quirky folks, working folks, cops, programmers, the un(der)employed -- everyone's welcome), the coffee and the fresh baked goods (both way better than anything a chain would offer), John's takes the top spot as my favorite coffee shop.

Been coming here regularly and I have to update my review based on my experiences. 

 My favorite drink is definitely their signature 'Grouchy John', made with White Chocolate and Amaretto.  One of my favorite Frappes in Vegas, when made right!  Unfortunately with all my visits I've been noticing that this frappe doesn't always have the same consistency . There were times when my drink would be undrinkable halfway through because its just too icey and I'm left trying to stir the ice with the super cheap straws that bend and break easily. As of right now you might want to stay away from Frappes and just go with iced coffee if you're fixing for something cold and delicious or you could try your luck and hopefully your frappe will come out OK.
I love this place! It's cute and it's different from most cafs. They have their own drink menu which consists of a lot of different flavors. I only wish it was closer to me!
Amazing coffee amazing space.   Even took the girls to play board cames and have smoothie.  Fun relaxing place to play.   They even have paint and coffee nights.

Loved that they had a drive through since we were in a hurry to get home to Scottsdale to our girls. 

The coffee was okay nothing great. And none of the people there were grouchy which was great given the name :)

Great service, cool environment, catchy name, and yummy beverages and food!

My friends and I met here to get a head start on our day in Las Vegas!  There were two connected rooms with different energies.  The first room was busier with the cash register and customers going in and out.  The second room had a relaxing feel where people could read and study.  There was a piano, recliner, board games, and cool Star Wars themed decor and drinks!

I got a special smoothie which was posted on a flyer.  Its title, "Shirley Temple of Doom", intrigued me, so I got it!  The healthy Matcha Green Tea with the Maraschino Cherry flavor blended well - The cherries decreased the bitterness of the Matcha!  Yay!

We had a fantastic experience here because of the Worker Bee, Cody!  He was awesomely efficient and witty!  I would return for another round of entertainment and maybe a Butterbeer Latte!

I've tried their almond roca drink with almond milk and most recently the butter me up with nonfat milk.  Usually I drink my coffee with nothing added- the mixed drinks are when I want to indulge a little.  While the drinks were tasty and I'm a cookie butter lover this place just doesn't excite me the way it seems to for others, but still a nice place.

Just tried them for the first time, and I will be back! Customer service was spot on, hoping to pop inside on my next visit as I used the drive thru this time. Happy to have a small business I can contribute too in my neighborhood with great products and service!

This hurts me, and I may take Terri R's suggestion to bring this up with John next time I'm here. I'm sitting here writing this update as I just tossed out my drink. My standard drink in any coffee shop is Chai Latte, and most times its a dirty chai. Ordered one this morning, iced dirty chai with soy milk. When it was handed to me, I noticed how dark it was, like I was getting iced black coffee. I took one sip and it gave me bitter beer face. It was so artificial and syrupy tasting, I couldn't even get it down. It was terrible. I can't even tell if there was espresso in there, I would it that was a syrup as well. Yuck.

This is the best coffee house I've ever been to and go every morning before work. they pay attention to the details and care about their customers. they also give you a couple of starburst with your coffee/tea which is a very nice touch. I will just be depressed because I'll be moving as far as possible away from my current apartment complex because their management team is a despicable unprofessional bunch (the paramount, dont rent there) and grouchy john's is next door. Maybe the staff at grouchy John's can go next door and give them a consultation on how to treat customers but they are probably too cheap to pay them for their work. God Bless Grouchy John's staff, it makes me still believe that customer service is still important in this country to some companies and people.

Ordered two iced drinks one came quickly and the other one (iced pumpkin spiced latte) took 10 minutes. And then the latte was warm and not really iced. Good flavors. Maybe just a bad day...would try again.

I don't exactly live close to here, but I always try to find a way to make my way past Grouchy John's. I love everything about this place - the ambiance, art, drive-thru, everyone who works there, and of course the drinks! The coffee, tea, and smoothies are all great. Great choice for non-dairy milks, too.

Stopped by on my way out of stuffy smelly noisy Las Vegas.
Great coffee, service, bagels.
Very friendly and eclectic.
Good decor and ambiance.
Highly recommend it.

I can't state enough how much I love this place. The atmosphere is great from the moment you walk in. Local art covers the walls and the music selection is nice. Upon ordering, the customer service was fantastic. The staff are patient and friendly, and they don't see you as a dollar sign. Customer service can't be substituted with anything else. The staff really make this place wonderful. I ordered a Hot Caramel coffee and was blown away. I don't drink coffee often, but GJ's has converted me. The caramel was smooth and not too sweet. Everything in the coffees are just the right amount to enjoy the natural flavor with a hint of sweetness. My friends ordered oatmeal and both said it was pretty good. They have a stamp card system to get free coffee when you fill it up, as well.

There are two entrances to the building, and more room in the back where you can play table top games. They have an electronic piano with headphones and a pretty nice selection of games. Comfortable couches and chairs! I could seriously stay here for hours. Are you guys ready for the best part? FREE REFILLS on regular coffee drinks! That's right - you read that correctly. If you order a caramel coffee and want plain coffee after, they will refill your cup free of charge and with a great attitude. I don't think I've ever had such a pleasant experience buying coffee, and that alone makes me want to choose GJ's every time.

The staff and customer service make me want to love this place, but none of the drinks or food have impressed me. 

If you plan on visiting prepare yourself for hipster sightings.

Finally made it to Grouchy John's. Fun atmosphere, lots of choices for sitting and an awesome "take one bring one" book exchange. 
I had the cinnamon dolce Frappuccino with almond milk. Oh my....so good. I had the wrap with no meat. Spinach wrap with field greens, tomatoes, pepper jack cheese and bell peppers. Yum! My mom had a strawberry smoothie and the breakfast sandwich. She didn't have to say anything, she gobbled it up. 
Check this place out, I know I'm going back.

Visited there for  the first time after leaving the nail salon in the same parking lot and enjoyed myself. I went with a friend , she had coffee and said it was great, I got one of their signature smoothies which was delicious. The vibe in there was cool, a ton of people hanging out and getting work done. I live very close and will for sure be back again.

I absolutely Love this place! The owners are super rad guys, and their staff are all pretty nice! I love that you can pretty much create your own drink, and if you're completely unsure, and ask, they'll surprise you, and it's always amazing! 
I always make an effort when I'm in town to come here!

I'm what you would call a coffee snob. I spent the years of high school, college, and the ones after in an authentic San Francisco coffee house that had been transplanted in Arizona. Unique, high quality coffee and atmosphere are a must for me. Grouchy John's has both. The coffee is excellent and they reward their regulars with an 11th coffee free stamp card, double stamps for check ins at the location, and discounts if you bring your own cup. The drive thru is quick and well staffed. The inside has a huge collection of books, games, and art. The only thing I would change is to make them stay open later. If you enjoy excellent non-chain coffee and a tradition coffee house atmosphere this place is a must.

There's nothing grouchy about John, or whatever the name is of the owner/manager we interacted with there.  This is what a coffee shop should be!

First of all, the coffee.  It's a solid, quality offering...drip coffee...nothing fussy, and not expensive.  I quite enjoyed the Brasilian blend.  It's the type of coffee that there's no need to put sugar in (I definitely sugar my Starbucks).  My friend Marc, however, choose to order one of the fru-fru latte drinks which included some sort of "monkey" thing with bananas.  They were tasty, although that's not really my coffee preference.

They had a nice assortment of sweets and pastries.  I had a bagel they'd bought from some local bagelry (I'm going to make that a noun).  

What really is cool though is that the staff are all incredibly friendly and welcoming.  The other neat thing is that they have a ton of games for play by customers just sitting around.  Seems like it would be a neat place to hang out.  Bonuses include Wi-Fi, a drive through, lots of power strips, and a free drink loyalty card.

We came here 3 days in a row for my morning coffee during my trip to Vegas.  If I lived in Vegas, I'd be here all the time.
Love it here! The atmosphere is pleasant, they have almond milk (a big plus over Starbucks), wi-fi and board games, and the coffee is tasty. They also have a happy hour, which is pretty cool.

Super friendly service, amazing coffee, great food!

Bring your laptop and get work done--they provide outlets throughout the shop and there's even free WiFi!

Check out the pastry offerings--they work with local bakeries to offer cupcakes, bagels, and cookies.

Get a stamp card, and for every beverage you purchase, you get a stamp! When you've got 10, you get a free drink! And as a bonus, when you check in on Yelp, you get double stamps! What's not to love?
This place has such a relaxing atmosphere and the drinks are great!
First time here with the Family and we're loving all the many choices of coffee they have...loving the theme which is Star Wars...check it out guys

Few years later and this place has grown in business, people, and community. They kept their prices low and expanded their store to an entire room. They're still keeping up with the great hospitality and they do ALOT of popular local events  

I'm literally here every Saturday (much quieter than Starbucks on Eastern + more space)

They still kept up their old principles such as 
-HALF off MONDAYS 
-Free starburst with purchase
-Caffeine art events
-Employees asking each customer for water (LOVE THAT)
-Stamp card!

New principles:
-HALF off tea + coffee after I think 5pm on weekdays (don't quote me on the time, I think it's 5!)
-More art work is hung up on the walls
-OPEN until 9pm!! I think opening an hour later will support lots of college students & their late night studying habits 

FAV DRINKS:
-Shirley temple of doom
-Butter beer latte
-Honey latte
-Dirty chai latte
BTW they can adjust your sweetness. I read that a lot of people don't like how sweet it is, so I suggest to ask for LESS or HALF sweeten. They're more than happy to do it 

Fun fact: I use to come here when I was in high school and now I'm about to graduate with my BS in 1 semester. I thank grouchy johns for providing me such an awesome place to just study & focus 

#GrouchyJohnsFan

I think I am sort of at a 3.5 for this review. I got a small mocha and a bagel plain, in the bag and my total was over $6.00 which seemed high. The vibe in the coffeehouse was really awesome and they were pretty busy which I was happy to see. I just thought it was a little spendy. The mocha was very good and the service was friendly.

Twice in 5 days--not bad.  When I was at the store Monday night for the Yelp event, Grouchy John told me he'd be at the Nevada Cancer Institute with his mobile unit today.  That's only about a mile from home.

After the gym, I skipped my regular coffee stop and went to the NCI.  There was John in the curve of the one building with the unit.  I got an iced quad espresso and two pastries--a cheese danish and a blueberry muffin.

The coffee and the cheese danish were great.  I'll keep checking the website to see when the unit will be in my area again.  It was good to see John again--with a smile and not grouchy!

Came in for some coffee based on the yelp reviews...first cup of the bold was lukewarm and not so bold, complained and was told to try the milder brew...started driving, its a little hotter but tastes like coffee flavored water. So I stopped to throw it away and write this at 7/11. 

Hopefully the bagel I bought won't be as dry as the service. Luckily I'm only visiting Vegas. It's 7:15am...why is your coffee like this already?!

This place has quickly, hands down, become a favorite between me and my boyfriend and has been a constant must every other morning when we both either have the day off or simply want to start the day right. 
Grouchy johns has mastered what every local coffeeshop aims to be in all areas of: consistently good and knowledgable customer service, a certain level of local collaboration (their business card area is always filled to the brim with interesting local businesses and startups, they have a full library of local literature like the Sunday, Vegas weekly and seven; the books in their library also appear to be comprised of a lot of donated good reads; thank you notes from local businesses and or from regulars can be found pinned up here and there, the art on the wall featured by local artists etc) that makes it feel like a genuine local spot that locals have indirectly or not helped to create, and they have a good handle on making a good cup of espresso that doesn't need to be masked by all the flavorings and whipped cream in order to hide their lack of skill and attention to detail like some other establishments (cough cough ahem starbucks cough lol).
This place simply must be experienced in order to understand the "hype" and well deserved high praise.
My recommedation/tip to spice things up?: ordering any of their specialty coffee lattes (rushmore, honey boo boo, the sith, etc) iced, breve with 1/4 of the usual sweetness. Of the holiday seasonal drinks, doing the above with their pumpkin spice latte was absolutely superb.  might seem a little finicky/nitpicky but it makes the world of a difference ;)
Love this place! Always go for a large as these guys cup size runs on the small size. Large here is the size of a medium other places. Love the OG and the Grouchy John.
They have the best coffee in town. Every time I go my coffee never changes, it's always delicious. They are also very friendly. Always ask for their stamp card.

Drinks definitely have a lot of variety, quite unique selections. I purposely went out of my way to try this place-- saw it on Yelp-- and I like patronizing local spots.  I ordered the Mayan Apocalypse--coz I like dark chocolate and cinnamon, and requested almond milk and just a little of the horchata.  Still too sweet so they added  coffee.  I love that they tried to make the drink according to how I like it.  You can't beat that kind of quality service.. And that's why I love local businesses.  Customer service is more personal! First time to try this place and I love it already!

Every time I go here they are always super friendly and the drinks are unique and on point, plus they always give my dog a treat and sometimes an extra stamp on the card which is always nice. I definitely recommend this spot for anybody but especially for the locals around- quick, friendly, unique and delicious

I love finding local coffee shops that are a good atmosphere for coffee dates and study time. Located right off the 215 and windmill making it a convenient location. It has all the classic coffee selections, teas, and smoothies, with little goodies to eat as well. Also has a drive thru! They also have plenty of seating space. There's a front room, and a back room. Prices are very reasonable. Service was friendly and quick. I'll be back!

1st time here. I wanted to sit down but the shop was a lot of people !! I tried grouchy johns signature it was so yummy !!! 
I'll come and try other signature they do have !! They have so many options to chose 
Next time I'll try to use drive thou :)

This coffee shop is not just another coffee shop. The name does not do it any good either it is a gem that customers can order a cup of coffee and eat a great muffin. It is sometimes super crowded I order their iced coffee black and it is good even black. The staff is very friendly and walk around and ask once in a while if we need anything.

I tried grouchy john's at first Friday and it was freezing that night! That might have added to why I loved my drink so much but it was really amazing.

I got Christmas in a cup it was a gingerbread white mocha latte.

It changed my life.

I literally raved about it to everyone it was PERFECT! The perfect sweet treat on a cold night. Not too sweet and just enough "coffee" flavor.

Doesn't it just sound delicious? 

I tried to order the drink at Starbucks and it just wasn't the same. Since this is one of their signature drinks I just figure they spent time on finding the perfect gingerbread vs white mocha flavors.

Also my friend got one of their monkey drinks. Banana with Nutella maybe? I don't remember but it was delicious also. 

It was made pretty fast, the girl taking the drink orders was nice enough, and the price was okay.

Great neighborhood coffee shop vibe, the coffee isn't the best I've ever had BUT the prices are reasonable, the staff is friendly, the art on the walls is cheery, there are ample outlets for plugging in your electronic devices, and the one time I came in shortly before closing to have a "quick" business meeting that ran a little longer than I expected, nobody started vacuuming around my chair or giving me the evil eye.  I enjoy coming here to get some work done on my laptop or meet up with some friends.  As for breakfast, the oatmeal is pretty much perfect the way they prepare it.  Be sure to check it out!

I love Grouchy John's because it's a local coffee shop, cute inside, and not too far from my house.
I love that they have so many options for drinks, all with clever names.
I love that they stock protein muffins from Great Grubbin down the street.
I love that the service is super friendly and the owner is usually around, too.
However, I just don't love the drinks. Granted, I am not a coffee drinker, but a tea drinker. They have a  really great looking selection of tea drinks, but after several visits and multiple variations of tea lattes, I just can't find anything I like.
I'm glad you exist, Grouchy John, but I just won't be back to see you.

Four years later and my love for Grouchy John and his caffeinated drinks has only grown. I have sampled most of the drink menu and many of the breakfast foods offered, and have never left disappointed.. 

Why do I love Grouchy John's? I'll break it down in list format:

-I adore how I walk in and am greeted by name. 
-I am a big fan of the promotions they offer, like their punch card (double stamps for checking in on social media), free birthday drink and on Mondays one specialty drink is 50% off. 
-I am thankful I can tell the barista I am undecided on what to order and get a great recommendation.
-I appreciate that Grouchy John's is active in our community and hosts donation drives and other events. 
-I enjoy that I can view the artwork by local artists while I wait for my order. 
-I am happy that hours have been extended and Grouchy John's is open until 9 pm now.

There are so many reasons to love Grouchy John's, which is why I will happily drive right by multiple other coffee shops to come here. xoxo much love GJs!

The service is awesomeee. Always flavorful, just like the coffee. the staff are efficient and fun, consistently. No need to name names, they all have contributed to the good juju in their own positive way. Also, there is a relatively sizeable space in back and a hidden nook by a bookshelf, which is dark and cozy perfect for headphones and homework benders. I mostly come for homework but have met friends recreationally here as well. The vibe is well suited for either, and the event possibilities for that back room seem endless...anyways, back to my math hw ;)

I get bored working from my office from time to time and find working out of a coffee shop is not only a good change of pace, but you tend to get a nice treat away from your standard cup of Yuban made from the 8 year old coffee maker that's been collecting dust in the office kitchen. 

I have passed Grouchy John's just about every Mon-Fri on my way from the office to the gym and never really gave it thought till today and my Yelp check for a nearby place ran me here because of the reviews. 

And now i too have become a fan. I type this from one of the very comfortable couches that fills the interior and makes you feel very comfortable to chill out, work, or converse with friends over a good cup of Joe. The interior is a little funky but friendly with a wall full of books, unique art, and a Star Wars toys wut! The staff is uber friendly and welcoming when i entered. I mentioned my usual order at CBTL and asked if they could do something similar which is just a coffee with chocolate powder and they did it here with syrup (no charge) and it was perfect. I cant say that the coffee is anything any more spectacular than what i have had at other locations around town but i can say that i like the feel of the layout, the comfort of being able to sit and not be bothered to GTFO anytime soon, and of course the WiFi allows me to do my work my work.Service goes a long way with me, and friendliness never hurt anybody so i will certainly be spending my money here again when i want to venture out of my cave (office) and people watch while having a cup. 

Note... they had a picture of a damn bowl of oatmeal i will have to check out next time in here for only a couple of bucks. If it wasn't taco Tuesday and id feel id ruin my appetite i would have done that for sure cause i sure looked tasty. 

Also i had a young lady sit next to me the entire time i was here and just came in for the free WiFi, never bought a thing. Im sure your simply trying to be nice but i think a password or code for the WiFi would be a good idea so you dont have people doing this constantly. I always make sure i have something while im in a business like this because they are providing me a service so the least i can do is spend my money for what their offering...its only fair.

Updated review... after I was pretty upset with my first visit here, JJ was kind enough to reach out to me and made sure I was taken care of the next time I tried their coffee. I had to ask for half sweet but I am happy with how it tasted the second time so if you're like me that doesn't have a sweet tooth I would recommend you say half sweet. The workers here were also extremely friendly. Thanks again JJ I will be back for the cinnamon dolce drink!

Found out about Grouchy John's through their food truck at a local event. I decided to stop by their brick and mortar and it is pretty big. The atmosphere had a comic book, movie, board game type of vibe like the names of their drinks. I really love the honey latte with soy milk! Don't forget to get a stamp card and check in! You get the double the stamps when you check in! =D

My favorite coffee shop! With their list of unique and delicious drinks, friendly staff, and awesome decor (Star Wars, Doctor Who, Walking Dead - to name a few), I feel right at home. My go-to drink is the Caramel Macchiato, but the Butterbeer latte is a close second.

This place is awesome!  Quick drive up times, often there is a pay it forward happening in the drive up and you can get extra stamps towards a free beverage.  The intercom is great you can understand them plus they speak English!!  I always get the Chai Tea as its amazing

Umm... Best coffee shop in town!!! Great staff, great coffee and amazing atmosphere!
I spend as much time here as possible studying and reading. The only drawback is that I can't read at home anymore.

Love this coffee shop,they have quite a few different options of coffee flavors. Jedi iced coffee one is my favorite (white chocolate and coconut) also tried the hazelnut and vanilla one. Cashiers are very nice and helpful. Atmosphere is very relaxing with music and you can sit with your computer.
We go here every Saturday morning. The nitro is great and by far the friendliest people working the drive thru.

Grouchy John's has pretty good coffee. Their food isn't too great though. I like a good breakfast sandwich with my morning coffee and I don't like their breakfast sandwiches, the eggs seem fake to me and they're nothing special. They gave basic lunch sandwiches with chips. And they should use a different donut/pastry vendor! So final word is pretty good coffee, not so great food.

Checked out this coffee shop with a few of my friends that are regulars. This place is awesome. Their custom drinks have awesome names and the vibe is what a coffee shop should be like. I had an og or something like that. It was yummy and I wasn't over whelmed with the hustle and bustle that comes through a place like Starbucks. I will definitely be back.
YUM great coffee great friendly staff and great location. I love the friendly community atmosphere. Love the Yoda too it has kale in it

I am very specific about the coffee that I drink.  I have lived in both San Francisco and Seattle for many years, so I have had my fair share of good coffee.  I must say that Grouchy John's has the best coffee I have had in Las Vegas- and perhaps- of all time.  These guys know how to make EXCELLENT, authentic coffee.  Everywhere I go, my standard order is usually a triple short breve with a sugar.  I have even gone to that hipster Emergency Arts coffee shop in the Arts District (Fremont), anticipating that the coffee would be like it is in a major urban area.  Not at all.  TERRIBLE.  I have even driven all of the way over to Sambalatte in Summerlin.  PRETTY GOOD.  However, when I get my breve with one sugar from Grouchy John's and I take the first sip...HOLY MOMENT.  This place is the reason why some people stop doing drugs and start drinking coffee.

This is a really great place...I'm very happy to have a coffee shop at this location again.
Staff was friendly...coffee was good...can't ask for much more!

This I think is the best coffee in town! 

The service is super nice and personable. I had my punch card almost full and I think it was the owner (maybe a manager) that threw in a couple extra punches to give me the free drink, this probably is not an everyday occurrence but the fact that they did it is cool and less corporate than the other big green coffee bully in town.

Service is great but the best reason to visit Grouchy John's is the coffee...it is incredible!

Oh my gosh I am so glad this place is not right next door to me, because I would spend all of my money here. 

They were busy! There was a line at the register, we were about 6 people back, and the drive-thru was jammin'. Once we got to the register to order, our drinks were done in about 3 minutes. We were shocked at how quickly our drinks were made, and brought to us. 

Everyone working there was super friendly. I love that there is a t.v., lots of comfy sofas, little corner spots to sit as well as tons of board games and SO many books to read. This place seems small when you walk in, but there is an entire back area to sit in that can accommodate a larger group. 

The drinks were tasty, and they were super fast. Really really like Grouchy John's. And their logo is awesome.

Great place! They have amazing coffee, great selection of fun drinks! Everything can be customized too which makes it super easy if vegan. Evil monkey is the best drink ever, just saying ~
10/10 
They even have a drive thru.
I was impressed until you forgot my breakfast sandwhich!!! And you sold the last cheese bagel I ordered.
Very nice place to chill and to have something to drink/eat. Customer service is 5 stars. Love it.
Great atmosphere to study or to hangout with someone to talk. Coffee was grwat, staff was welcoming and very helpful.
Awesome...friendly staff....my latte and kids got chocolate tasted great...I had the oatmeal which was on point

Went there after seeing great reviews on Yelp. But we were disappointed. We ordered a double shot latte and a butterbeer latte. Both were bad. Jus bad. The place was cute though. Wish we had a better experience.

This is my favorite coffee shop in Vegas! I am a little upset with myself I didn't write a review sooner... I have been going here for years on and off every week and I only go through the drive thru. The owner knows who I am based off my frequent visits even if I haven't gone back in months. I love coffee and am very picky about quality Grouchy Johns is top quality to me! They are also fairy priced and have yummy food options (I like their wraps!) I love this place and their service what other coffee shop will just give you starburst just cause :) Go check them out for yourself you will not be disappointed !
I love this coffee shop it is my absolute favorite! They have great prices and original drinks... The pB&j is to die for!

Best coffee in town!! Plus they offer almond milk! And they are a small local business which I will support any day! John the owner and his crew are friendly also they donate so much toward charity's in our community I will from now on only drink grouchy johns coffee :)
COFFEE.. what an awesome experience. Perfect latte, great art, fun atmosphere and did i say how good the latte is? May just be the best latte i have ever had.
Great place. Coffee is good staff knows what they are doing. Will be my coffee shop here on out!
I got a hazelnut iced latte and it was one of the best I have had! If I lived here I would drive out of the way for their coffee!

There's definitely a reason why I can't stop myself from frequently visiting Grouchy John's over and over again. 

First and foremost, every coffee beverage I've enjoyed at this establishment has been expertly crafted and brewed to perfection. Their coffee menu options are endless, so not matter what type of coffee beverage you prefer, they will certainly have the perfect concoction created to satisfy your caffeine fix. Their blended PBM is my absolute favorite because it's the perfect combination of coffee, chocolate, peanut butter, and of course, bananas! Plus, I can't help but love the nerdy spin they added to their menu by naming drinks after iconic characters such as Chewbacca, Yoda, and even the adorable Curious George! 

In fact, I recently tried a blended version of their Chewbacca specialty drink and I must say from the moment that first sip touch my lips, I couldn't stop myself from belting "RRRAARRWHHGWWRR" out of pure joy and utterly complete satisfaction. I hope to one day be able to say I've conquered the entire menu because I'm 100% certain that I will always be satisfied with whatever beverage I purchase from this wonderful coffee joint.
Delicious espresso. I come here for strong cappuccinos and smiles. They use local beans, something i support very much, beans from the CRC co.

Grouchy John's get all the stars from me for being the best true local coffee shop in town. Always quick and always good, it's a regular stop on my way to work or whenever I need a fix. 

Usually I go with something simple. But if you like a sweeter drink check out the OG. It's my personal favorite sugar bomb!!!

Also..IT IS NOT STARBUCKS!!!! 

Love the local vibe and all they do.

4 Stars - Solid coffee, mostly consistent, and when inconsistent, they will remake it for you no questions asked.  If you like flavored coffees, this is definitely the place for you.  For me, however, I generally ask for 1/2 the normal flavor additives, because I find it overpowering otherwise.  If you want pure latte or regular coffee, they are quite solid.
5 Stars - The staff.  Yes, they're a mixed bag.  But in the end, they are always friendly, always helpful, and always willing to do whatever it takes to make you satisfied with your drink.  I was amused and pleased to note that after just a couple times there, many of the staff already know my name.
4.5 Stars - the Atmosphere.  It's great for when you're feeling silly, want to have a convo with a friend, or just indulge your sweet tooth.  The back seating area could be greatly improved on (thus the minus .5 star), because it has a cafeteria feeling and isn't as kitchy or funky as the main area.

Recommendations - 
Honey Boo Boo, seriously, it's as good as it sounds bad.  Or maybe it's just that secret guilty pleasure.
Sith - because why have mocha when you can taste the dark side?
Chupacabra - because we sometimes need a bit of spice in our lives.
Iced Latte - because let's face it, sometimes a good cup of iced coffee is all you want, and they do it good here.

Avoid -
Bulletproof coffee.  Whoever invented this should have their tongue examined.  It's NOT good...  As in, imagine coffee were turned into a health food/coffee syrup.
