It's what I imagine castor oil would taste like.  So uh.. I guess if you're finding yourself cursing due to traffic, it might be an effective deterrent?
Excellent everyhere now. Getting Americano and honey to go. Large size is actually a medium but very good for sure. Good find here.
Coffee drinks are OK but don't expect to accompany your drink with anything good, all pastries and bagels are not fresh and they are obviously  brought from a nearby supermarket store and resold.

My son goes here a lot but today was the first time I tried it.  It was so delicious!  The girl at the drive up menu helped me order my Cinnamon Dolce with Almond milk.  It was so yummy!  They also offer coconut milk, which is another nice thing if you have a problem with whole milk like I do!

Best coffee shop in Vegas. Perfectly delicious drinks every time. Amazing customer Service. Also a great place to check out local art and local food companies.  They are very big on supporting local business and community events. They also offer both almond and soy milk as an option.

I think this is a great casual hang out or study spot, but their drinks are mediocre at best. Most drinks are way too sweet for my taste and I prefer the coffee to be highlighted in drinks generally, and not the added syrups, spices, powders, and whatever else, but that's just my personal preference. The only drinks I do like are their pumpkin spice lattes, blended matcha, and their nitro brew. However the costumer service and the atmosphere is great :)

Ive been coming here for a pretty long time now but haven't gotten around to writing a review. This place is definitely a great locally owned coffee shop. Please people stop going to Starbucks! Not only is the coffee pretty gross it's just not the same when you're supporting big business like that instead of giving back to the people of our community. They brew using excellent beans and the coffee is always strong. I come here and get the same thing always, a large iced latte with two pumps of hazelnut and one pump of chocolate with whole milk. Try this drink! Something I made up and it is super addicting. I crave them all the time. They also have excellent pastries that they also source locally from places in town. The ambience inside is great also, not too stuffy like some trendy coffee shops like to do. Everyone is very friendly and always smiling. Overall it's everything you want a business to be. I really enjoy coming here and I always recommended Grouchy John's to other people.

I love this place. Menu is great. Easy to order speciality drinks. Love the vibe here. Quiet for work, school, or a good conversation with friends. Plenty of seating. I have finally found my new coffee shop after searching for a year. Thanks Grouchy's.
Good service, great coffee and I cheated and had a great chocolate donut! Coffee is WAY better then Starbucks!

This place has it figured out! Variety is the spice of life and I LOVE trying new things! Their menu had so many exciting flavor combinations I'm already wanting to go back! They gave me a couple starburst with my drink (nice touch!) and double stamps for checking in?! Goodbye Starbucks!!
Friendly people & great service. They have a pretty good selection of coffees & pastries for a nice morning start.
Big fan. Great nitro coffee, cool mellow non-corporate vibe.
Such a cute coffee shop. This is exactly my ideal kind of coffee shop! Tasty coffee, delicious pastries, every board game known to man and cozy atmosphere. Just wish I could walk there.

Such a great cafe spot! Worth the short 18 min trip from the strip. They serve the standard fare but also has BPC!! So keto peeps- check em out! Great quirky artwork up, books & boardgames. Saw a fella. drawing up and inking his comic book project. Fun place, warm people.

Oh dang! Grouchy John's is really good. There are seriously not many places ever that can make my coffee just how I like it, and Grouchy John's succeeded on the first try. I broke my coffee maker the other morning and they came to the rescue for my morning coffee needs! I also got a wheat bagel from them which was perfectly toasted and delicious. Will surely be back soon!
went through the drive thru late at night and the caramel latte that Randi made me was so perfect, it tasted soda gud, will be back asap like rocky. #lit #lit #litty

GJ's is a great locally owned coffee shop.  They pour a good cup of Joe & pull a nice shot of espresso.  The drink menu is expansive but I only drink coffee & espresso...together sometimes, well, mostly. So, I can't speak to the quality of anything else, but would guess it is all good. 
In the mornings they have an urn full of coffee with to-go cups on a table & a self-pay system for those in a hurry. BRILLIANT!
Also brilliant, they have a box full of power strips for laptop users to tap into the electricity, so you don't have to fight for a plug.

The staff is super friendly & the location is easily accessible with convenient drive-thru.     

GJ's is and will be one of my regular coffee joints for a long while.
What an awesome place. Great ambiance and over the top service! My blended mocha was delicious! I live across town, but when in the area I stop here. I highly recommend it.
Just saying.. Everyone is always so nice as usual. Traffic seems to have let up before 9. Enjoy a nice iced coffee on a warm day!

One of the best coffee shops I've been to period.  Super friendly staff and extensive menu for all tastes.  I definitely got a Pacific NW vibe from the place, which, if you've been, is an awesome thing.  You wouldn't think such a place would exist in Vegas, but it does and Vegas folks... err Henderson folks are lucky to have them brewin the good stuff for them. 

They have daily half off specials, which are a great deal, but I went straight for the nitro cold brew, which was on point.  

Waaay out of the way for me, but I'll def return whenever possible.

This place is awesome! The staff very friendly, great food and coffee. They don't take long to make food and drinks even when they're busy. Also, they help local artists sell their art by displaying it on the walls. Love it!

Cold brew is tasty! I recommend purchasing the glass bottle. I have pulled through and ordered custom shakes (the yoda, add protein) and it wasn't the hit I was expecting. Still descent! 

Update: the last couple of times my order came out wrong :/ not sure what's going on but still stop here often!

I went to this shop on two occasions. The first time was for plain black coffee. It tasted burned. I had a sip of the wife's cold nitro drink and it was moderately better. 

The second time was for their signature Grouchy John Frappe. It was sweet but artificial; and lacked any bold taste. It truly was no better than your commercial caf frappes. 

The upside is that they offer to make you another drink if you didn't like yours. The downside is that they're still expensive drinks.

I really liked this coffee shop. It's decorated eclectically which makes it fun and interesting. I am especially thrilled with their very large community room. A huge back room available to anyone for free. I was there with a group of ladies doing volunteer work. I appreciate that Grouchy John's makes this room available.

The only thing I didn't care for was the tip jar. They had a clever but inappropriate saying, "Just the tip, not the shaft". I chuckled lightly and I'm not a prude but I didn't like it overall.

I love everything about this place, except for the location because it's nowhere near me or the places I tend to frequent, but if I'm ever within a few blocks I make a detour and pay them a visit. The drinks are fantastic (with tons of dairy free options), the service is excellent (they are all super friendly and not at all grouchy) and they even have a drive thru for when you're in a rush. If you have the time to go inside I recommend it as it's very comfortable with little nooks for readers and couches for socializers. Plus, if you get their stamp card and check in on Yelp when you visit you get double stamps, that equals a free drink every five visits!
LOVE, love, love Grouchy John's. A great place with interesting, and fun decor and talented Baristas! The service is fast, incredible and friendly, and the coffee is to die for!

This place is awesome , I have been a regular for over a year.  But in the morning of 12/03/17 I had a bad experience, the lady with dirty blonde hair at the register was super rude and acted like me being there was a inconvenience for her and her attitude. I've never written a review, but I could not let this slide. I will be going back here , as long as I don't encounter the same bad customer service.

John and John are kind of opposites when you meet them, one kind of quiet and surly, and the other complimentary and social-able, but put 'em together and you get one phenomenal coffee-shop.   From the local artists featured on the walls, to the huge selection of board games, and the clean and comfortable environment this place has was it takes.  It is my new favorite place to grab a cup when I am in the southeast area, and is one of the few places left to go that doesn't have a frigging mermaid on the cup.  The drinks are delicious, the coffee is wonderful, and the atmosphere is perfect for me.  If you like your coffee and you like to support local business and you are tired of the same bitter crap from bux, stop in and say hi and have a cup!.  Tell 'em I sent ya!   They won't care, but then again, neither will I!  As a lover of "real" coffee houses, I just can't say enough good about Grouchy Johns!

my only problem with this place is there is only one location. yea its on the way to work but i love the coffee here so much i wish there were more locations. awesome people, awesome shop, awesome coffee. never thought i'd find another place other than that other big chained coffee shop that i'd enjoy but Grouchy John's proved me wrong. support your local shop owners and consider visiting here and giving it a try. i was quite surprised at how delishus my mocha latte was.

This little local coffee shop is fun! They have fresh bagels and pastries every day, and the staff is SO NICE! For my first time being here, they were so  helpful. I enjoy this places atmosphere and coffee. Their menu has a wide variety of fun options to choose, I will definitely be back!

The best coffee shop I know of in the Vegas area (to be fair, this city underwhelms in that department). Plenty of space, decent wifi, outlets, easy parking, kitschy (but tasteful) decor, friendly service, and very good coffee (including a number of creative specialty drinks).

I am so happy I moved down the street from here! I'm diabetic, so I order the sugar free almond roca, blended (BOMB DOT COM). I have also had the OG drink in sugar free... that's like salted caramel and something else. I will be trying other things now that I live in this area, but I love treating myself to these delicious, sugar-free concoctions! Love to support local businesses.
Delicious coffee, fun environment and very friendly staff. Great place to meet friends or make new ones. They even have coffee and canvas night. I love grouchy John's!

My first time here driving thru the famous Grouchy John's Coffee shop and I have to say..the reviews from the past are right on. I got the popular Grouchy John Frap on ice with almond milk (for the health conscious:) ) I'm impressed and lucky for me I checked in and got the double stamped for every drink I bought. The gentleman that served me was very professional and I appreciate the great service as a first time customer. Thanks Grouchy John for a great coffee drink to get my day started right. 
My little guy is loving the strawberry smoothie so that makes me double happy for the drinks:) It's Friday, so go get yourself a fabulous yummy coffee drink:)

I love the bulletproof coffee. It's really very gud. 
Also almond roco Frapp. It's my favorite.
I LOVE this place! Sorry Starbucks - this place is way better and better for you in my opinion! Amazing service, atmosphere (if you care to spend some down time here) and products - so delish! :)
The most amazing coffee I've ever had! Currently obsessed with the Iced Grouchy John's Latte!
Love the fact that their coffee is delicious and their locations are near my house and campus.
My new favorite is the Almond Cookie tea. It's decaf so able to drink at any time of the day and tastes incredible. Of course, everyone working here is awesome as well and very hospitable.

The coffee here IS SO FREAKIN GOOD!!!! I live all the way in Centennial so anytime I am out by Henderson or the airport I stop here. Madhouse and this place are the best and I wish that they were on each corner besides crappy Starbucks!! They only lose a star because I wish that their cup sizes were bigger!

I was going to make a joke about this place having great service for a place called Grouchy John's, but someone beat me to it. Dang!

But, really, this truck is awesome! My party ordered a few smoothies, of all which were great. The service was great, too, and I believe we only waited a few minutes for all our drinks to be ready. It's really awesome that a mobile place is able to put out this kind of service and quality, which also speaks to the higher quality of mobile food purveyors. 

Going back to the smoothies, they were delicious. They were better than the ones I get from Tropical Smoothie all the time, and the service was a lot better too: really friendly, no-pressure, "do you have any questions?" approach that really invites you into a conversation. Great service.

Great coffee and flavor combinations, loyalty punch card and a drive thru that is quick.  Yes, please.  Very cool atmosphere inside to lounge and get some work done.  They also have a really good happy hour.  Their Cafe Au Lait is the best I've had outside of New Orleans.  My only caution would be that their coffee drinks run hella sweet.  I get them 1/4 sweet and that's definitely enough.

I love their coffee. Coffee fresh. Coffee hot. Coffee cold. Coffee delicious. I love coffee.

 Grouchy johns has the best customer service in Las Vegas I love coming here because I know I'm going to be greeted with a smile and with deliciously prepared beverage.

Visited this place after going to their truck previously.  The prices were good and the coffee was great.  I am usually hesitant to visit coffee shops besides starbucks just because I know what I like and I hate when my drink doesn't taste how I want it to.  Grouchy John's got it perfect and I will return.

Wonderful. Already left a google review but hey we're just that good that they deserve a yelp review as well. Quality food, coffee, and customer service. A must do for breakfast in Vegas. The menu is expansive as well with plenty of options for everyone. Love this little cafe!

This place is FANTASTIC! I went here and ordered a green tea smoothie type drink - it was amazing. The staff was very welcoming and personable. They had a great assortment of treats. The staff was very knowledgeable on their drinks and I enjoyed chatting with them. They brought my drink right out to me while I enjoyed some sunshine on their patio. They had a really awesome group of eclectic people there - a study group, friends chatting, people playing board games. I will definitely be returning!

Grouchy Johns has a great coffee menu. The have all of the basics and they also dabble in plenty of unique coffee drink options. The ambiance is quiet, and filled with nerd culture. This is the place for Star Wars and graphic novel geeks. They have a book shelf where you can take from and donate. Books, games, and posters keep your eyes busy for a few hours. The owners are very sweet and remember their guests. My favorite coffee is the iced Dark Sith with coconut milk.

We loved Grouchy John's! The staff are anything but grouchy though--so friendly! We were visiting from LA and felt right at home. My husband loved all of the Star Wars paraphernalia! He also said it was one of the best English Breakfast teas he's ever had (and he's British...so that's saying a lot). I loved my cookie butter iced coffee, it's something I know I'll dream about until we meet again. Oh! And we had a breakfast sandwich which was also delightful--flavorful and yummy. We'll definitely be back!
This group of people are awesome. Sometimes the drive thru peeps sound irritated but my food and drinks are on point. Coffee is important so I appreciate the great attitudes from these dudes

I have just started to frequent grouchy john's and so far so good.  First I love the name and the coffee's that I have tried are great.  Skinny almond rocha mocha is yummy. I will be going more often.... YUM

I've been here a couple times and the service and the drinks are fantastic! One of the managers recommended the South Sea Magic Ice Tea and it was amazing. It's a black iced tea with light floral notes. It's perfect on a hot summer day like today. Great place to relax, read a book or play a board game. Best coffee shop in town!

The service was friendly. Three stars because I think it was a bit overpriced. I know getting your drink modified using soy milk and adding a pump or two may add 30-50 cents extra (though when I worked for a coffee shop I didn't charge for an extra few pumps), but for the size and I believe because it's not a chain like Starbucks or Coffee Bean, I would think they would want to compete with their prices. 

They give you starbursts! And offer a punch card though! :)

The prophecy is true. The grouchy man has risen from the wasteland to save us from the evils of bad coffee. That's basically what his twitter profile says anyway.

I visited Grouchy John this morning while he was parked in front of Slidin Thru HQ. At the truck with John was JJ, the author of Bloodsucking Vegas. I thought he looked familiar. With today's secret word, I was able to get a Caramel Mocha Latte and a Chai Tea Latte. Double fisted gourmet coffee FTW! I don't get coffee often, so it was a good way to sample the grouchy man's menu. I thoroughly enjoyed the Caramel Mocha. It was uber-sweet and would satisfy any sweet tooth. On the flip side, the Chai was much milder.

Like I said, I don't get a lot of coffee. To me, there is simply good and bad coffee. On that simple pass-fail scale, Grouchy John's certainly serves up some good cups of Joe. At $3 for the Chai Tea and $3.50 for the Caramel Mocha (both 12oz cups), the prices are on the upper end. Still, I'm a fan. In the increasingly crowded Vegas street vendor scene, I hope he does well. Time will tell.

Love this little coffee house! It's totally nerdy and amazing! Their coffee is really amazing they also have smoothies that are Star Wars named and delicious! Would recommend! They have a drive thru also!
I don't think I met grumpy John because everyone was pretty friendly when I visited. The coffee was pretty solid and this seems like a good place to get some work done because there's a ton of space.

Decided to try this place after reading all the reviews on yelp.

1. The staff is great. Very friendly and patient
2. The atmosphere is very relaxing. I enjoyed looking at the artwork on the walls.
3. They have more to do than just drink coffee. Books, games any all the goodies mentioned in other reviews.

What I did not really like was the coffee. Very...very sweet. Infact, it was way to sweet for me and I love sweets. I went with a friend and she too agreed that the coffee drink was too sweet. They use syrups to flavor the coffees and it takes away from the real coffee flavor. Perhaps we made the wrong choices and should have tried something else.

Not sure if I or we will go back. It's a nice change from boring old Starbucks, but the coffee is just not there.

Please note: I am not a big fan of Starbucks. I prefer coffee bean but the store by me has really gone down hill, amongst other issues. That's another reason I tried this place.
Poor customer service, they didn't understand the difference between a bagel sandwich and a croissant sandwich.  Good coffee though

After a hard day at work, Grouchy John's Coffee Shop makes me a joyful coffee drinker. It is one of a handful of coffee shops that I routinely patronize.

  Grouchy John's Coffee Shop is the antithesis of the corporate coffee shop. It has the personality and energy level of a downtown Las Vegas coffee shop. It is a slice of downtown Las Vegas in the southeast Las Vegas Valley. Outside the entrance is the iconic Grouchy John's coffee shop. This is an omen that the customer is in for a unique coffee shop experience. Inside the lobby resembles a student union with the touch of a living room. On the way to the counter, which is on the right, are numerous seating arrangements. There are the standard tables and chairs throughout the lobby. At the far left corner are plush chairs arranged around a small table. At the far window are bar seats that are popular with Internet users. Bookcases holding books share the space with the seats. Grouchy John's is more than coffee. It is also a library. In my opinion, the library is more of a decoration. From what I see, the majority of the customers are on-line reading digital material compliments of the free WiFi (myself included). The sight and smell of the books improve cozy vibe of the place.

  At the counter, the employees are friendly. They notice repeat customers, and make them feel welcome. They show their appreciation for repeat customers with a card that earns stamps toward a free beverage. Forget the card at home. They will not be grouchy. They will stamp another card which you can use with the other card toward a free refill. When I first started going here, they would visit my table to ask me if I needed a refill or a Starburst. So much for grouchy.

  My beverage of choice has been a cup of coffee with peanut butter syrup, This tastes like sipping melted Reeses Pieces with the advantages of caffeine. Today, I tried the Almond Roca Mocha Late. It tasted like a hot liquid desert beverage with the advantages of caffeine.

   If you decide to visit Grouchy John's Coffee Shop, please keep in mind a few things. On weekdays it closes at 8:00 PM., which in my book is way too early. High quality coffee based beverages are delicious on the taste buds whereas they are poison on the breath. I highly recommend bringing breath mints. And most of all, do not expect to leave grouchy.

I'm not really a coffee drinker, but "getting coffee" is something to do when meeting up with friends, so I oblige. Starbucks is boring, so we decided to try Grouchy John's because a friend is addicted to this place and highly recommended it.

I originally asked for a Strawberry/Banana Smoothie, but the guy at the register suggested I try the Suicide Smoothie instead. I went with his recommendation. The drink was good, but nothing special. I'd rather have Jamba Juice to be honest. Maybe I messed up by ordering a smoothie at a coffee shop, so I'll venture into the coffee items next time I'm here.

Rather than the drinks, the highlight was the atmosphere. The place is fairly quiet, but not stale like a library. It does have an artsy feel. Not in a skinny jeans and PBR hipster type of way though. Nerdy and comfy would be the best way to describe it. This gives it the character that's lacking at the chain coffee shops. Best of all, their tip jar has a sense of humor.
Worth the drive from Henderson! Love their fresh brewed iced tea options. Never have had anything less than great customer service. And free refills while you hang out? Couldn't ask for more!

I drive by this place every day after dropping my daughter off at school, thought I would swing by. You know what? A REALLY GOOD CUP OF COFFEE! It's refreshing to have a new go to place that does not involve mermaids and burnt coffee. That, and supporting a local business is refreshing!

This is my favorite place to get coffee drinks. The evil monkey is really good and my favorite is the jedi. This place has the best names for drinks and the staff is always friendly. The atmosphere inside is fun but you need to see it for yourself. I will always come back
Better than Starbucks.  Way less people.  Friendly staff.  Lots of space.  Good location.  Rather than support the commercial places, nice local spot here.

All I can say is YUMMM!! We tried this place for the first time yesterday & it was so deliciously addicting that we had to go back for today's thirst fix! 

Our first time was through the drive-thru. The drive-thru menu was very easy to read but so hard to decide because of their great coffee variety & choices! Most drinks can be either hot, iced, or blended so whatever your mood, they've got you covered! I ordered an iced dirty chai with soy milk & my better half got a blended vanilla frappe. Like I said, we went back a second day in a row so the drinks were obviously the bomb to both of us!

Today's beverage choices were a tad different & equally delightful! I tried the 'Butter-Me-Up' frappe because it had been recommended to me by the girl at the drive-thru when we were waiting for our beverages the day before! Her recommendation was phenomenal especially if you're a cookie butter fan! My lover got the blended vanilla frappe but this time with an added espresso shot! We also got a vanilla shake for our little one & a caramel frappe for the mother-in-law... all of which were incredibly incomparable to any other coffee drinks around!

Their espresso taste is so rich, smooth & creamy that it's flavor is what's so desirable about this place! Not to mention, the inside of this shop is too stinkin' cute! I was in awe once we walked in on day two to see so much creative color, Star Wars & all around good vibes! A huge plus for me is that they have a stamp card! Each drink gets you a stamp & ten stamps gets you a free drink! The greater value of this incentive is if you check into Grouchy John's then you earn two stamps per drink! Pretty sweet deal if you ask me! If I would've been offered a stamp card the first time around & knew to check in on the second day then I'd already have a free beverage for tomorrow! (So definitely not hard to fill up a card & enjoy a coffee on them!)

Overall, this will definitely be our newest chill & drink spot & I can't wait to drink our way through their menu! Mahalo Grouchy John's!

Glad I finally have this place a try. They offer a variety of hot and cold coffee drinks in an artsy hip atmosphere. The amount of local art for sale, comic book art, Star Wars figurines might be a little overwhelming at first, but the place isn't messy so it just adds to the atmosphere. The girl who took my order was very knowledgeable and helpful in making a recommendation. I got the cold brewed coffee, iced, to-go, and the girl mentioned I can can a refill too. That's good to know. Even though I got a small, it was plenty strong so didn't get a refill on my way out. Coffee was smooth and tasty. Price was reasonable and they even have a drive through and was 3 cars deep when I visited. There is plenty of seating and even a bookshelf with real books one might actually read. I would come back if I was in the area.
I love this place. Staff is always super friendly. The atmosphere is cozy. They have a lot of sugar free options along with almond milk. I go as often as I can For a little coffee treat.

A great fancy coffee place with drive thru. but not so fancy you can't handle or afford it- cheaper than Starbuck's with way more variety! their coffee drinks are truly unique.

I had HORCHATA in one iced coffee.. mind blown. and in another: cayenne and chocolate. It's like Forrest Gump's box of chocolates... you may never know what you are really getting with the flavor explosions they offer, but it's well worth the trip. they do it right.

Grouchy John's is my go-to coffee place. :)

Customer service: 
The staff is extremely friendly and make the effort to get to know their regulars. I'd like to point out that while they're friendly, they're not overly enthusiastic or robotic in their kindness. They're very down-to-earth here.

Menu:
They have a large selection to choose from. Lattes, teas, and smoothies, as well as some snack options like bagels and donuts (Pink Box!!). My personal favorite is their nitro cold brew. It's so smooth that I can drink it black. If I want some sweetness, an iced cold brew with a pump of flavor (hazelnut!!) and almond milk is great, too. Sencha when I'm feeling some tea~

Atmosphere:
The shop is very warm and inviting. The walls are filled with artwork from local artists and are available for purchase. They have Caffeine and Canvas Nights every month, which are tons of fun.

Walked into this place while visiting from Sacramento. . awesome coffee place. My honey got the PBM peanut banana and dark chocolate latte drink. .he is not big on sweet drinks the server said no problem they could make it a little less sweet. .  he loved it. I got the Mocha Carmel blended also a winner we will definitely be coming back next time we are in town.

I'm going to have to be honest and reveal that I'm really not much of a fan of coffee. I take it black and that's about it. That being said, lots of my family and friends love it and that's why I found myself at Grouchy John's Coffee. An out of town friend scouted this place out on yelp because they had all kinds of board games to play and that's literally the one reason why we ended up all the way down in the bowels of Henderson! So the coffee: It was black and hot. That's all I really care about. But this place really did hit it out of the park when it come to having a huge selection of board games available for play. We ended up playing backgammon and chess but they must've had about 50 other games to pick from. There weren't any pieces missing and we had a grand ole' time playing and conversing. Oh yeah, we drank our coffee too. I'll never be back to this place unless said friend comes back to town and needs to play board games while consuming coffee but if that happens, Grouchy John's is where I'll go! 
ps I'm still bummed that The Beat downtown closed. That was my old go to.

Love the name! Sat down and relaxed w a cappuccino.. wanted to give this place a try besides the usual Starbucks etc 
Liked the options of smoothies and pastries ! Will be back !

The absolute best coffee house in town. The baristas are extremely friendly and very knowledgeable. They have two large rooms to do everything from play board games to settle down with a good book. They have a wide variety of drinks and food and the decor ranges from artsy to super hero theme.

This is my favorite coffee shop in town! Everything that I've ordered I have enjoyed. My favorite is the Chewbacca with soy, yum! We discovered this place when they where at the Bite of Last Vegas, several years ago. You know the best part of it all!? Well, they have awesome deals for the military! As a military family we appreciate that so much! Thanks  John's! We are forever hooked

This is my FAVORITE local coffee shop. I try to schedule my meetings on that side of town to have coffee there.  Owner and staff are really friendly, their juice and smoothies are made fresh, their coffee is yummy and best of all its a LOCAL coffee shop that got it right. Love Grouchy John's...
Environment is chill and not silly like some of the coffee shops in Anthem. The coffee is much better here as well.

Found this place based on the yelp reviews and thought I would try it. Went through the drive thru and ordered a breakfast sandwich and an ice coffee. Both were delicious and the folks at the window were very friendly. I also got a punch card! :) Will definitely return here again in the future.

I came across Grouchy John's by accident. I was very content with my discovery of Sambalatte and my belief that it was the best coffee in town. And while it is still my go to and this is my first visit to Grouchy John's and he will have some making up to do, I have to say I was pretty blown away by the coffee and service!!
   I was unsure of what to order. So many choices and combinations to choose from! ( they have their fav's- grouchy John, o.g., a.r.m., all of which get phenom reviews). But I decided on the butter-me-up, made with trader joe's cookie butter. Now I just have to say this is one of my favorite guilty pleasures on earth, but to find it put into an addiction of mine (lets just be honest here!)... Coffee??? SOLD!!!!  And the verdict is..... Delightful!! It wasn't too sweet, which I was worried about. I ordered it with whole milk but it didn't feel heavy at all. It was delish and I wish I had ordered the larger size!!
   The service was great. There were a couple people behind the counter and a gentleman that walked around making sure everyone was happy. I assumed the owner and later asked and was correct! He asked twice if I had tasted my coffee yet and to let him know if I liked it and checked on me several times as I sat and enjoyed the vibe. The barista (girl with dark hair) also asked me. It was very nice to have such great service.
   Now....On to the vibe of the joint. I really enjoyed it, but initially it threw me for this side of town I think. I seriously felt I was walking into a gamers room who is obsessed with star wars and may be out of town at a comic con convention. Very eclectic range of people hanging out, playing board games and on their computers.  Honestly,I could see this place downtown... but am more than thrilled that this piece of culturally diverseness found its way into my part of town!!! It's one of my biggest reasons for missing LA so much. Vegas lacks places like this!! I will be back!! Thanks Grouchy John.... Who isn't grouchy at all!! ;-)

Great local coffee shop that is easy for me to get to driving to work. They have a nice environment inside with lots of chairs, tables, etc. They also have a nice selection of locally made pastries and other edible goodies. Their customer service is top notch and if you remember to check in on Yelp you can get double stamps towards a free drink. I love that they support our local coffee roaster and use their beans. Keep up the good work GJC!

Was looking for some good coffee for the long drive back to SD. Checked on Yelp, and waahhhlaaa! 
I walked in to this cozy little establishment, that had a living room vibe going on one side and restaurant open area on the other. I was immediately greeted and helped by a super nice guy. He was very helpful, friendly, and happy. Made me feel welcomed, and put me in an even better mood. He recommended a few choices, and helped me decide on the large iced coffee with cookie butter. ( I love trader joes cookie butter, so when he said they use that and hand mix it in, I was sold) He waited for me to try it and said if I didn't like it, they would make something else. After a few sips, I decided I was good.
The coffee was good, but a little too sweet for me. It was slightly salty as well, but not too overbearing. I think it was the cookie butter that gave it the sweet salty taste mixed with the almond milk, but who knows. Either way it was good and I was very impressed with the overall experience. It was a creative, different, and the taste explodes in your mouth. I'd definitely come back for some coffee on my next trip to Vegas!

So I'm only gonna talk about the coffee in this review.

The coffee is amazing! They have a different menu then some places. I love the OMG because I love salted caramel but it also adds vanilla. I am a big coffee person.. or at least I like to consider myself a big coffee person. There are people who would disagree. They have a unique menu and I love it. Everything is made very well and the flavors are great. I like the ice blended items because they use like a certain ice that just has a different texture. I don't know if the makes sense, but there is no huge chucks of ice which I like. The ice blended items seem to be very smooth.

The flavor of the signature "Grouchy John's" is amaretto and vanilla I believe. It was a little too sweet for me. I like the OMG more but I think to each his own. I have a weird sense of the perfect sweet and too sweet though.

I really like this place and will probably go a number of times!
Discovered this place thru my realtor - I always order the salted caramel in half soy and half 2%- I am obsessed!! It's the best iced coffee in Las Vegas

I love this place! I've been there three times and all of the drinks I had were delicious. The first time I was there I had their Pumpkin Spice latte, which they make with real pumpkin. It was so good! Not quite as sweet as those at other coffee shops, but that's a plus! I tried the "Jedi" and that was delicious as well. It has white chocolate and coconut flavor. Very good, but much sweeter than the Pumpkin Spice latte. This morning I had a Nonfat Sugar-free Peppermint latte and it was delicious! I can't wait to go back to try more of their flavors.

The staff here is super friendly and they're quick! I can stop by before work and still make it there on time. I will definitely be back for more!
A great cafe that has the best most unique selections of lattes and smoothies and DANK breakfast sammies. Get the cookie butter latte and PBC latte it'll be tight

We LOVE this place.  People who work here are super friendly.  Love their Almond Mocha Rocha.... mmmmm.

We bring our dog here and sit outside.  The coffee is way better than Starbucks. We support local businesses and you should too!!! WOOOOO!!! We love JJ

Always a wonderful place to visit and the coffee is great. They treat veterans so kindly and they're nice to your animals as well. :) I've been going to Grouchy John's for years and will continue to do so.

AWESOME COFFEE!! What a cool place!! People are SUPER NICE!! Starbucks who??
Definitely worth a try!! SO DELISH!!

Love this place, it's alittle out of my way but nothing compares. 
I love their Nutella latte and wraps. Service is beyond friendly, everyone really cares about your satisfaction. 
There is a good amount of space to study if your in school.

Ya know whats weird, I'm not even a big coffee drinker and I swear by this place.  Their facebook posts crack me up.  The cleanliness is astonishing and when I go there I feel like I'm at home. Its cozy and welcoming and the staff is so pleasant. I love the hot apple cider and every coffee drink I've had is tasty.  Well done all around.

I was visiting from out of town this weekend and my friend who is a regular here was telling me about all the specialty recipes. After checking out the menu, I knew I had to try the Curious George frappe, it did not disappoint! I'm excited to go back on my next visit! My daughter had the raspberry cream Italian soda and said it was the best one she's had so far.

Everyone here was super friendly and wanted to strike up a conversation (employees). They clearly also support local businesses and have tons of ways to connect with them on social media! My kind of coffee shop.

Now only if they had multiple locations, or at least one closer to the westside.... pretty please?

This place is conveniently located near my work and thank god it is.  The atmosphere here is always positive and pairs extremely well with their delicious beverages. In the mood for coffee, try Grouch John's Latte? Not in the mood for coffee grab the Suicide or the Caribbean Colada Smoothies.Highly Recommend!
Always the perfect cup of joe, great staff and comfortable coffee shop! A great, relaxing environment whereby a second cup is always in order!
I've been a customer if Grouchy John's for years... they have some tasty signature drinks! top notch customer service everytime.... support you local shops! and stop going to starbucks

This place is so hip and fun! I love the decor. It's definitely somewhere to come and get away from all the craziness and all the annoying noise that you usually find at a Starbucks. The staff is very very friendly and they have a punch card! 

They have board games as well as a couple of bookshelves stocked with all kinds of different books. 

I usually hit up a Starbucks everyday to do some work since I work from home. It's not ideal however now that I have found Grouchy John's I will be coming here. 

I plan to update this review as I start to come here more often.

The epitome of customer service. One of my favorite customer service experiences. I had been here over a year ago and it was really good, therefore we hunted it back down even though it wasn't close to the strip. Coffee was great!  Had a mocha and we also had an americano. Both we very good but the customer service was awesome. They truly make you feel like you are family. 

Way to go Grouchy Johns
Love this place!!!! Great service, vibe and their Nitro Brew is the shizzz!!!!! Highly recommend

This is such a fun coffee shop. Covered in art, comics, friendly guests AND staff. It's such a nice either hang out or study spot. It was my first time here and I was kindly greeted by a man who seemed to be a manager. He was very helpful. Showed me all of the menus that they had (they have quite a lot), specialities, coffees, teas, iced, blended, etc. After he gave me the rundown of how everything worked the cashier helped me through finalizing my order. She was super sweet. I ordered the blueberry muffin and a blended Rushmore coffee which is a white chocolate and hazelnut specialty coffee drink. I ordered it with almond milk and it was perfect. I love the options they give you here!

Delicious coffee! Cool staff and funky atmosphere.  Had a few different iced/blended beverages, and visited the coffee trailer they have at events as well.  Everything has been really tasty, and John isn't that grouchy!  He often hands out small samples at events like First Friday.
The staff was very helpful when placing my order. I like the ambiance of the cafe. More homey than Starbucks. Will definitely return.

5 stars because this place has a lot of sugar free and healthier choices. I ordered the ice blended sugar free almond roca with nonfat milk. Honestly it tastes like dessert with fewer calories. The lady working the drive thru was friendly and drive thru service was efficient. She even offered my doggy a free dog treat. Be sure to use their stamp card to gain a free drink and don't forget to check in yelp to earn an extra stamp.

Ambience: fun and welcoming. Comfy seats and couches, lots of tables, nice lighting. Lots of books!
Patio too! 

Drinks: I do not personally like their hot drinks, as the ones I tried didnt have much flavor. I love plain lattes but if I order a flavored one I expect to actually taste the flavor and a bit of sweetness. 

With that said, their iced drinks that I have tried and especially their blended drinks are amazing!!! Particularly the butter me up! I get it with an add shot of espresso..yum!

Service is friendly

I don't hit this spot enough even though I should. The service is great and the pastries and coffee delicious.
Make sure you head here is you're close by!

I live in close proximity to Grouchy John's and enjoy stopping in to treat myself from my normal home brewed coffee everyday. 
The quality is probably the best I've ever had as far as the actual coffee goes. Big chain coffee shops simply do not compare. 
I've ordered as simple as iced black coffee to a few of their specialty drinks, (yum!) and they are all fabulous! 
Their plain brewed coffee is flavorful, delicious and, not at all "burnt" tasting. Their specialty coffees are so customizable it's amazing the flavor options they have and different milks they carry to customize your perfect drink. Hot, iced, or blended. 
They have a drive thru, but I always opt to walk in. The interior is awesome with a couple of couches to lounge on and so many things to look at; various art work (for sale) , a small library book nook area and a separate room that seems to have more tables and chairs for working on laptops, sitting as a group etc.. 
The service is stand out as well! Very nice baristas working hard to make people happy with delicious coffee creations! One of these days I'll have to try some of their pastry items... until then see you soon Grouchy John's!
Awesome joint, ARM is great. Great crew. Drive thru or just hang out with the art and board games

Best coffee ever! Plain and simple.

I usually get caramel frappe and use almond milk instead. So so so good! :)

Only thing I dislike is its in Henderson! I have to drive 20+ minutes each time to get here. Worth it though! They also have specialty concoctions on the side, so I'd look out for those too. I've tried a few and yum! 

About the place, it's def a place to hang out. It's super nerdy and cute. Star Wars, Walking Dead, a bunch of local artists, etc. are represented on their walls. They even have another room to where people can study or hang out. Play board games or enjoy your drink. They do have a coffee and paint night. I've always wanted to try it out, but never got the chance to. Looks fun!

Everyone I know loves Grouchy John's so maybe there's something wrong with me.  I've only been here twice and both times just in the drive-thru to grab a mocha latte, which, to be perfectly honest, I wasn't all that big of a fan of.  

The service was great, though!  Everyone is super friendly and they even gave me a punch card.  If you check in on Yelp, you get double stamps.  

Also, the coffee is quite expensive.  A mocha is about $1 more than at DD and much smaller.

I agree with Tracy P's review of Grouch Johns. 

a. The small business owner mentality is awesome.
b. The coffee tastes great.
c.  The location is near the mother in law, so perfect for all.
d.  The prices are awesome.
e.  Menu has all you would want just slightly different then normal, yet good!
f.  Great staff.
g.  If you check in on social media, they give you double punch on your frequent card.  

Great place for coffee, home style, art on the wall for sale, books to read.  Nice.

GK says, check this place out.

A Review In Haiku: Grouchy John's. 

Oh yes, thanks so much | 
I'd love a couple Starburst |
With my chai latte.

Came here at the recommendation of a friend (and old check ins from friends on Yelp and Facebook). Came in with no expectations but leaving very impressed. 

The quirky little decor of Star Wars, TWD and the books available to read makes this much more inviting than a Starbucks. It's like they want you to stay instead of just get your order and get outta here kinda feel.

I was very surprised when they offered to warm up the blueberry muffin I ordered (Yes it's summer in Vegas and I wanted something warm to go with the Yoda I ordered). 

Nice music which is not too loud. Free wifi. The people aren't annoying like some people who camp out at a local Starbucks location. The menu of specialty drinks are what's going to get me to come back and try them again.

Glad i found this place while visiting LV. Soooo much better than any national chain. Obvious owners have put their heart & souls into their shop. GREAT coffee & everyone is instantly welcome. No strangers here : )

In town for the Silverman Ironman & like to try out local places rather than the typical chain. Yelp to the rescue! Found Grouchy John's, great coffee, awesome vibe & super staff. Knowledgeable & nice, the perfect combination.

The only issue I had with this place is trying to figure out what I wanted to order. So many drinks to choose from! The staff was extremely friendly and welcoming. Definitely at the top of my coffee shop list.

Grade A stuff.  

Galaxy Cafe closed down not too long ago prompting my search for a cool new coffee shop to fill the void.  

I recently visited here with a friend and it did just that.  It had everything from the pop culture interior (walking dead, star wars..Curious George?), friendly workers to the vast assortment of board games! 

Oh, and obviously I enjoyed the product.  

Now I know where to go for all of my caffeine cravings.

Stopped in because I happened to be driving by. This was my first time here. It used to be another coffee chain back in the day that has since closed. 

I went through the drive thru. Very friendly girl on the mic. I ordered a blended Grouchy John. It's a white chocolate and amaretto coffee. 

Took a little while at the window, probably because they were busy. The drink was really good! The place smelled amazing when they opened the window. I want to go back and try the blended mint drink next time!

Was introduced to this place by my daughter and was not disappointed. Excellent coffee and the blueberry muffin is amazing. I think we spent about an hour here enjoying coffee, tea and muffins. Yes I had all three. . Then I found out about a painting class they offer once a month so we signed up. Went back for the class which for the low cost of 35 bucks you get all the things you need to paint a fun picture as well as tips and tricks from the artist, but you also get a drink and a pastry. Was so fun to hang out with a group of Yelpers. I can't wait for this months art event and enjoying the wonderful coffee.

I love it here!  The atmosphere is great.  Lots of places to sit, books and board games to use at your disposal, and quirky geek decor.  There is even a drive-thru.  The coffee is delicious!  There are a bunch of options for flavor combinations and I believe it's a tad bit cheaper than Starbucks.  I love my iced lattes, and I'm used to getting a cup full of ice with a little bit of coffee.  But at Grouchy Johns, there's just enough ice to make my coffee cold.

This is strictly based on the drive thru. The guy at the window was extremely friendly and my drink was done quick. I asked for a white mocha cold brew with cream but they gave me a regular mocha cold brew with very little cream. It was okay, but I like my coffee light and sweet. Definitely want to check them out again and actually be able to get out of my car!

Edit: yummmy coffee and great service! Atmosphere was super cool and the baristas were super patient with my inability to decide.

This place it great! Cute decor, board games, 5 star service every time, reasonable prices, amazing art for sale on the walls, convenient place, and best coffee!

My favorite is the hot chai tea and double shot coffee with almond milk.

Always great conversations, friendly and attentive staff.  Love the pop culture themed design.  Recommend the evil monkey, Yoda, and bold coffee.  Every Saturday a large group of us Las Vegas Runners take over the seating and JJ and the staff is always accommodating.

My first time coming here was yesterday, and I cannot say enough wonderful things about this place. I ordered the OG and I absolutely loved it! The location is cool, vibrant, and funky. It definitely appeals to the creative side in me. They have books and games available for you to peruse. My friends and I were sitting outside and they came out to ask if we needed water. First rate service in a coffee shop, I was surprised but in a good way. I like the fact that they have a loyalty card and they hand out Starburst when you order. Grouchy John's made an amazing first impression and I'll be back sooner than later!
Amazing service and friendly atmosphere.  The coffee is always consistent and flavorful.  The pastries are always fresh.  I can't wait for more locations to open up.

Do yourself a favor and pass up on Starbucks.  This was a terrific place to sit and have coffee.  My Grouchy John Macchiato was suberb with the almond milk suggested by the barista.  The place was ultra-friendly and the decor quirky.  Right up my alley!

In town and needed a coffee and a place to work for a couple hours and glad I found this place... About 5 minutes off the strip depending on where your staying.  

Coffee: Seriously pretty good.  I was actually surprised but im a coffee snob from the NW. So Portland people shouldn't be afraid. Enjoy. 

Atmosphere was a little crazy but honestly that's what makes the place I'm sure.  Tons of stuff on the walls, crazy Star Wars swag everywhere, not a bad place to work or study if you can get a seat.

People kept coming in steady while I was there so obviously they have a following of some kind... 

Had a muffin and an Americano... And yes, I said "three" shots in that small cup thanks.  Lol 

AS I LEFT I THOUGHT: If I'm close and need a coffee fix I will come back for sure.

Was happy to find Grouchy John's coffee truck parked at the Las Vegas Book Festival last weekend. I needed my caffeine fix, and there it was. Then I ordered and was even happier: $2 for my iced coffee! Talk about sticker shock--in a good way. The iced coffee was great and the price was perfect. I hope I'll stumble on this truck again on future mornings.

This is, by far, the best local coffee shop in Las Vegas. The owners grew up and went to college here. They do all kinds of wonderful, thoughtful local stuff. I am talking blood drives, Christmas donations for Child Haven and recently collected money for a veteran who died that was a regular in this coffee shop. Once you get past all that, their coffee is pretty damn good too! They use local and organic coffee beans for coffee roasters in Boulder City. They have all kinds of crazy, delicious specialty lattes, local pastries and even have an area with local business cards around the city. What more could you ask for?! I love coming here knowing I am not just giving yet another major corporation money. They welcome you back every time and try to remember your drink. I haven't even mentioned how awesome it is inside their cafe. Please just do yourself a favor and go check it out. You'll definitely be visit again!

Awesome atmosphere. First time here I ordered an iced Grouchy John and a toasted cheese bagel with cream cheese both being absolutely delicious. The staff is very friendly and informative when it came to ordering off their diverse menu. This place is obviously loved by the locals as I noticed a crowded table of friends exchanging stories with one another. Will definitely have to come back again soon and try out their other well-crafted drinks!

I love the coffee here but messing up the order when the prices are so high is aggravating. I just went through the drive through and ordered a 16 oz coffee. I was rushing to school so I pulled away and then realized it was only a 12 oz. My roommate and her boyfriend were in the car behind me. They ordered their drinks which were different kinds. They both received the same drink. They didn't realize till they pulled away also. Whoever is making the coffee today keeps messing up the orders because that was 2 in a row. Besides that, the coffee is really tasty.

I've been here a few times and it never disappoints I just wish they had one closer to my house. The employees are always so helpful and explain the drinks in detail I love the customer service, they always make me feel so welcomed. This is the best coffee I've had in Vegas.

Grouchy John's will forever be my favorite place to get coffee. Employees are always very friendly and quick. In the morning before I have my coffee I am not a happy camper but when I walk into the shop I automatically feel so much better. Also, the artwork all around the shop is so beautiful!

Man, this weekend was full of checking out eclectic coffee shops.  The other day, I checked out Sunrise Coffee the other day and loved it.  A couple of buddies of mine, The 80's Kids, told me about this amazing place on Maryland called Grouchy John's.  I has a lot of work to catch up on and thought this was the perfect opportunity to take advantage of this Yelping opportunity.  

I'm literally sitting in this joint writing this review.  It's located on the corner of Wigwam and Maryland Pkwy.  Brings back a few memories from when I used to live a couple of blocks away.  That was almost 6 years ago. You walk in and notice the vaulted ceilings, vibrant colors and eclectic artwork on the walls.  In fact, my buddies' artwork is displayed in this joint.  Walk by the orange back wall and you'll see the 80's Kids artwork.  In this joint, there are books of all kinds and a large screen TV. The staff is young and therefore, vibrant and hip!   I LOVE coffee shop vibes like this one.  Definitely an amazing place to hang out and do some work. 

For my drink I got the 12 oz. Non fat Hazelnut Latter for $4.  The Barista even created foam art for me!  It was a cute leaf on the top.  The drink was a little sweet but not overpowering.  I loved that the espresso used was a little bitter, really working with the hazelnut flavor.  Definitely a great cup to go along with my work.  

All in all, it's a great place to visit!  I love the nerdy, yet sophisticated vibe you get from this place.  I'm really starting to dig this type of ambiance when work is needed to get done on the weekend.  When I'm in this part of town again, I will certainly keep this place in mind.  Come check them out!

I like coffee but the coffee I got was not good. I think it's called "dirty chai" iced coffee. I'll never get that again. They have a nice atmosphere, for a meet up and hangout spot. Why is some coffee places overpriced now a days? I'm not sure if I'll ever go back there again.
High quality products and cheaper then Starbucks prices. The atmosphere here is positive and friendly, whenever I come they're busy! Not many options for vegans.

I've had Grouchys long long ago when it was just a little trailer, but haven't had it since. I am not much of a coffee person, not because I don't like it, but many of them make me feel sick. It's a crapshoot, I don't know why it happens. I just gotta go for milder brews and hope nothing happens.  Thankfully Grouchys brews doesn't give me the ill effects and the flavor of the coffee is quality . According to a friend their beans are from a local purveyor, but I gotta confirm who exactly. 

You can go inside and hang, but there is also a drive thru. Dont forget to check in for your extra stamps on your stamp card. If you're bringing coffee somewhere, ask for a stopper that seals in the drinking hole of the lid. 

I got a A.R.M. (Almond Roca Mocha) Latte hot with almond milk and it was rather good. It kinda reminds me of a biscotti in terms of flavor. The BF got the salted caramel with half sweet. It was good this way, you taste more of the coffee flavor with a tinge of flavoring than it being masked with sweet and flavoring. Mine was full sweet and was good that way too, it wasn't overtly saccharine. I suppose just depends on the mood if I'll order more or less sweetener. 

If coffee isn't your thing, they serve smoothies and tea based drinks and pastries too that are probably just as quality. I will try a non coffee drink one of these days, but it's just hard not to order coffee since I rarely get to drink it. 

Its definitely one of the best coffee shops in town and wish there was one in our area. This is one of those businesses that could be a local chain. Until then, I guess anytime were even in the vicinity, we have to make sure we add in a detour for a drink here.

This place is not what I was expecting. Walking in, ther was an ambience of relaxation. The music in the background isn't distracting;not too many people here, and the atmosphere is fun with all the quirky paintings and toys placed everywhere. They have tables and leather chairs/sofas to increase your comfort while you stay. I definitely recommend

Super cute coffee shop in a small plaza. Free wifi. A good number of single tables that you can work at inside and some tables outside under a shade too. Single, large and really clean bathrooms. They have a variety of flavored lattes you can choose from (albino monkey, honey boo boo, almond roca, white chocolate amaretto, and more). They also have soy milk AND almond milk! I got an iced Nutella latte with almond milk, SO GOOD. But sweet, so beware!

Great coffee shop in this side of town! My boyfriend and I would drive by this place from time to time and we finally decided to give it a try since I was in dire need of an afternoon pick-me-upper. Walking in, we were immediately greeted by the friendly baristas. We were also amazed how quaint and hip this coffee shop is with tons of books, board games, Star Wars stuff, and local art/comic decor. From the outside, it looked like a small coffee shop but once you walk in, it is pretty spacious with plenty of tables in the front and a large separate room in the back. As for their menu, they have a huge variety of drinks and food to choose from including smoothies, teas, classic/specialty coffees, pastries, and breakfast items. I had a hard time deciding what to get at first because everything looked and sounded good. I ended up ordering a hot mint mocha with non fat milk and I loved it. It had a hint of sweetness from the dark chocolate/mint and a perfect amount of bitterness from the coffee. My boyfriend ordered an iced honey with soy milk, which he liked, but not as much as me since he's not too fond of the bitterness taste from the coffee. Overall, it's definitely an excellent place to stop by and get quality coffee and great customer service. We'll be back for sure to try their other drinks on the menu.

Great, locally-owned coffee house on the border of Henderson and Vegas... Off 215 and Windmill. I love it when I can have a client meeting  somewhere other than the corporate owner chains. The quality, service and environment is top notch. Lots of seating, WiFi and convenient freeway access makes this a new go-to for me. Definitely what put it over the top was the caring, personal service from the young man at the register. Offered a free sample of the herbal tea he recommended before I bought it. That doesn't happen at Starbucks.

This place is so cute. There's lots of neat decorations in the place, from Star Wars memorabilia to Colorful artwork displayed for sale. There's a shelf full of old books in case you want to hang out for awhile, and lots of other great pictures around the cafe (One does not simply waka waka into Mordor!).
The staff is nice and they usually deliver your food to you (drinks are set up on the bar). They were patient with me, being my first time there, telling me about the menu and what sort of combinations you could order. There is certainly plenty to choose from!
The coffee is great. I ordered the Butter Beer latte, and also tried the Sith latte. Both were major sugar bombs and delicious. They have a large selection of names that will have you cracking up, from "Honey Booboo" to "Shirley Temple of DOOM". They all sound delicious and can't wait to try more.
I also had the Apple Fritter and Bearclaw pastries. They were warmed upon request and were gooey and awesome! I don't know where they get their pastries from but it's definitely a new favorite in my book.
The breakfast sandwiches look very good and are cooked to a nice crisp, I can see why this is a favorite of people and it's surely a new favorite of mine. I can't wait to come back here.

You can't wrong with Grouchy John's coffee shop (and drink). Their signature drink has white chocolate and amaretto, which is amazingly delicious. It's what I get every time, whether it's hot, iced, or blended. Their specialty drink menu sounds so divine! I'll have to try one with almond roca next time. 

Located near the Windmill/215 it's just a short drive on Maryland. Grouchy John's conveniently has a drive thru, which is an absolute must for this busy mommy. I love that I can get my caffeine fix without waking the baby or hauling the kid in and out of the car.

Service is amazing here. The baristas are friendly and upbeat. I have been inside a few times and it's very artsy and tailored to Star Wars fans. There is also an outdoor patio with seating.

I've been here a lot with my friend and I actually don't like coffee. But the people here are really chill and are up for any challenge haha. Upon hearing that I don't like coffee, they offered to make something up for me. They're quite flexible. When you get your drink, they'll ask you to taste and see if you like it. If you don't, they'll fix up another one for you. The staff are really friendly and funny. The store itself is pretty funky with the decorations, they've got tons of books, board games, and even instruments that people can pick up and play. It's a chill atmosphere and even the snacks they sell are good. They also have heaps of different and interesting concoctions to choose from off their menu.

I have been back several times since my last review and have been inside and was very pleased with the atmosphere and service. When I asked what cookie butter was since I saw that they use it in one of their drinks they gave me a sample! Now that is going above and beyond! The coffee is excellent! Definitely will be back for more!

This review is about the atmosphere at Grouchy John's. 

About 20 of us gathered together for a charity craft project at Grouchy John's on Monday morning. We were welcomed by the staff & had plenty of room in the back room to work on our project. 

I'm not a coffee drinker & had never been here, but now that I've seen how bustling this place is I'll return if I ever need a people fix. I did order an iced tea. They asked me what kind but I don't know a thing about tea-I thought iced tea was iced tea. I don't know good from bad. But they treated me with respect & I appreciate that.

This place consists of 2 large rooms with a few cubby holes if you're looking for a bit of privacy. There's lots of unique & fun art by local artists for sale on the walls, there's a shelf of games to play & books to read are scattered about. Grouchy John's is so inviting & there are lots of things to keep a conversation going. (This is a great place to meet a blind/online date, a few of which I witnessed while I was there. Good luck, folks.)

I had eaten just before I arrived but next time I'll try some of the food there. Lots of pastries, cookies, bagels & wraps in the display case & on the menu.

I'm looking forward to my next visit.

Grouchy John's is awesome!!!!

One of my top three favorite coffee shops in Las Vegas and this one is only 3 miles away so makes it super special!!

I like how they decorated the place its very artsy and has a pleasant environment for working on your laptop and/or relaxing.
I love Star Wars, did I say I love Star Wars?
Much appreciation for decorating a section of the shop for that cult following.

They have a great selection of coffees, my favorites are;
Hot: Curious George, Almond Roca Mocha Latte and Grouchy Johns Latte
Cold: The Yoda and the Lando

The employees provide great service and are exceptionally kind, wonderful people.
 I have Grouchy Johns on my Facebook page and they very active in social media.
They are always involved in helping out the community and people. Good Stuff!!

Highly recommend!!!

I love coffee joints, so finding this place was pretty cool. I ordered an iced coffee but it was too watered down for me, so that was a bummer. Yet, I really adored the board games & piano they have placed for everyone to play with. Having free entertainment while drinking a coffee is what draws me back. Maybe the coffee will be a better hit next time!
Visiting from out of town and a friend recommended this place so I gave it a try.  Coffee was great and service was excellent.

Fantastic customer service, fantastic environment with a great Facebook page.  I enjoy coming to try their beverages several times a week and always look forward to seeing the daily special or something new they came up with.  Save your drink stamps and collect enough for a free beverage.  Very lucky to live so close!

Grouchy John isn't very grouchy.  I'm not sure if that should be a complaint or a compliment, but it is a great experience.  I had Grouchy John's at UNLV and not only is it the BEST coffee on campus, but it is also the nicest food truck.   My only complaint is that the coffee sizes aren't big enough for me...BUT,  if you bring your own coffee container they'll hook you up with the right size!

Good customer service and nice Big menu, but I ordered the coffee here twice and I've never has such a sugar ice dose in my life. I like sugar in my lattes but this was insanely sweet. I might try them again and be sure to say like 1/3 the sugar you normally use but before I was buzzing through the drive thru and didn't have a chance to go back and say how much I didn't like my coffee.

I try not to give too many five star reviews because I feel like it dilutes their value. But I found this coffee shop worth at least five stars. The counter people were very nice and helpful and when I finished my coffee someone actually came over and offered to refill it for me. For no charge. Maybe this is normal to do in the south but it sure isn't where I come from. The coffee & atmosphere were great, I was able to get a lot of work done while visiting from out of town. Will Be back again.

A must try place!

Walking into here you're immediately greeted with some cool art and toys. The layout of the place is perfect too! At every couch or chair they have an outlet ready for you to use! Just go order at the counter and pick a table. And while you wait or drink your coffee they also have books and board games. A major plus in my book.

I'd also like to note that this places thrives on customer service. Every person that has taken my order has been more than helpful in choosing what I drink. They always have a smile and if there was anything wrong with my drink the would change it for free!!

As for prep time the coffee always comes out quickly. For the taste of the coffee, I've never had a bad tasting coffee here. And if you were bored of a flavor here they always come up with new flavors!

Pro tip! They have some fast and easy to use wifi! I also like how this place always greets you as you come in and gives a goodbye when you leave.

If I could change anything about the though it would be their closing time! 8:00 is definitely a buzz-kill when I'm coming home from work :(

My friends hyped this place a lot and I wanted to try it out. To be honest I'm disappointed. I pulled up to the drive thru to order my drink, waited for almost 10 minutes in 100 degree heat (there was only one car in front of me that ordered just one drink) and then I get an empty stamp card...really disappointing.
Best Bulletproof coffee in town!  Plus atmosphere for daaays... THANK YOU!  :)

First time coming here. First off decor made me feel how inside of my head looks like lots of cool starwars stuff, eclectic art and their logo an angry cup of coffee (i love being angry). I came in the morning so the place wasn't crowded, they had a nice comfy couch (not worn out unlike other big chain coffee shops). I ordered their bulletproof coffee for wifey and myself. It was delicious. It wasn't too buttery and other ingredients complemented the coffee perfectly. Barista didn't just yell out my name unlike other places but delivered my to-go orders to me while I was sitting down on the comfy couch enjoying the place. 
If there's a 10 stars I'll give to them. LOVE this place come here hang out great coffee with a homey feel and free WiFi.
Definitely can see why the customers are loving this  place. They have good coffee, provide stevia, and the staff are very friendly.

Everything your heart desires in a coffee shop (and then some): delicious coffee, ample seating, complimentary WiFi, smiling service and a considerable stash of board games. Plus, the menu is not limited to coffee. If you're looking for a smoothie, they're on that too. My iced vanilla soy half-cafe latte (yes, I feel obnoxious whenever I order it) was perfect, and the environs were the perfect spot to host our book club meeting. On my next visit, I definitely want to sample a smoothie.
This is my home away from home, my Beat away from the Beat. They have the best mochas in town and the wi-fi is faster, but not as fast as their service. Grouchys is the jam!

I have a coffee everyday and Grouchy's is definitely my favorite!! Try the Albino Monkey which is white mocha and banana great hot or cold. The Cookie butter coffee is also delicious, my favorite is blended. When i'm staying long hours studying I enjoy the wraps that come with chips.

I like Grouchy Johns a lot because it's pretty unique in dcor. It basically is just a very random place. It has random art all over the walls, a bunch of Star Wars stuff, a book shelf full of books--kinda dusty, but still cool. There are board games and other miscellaneous games to play so you should never get bored, and they have a cool mural on the very back wall, which artsy people would probably appreciate. The customer service is usually pretty good--they're always friendly. I've talked to one of the owners a few times and he's pretty cool. 

My favorite drink from here is a large hot caramel macchiato with whole milk, half sweet with no foam. Regarding this drink: most of the time it is made properly. Sometimes it's bitter, which I've learned from my Starbucks experience is usually due to the amount of time it took to make the shots of espresso. I'm not usually a complainer, but one time I said something about it being bitter and I even mentioned the fact that I get the drink every day, yet the guy told me it's because I get it half sweet. Well, I tried not to be rude in return so I just asked if they can remake it after they offered to just add more sweetener. They remade it but I felt like it was also sweeter so I gave up trying. Like I said, they're always friendly, but maybe they're not all experienced in making good espresso? I don't know...

With all of that said, don't hesitate to come here if you feel like trying it. They have good coffee, good pastries, and games to keep you and your friends occupied!
There are two things I love in life, coffee and dry humor. Great atmosphere, service, and amazing coffee.
Legit coffee spot with great staff and a comfy cozy environment. LOVED my A.R.M and the grouchy john

So...my last review of Grouchy John's was 3 years ago. 

I hadn't visited in a long time, just due to not having the money or time to head over here as often as I'd like.

Last month, I found myself 2 minutes away from Grouchy John's before a dance workshop, and in desperate need of caffeine.  

I popped in and got one of my old standards:  The Blended Grouchy John.  
Let me tell you, the quality of the drinks and the standard of service have remained the same:  Absolutely excellent.  

I've been in a handful of other times since then, most recently being over the weekend where I tried my first pour over at this shop. 

Well.

I have found my new favorite.  
The pour over...I mean...I seriously don't get HOW it is SO different from drip coffee and french press, but....this is the first coffee I've been able to drink with no sugar.  

I'm super impressed, especially with the friendliness of service that has always been the standard.  Walking in and hearing "Welcome back" is one of the best feelings in the world for me.  

I love you, Grouchy John's.  I'm so glad I've come back.

Great shop!  Friendly staff!  The best vibe in Silverado Ranch/Green Valley.

Seriously.  This place is awesome.  The coffee is good, they have a large variety of speciality drinks and flavors that taste great. None of them leaving you feeling overly fancy or like you've over spent.

In fact their stamp card program is probably the best and most generous I've seen from a Vegas coffee shop.

Now the best thing about this place: the hang.

Elements that make the hang awesome:
-staff, they actually know who people are
-people, tons of regulars
-games, lots of them
-seating, well laid out
-decorative elements, radical

Look if you live in Silverado, go here.
I love this place. It's a nice Indy coffee shop. Drinks are good service is friendly. Always a good way to start my day.
I have a love for tiny coffee shops. This one is one of my favorite. The blended Nutella is my favorite drink!!!

This might just be my new study spot! Cool decor, lots of tables and chairs, free wifi, TV for mini study breaks, books, board games, music, and outside seating! 

Did I mention their excellent customer service? What about their stamp card? Omg what have I been missing all my life? They're awesome! 

I ordered an iced Nutella and simultaneously put a smile to my face and belly. They even asked what kind of milk I'd like with it. 

Five stars for my first time! Happy Tuesday!
Staff is always rude, coffee taste burned, and the lattes aren't filled up all the way.

I went here for the first time and asked the cashier for a recommendation - something not too bitter and not too sweet. He told me to try the salted caramel latte which I did. Not too bitter - checked! A little too sweet and tasted fattening. I will need to come back and try something else. 

I like the bookcase-lined walls and amble tables and seats. It's also not too cold in here which is nice.

Items selected:
Apple Fritter
Pumpkin Cream Cheese Muffin
Jedi - Coconut White Chocolate Latte

Moving on from Friendly Donut House with hopes of getting some work done prior to meeting a friend for breakfast at Layers a two hour stop at Las Vegas Weekly's "Best Coffee Shop" Grouchy John's would prove more than apt to the task in terms of style, service, and beverage even though baked goods severely lacked.  Friendly and efficient with a staff of baristas happy to engage the customer in banter about the myriad coffee concoctions or the day's events while satellite radio plays overhead and local art decorates the walls it was with some discussion that I eventually settled on "The Jedi," and although generally a double espresso or Americano sort I have to admit the flavor profile and mouthfeel were perfect while sweetness was not overdone, a sometimes-lost art that I appreciate for allowing the quality of the beans to show.  Moving next to the baked goods, the fritter room temperature while the muffin was lightly warmed, and having been told subsequently that neither item is made in house I will simply say 'good' as the former was flavorless and dry while the later possessed the texture of a wet sponge - a shame considering the vast number of quality local bakeries from which they could be sourcing instead.

Glad I searched yelp for coffee before our long drive back to LA, Grouchy John's was a perfect pick me up! Service is exceptional, prices fair and the menu beyond extensive. way too many blended drinks to narrow it down to one, I went with the Nutella one for my husband and the almond roca for myself, added shot in each. Drinks came out quickly and were fantastic!
Great quality coffee, blended well, all is good.
The shop is fun, tons of seating, board games, great place to hang out.
Will be back next time I'm in Vegas!

This place is a must when visiting the SE part of town. It's a homey and hip coffee shop where you don't feel out of your element. The staff is super friendly and you definitely get a big bang for your buck, especially if you take advantage of the stamp card yelp check in special. The OG is the best! Iced and as big as you can get it.
I really love this place! Art, Books, Games, & coffee. Would totally give them 5 stars if they had vegan snacks!

My mom's car battery died this morning, so I had to truck all the way from my casa on the West side to depths of Hender-tucky. Luckily for me, my mom said she'd treat me to coffee. Destination: Grouchy John's. 

I've had this place bookmarked on Yelp for far too long. I felt like a kid on my way to the candy store driving to GJ's. I walked in, was greeted with several hellos and a sea of MacBooks.
