There's a bookshelf with books, magazines, and board games. The walls were decorated with local art (which is available for purchase). There's also ample seating and free wi-fi; what more do you need in a coffee shop?

Stating that this was my maiden voyage to the shop, I got the full run down on their coffees, teas, sandwiches, wraps, snacks and treats. She also said that ANY time you check-in on social media, you get double stamps (10 stamps, free drink). 

I decided to get a GJ special called the Honey Boo Boo - a combination of honey and vanilla. My card was swiped, the register screen swiveled towards me, there was an option to leave a tip (THANK YOU, I was sans cash), and was handed my receipt, a GJ stamp card, and pink Starburst. I've never thought of honey and coffee being friends (I was a barista for 5 years during college).  This combination was amazing. Perfectly balanced, sweet, and a totally new coffee experience and taste! My latte also arrived with the quickness and I was on my way back to the West side.

Well done, Grouchy John's. I don't understand why you're a grumpy gills when you're serving out pure bliss! Can't wait to go back!

This is one of those occasions when half stars would be useful.. 
4.5 stars would be more accurate here. The menu has something for all preferences and tastes, the store is playful & fun, and the service is top notch.

Continuing my LV independent coffee shop adventure, my husband and I headed to Grouchy John's Saturday morning. 

Everything about this place was "just right". The store feels modern & contemporary but also relaxed and unpretentious. The menu was large but not overwhelming. Plus there are coffee & non-coffee confections that would make Willy Wonka blush! My husband had the Grouchy John Latte which combined white chocolate & amaretto. Grouchy John himself  (i think) helped me out with my selection. He picked an off menu item called Serenity... white chocolate, peppermint and topped with whip cream & caramel (i skipped out on the toppings though - didn't want a cavity before breakfast). My husband also tried their blueberry muffin, banana nut muffin, and a glazed donut (seriously, he did) and he absolutely loved every bite (blueberry was his favorite).

Other than the good coffee, I feel the most notable part of my experience was I felt like I was in a friend's living room. Yes other places also have books and boardgames, but the vibe here definitely felt very home-y. That's quite a feat for first-timers.

I wish I lived closer but I'm already planning a trip back with friends next weekend for another round of Sopranos Trivia (I rule).

Fave coffee place at all times hands down.

Love the caramel frappe in a 12oz - perfection each time.

Double stamps during their happy hour? But JJ, the manager I believe, gave me double when it was about closing time - but it's not even about that haha

Perfection in every way - dranks, people, place. A+ in my book and no need to look any further.

They have expanded within the last year or so. This place is awesome to study at. Staff is amazing, there are always seats. JJ is always there and talking to the customers. He is also very nice to look at, so it's a win win.

Cool space, but weak coffee & bland pastries. I got a brownie & a soy latte. The brownie was dry & tasted like cardboard. The coffee in the latte was flavorless. 

All that being said, this place is better than the Starbucks down the street. If I was in the area, I'd go here again and maybe ask for some stronger roast (& skip the pastry).

Perhaps I just need to step inside the coffee shop to be blown away. Perhaps my first time at Grouchy John's should not be through the drive up. But, for now, all I can review on is their product. 

I've been meaning to try out Grouchy John's because of the high ratings and praising reviews. Plus, it's really close to my house. So one morning, before work, I decided to swing by the drive through and get myself a cup of coffee. I opted for a soy latte, no flavor. 

Bonus: if you check in on Yelp, they give you an extra stamp on your loyalty card, which is really nice. It definitely encourages people to come back. More you visit, more stamps you get, which gets you closer and closer to that free drink! 

The employee that helped me was very nice and informative since it was my first time. 

As for the latte, I couldn't even finish it. The coffee beans that they used produces acidic coffee. It was sour in my mouth. It made me wish I asked for regular milk because it might have covered the acidity better than the soy. 

All in all, I don't think I'm a fan of their coffee. I'm not sure if I'd return.

I used to live in Las Vegas, and visit frequently as my family still calls Sin City home. 

This last trip, though, I FINALLY discovered this place -- and I'm so happy I did! My first visit here was through the drive through with my sister and nephew for my fix - an iced americano. The service was STELLAR (something you may not expect from a drive through), and the coffee reminded me of my local place back home (read: delicious). 

I made two trips here this visit and will gladly return on my next trip out -- daily. Glad to see that I finally found a local coffee shop that is more than 5 stars in my book! Thanks friends, for giving this Seattleite his caffeine fix!

Great coffee, very creative drinks, and a true coffee house ambiance you WILL NOT find anywhere else. Cushy couches, open spaces, available books to read and games to play makes this place awesome. Although grouchy John is the owner (and from what I hear, he is really grouchy), there was nothing but great service and patience from my cashier as I asked questions about their unique drinks. This is a great spot if you want to enjoy a cup of coffee, read a book, or just hang out with friends over great java. Enjoy!

Do you want really good coffee, but don't want the run-of-the-mill Starbucks option? Then Grouchy John's Coffee Shop should be bookmarked if you haven't given it a try yet. It's near the Windmill Ln. exit off of the 215.

They have a small-ish private parking lot and a drive-thru for those of you who don't want to get out of your car or for those commuters trying to satisfy their coffee fix on the go. 

Let's talk about ambience. It's not really a coffee shop worth going into if the interior isn't cool-looking. Grouchy John's paint was bright, fun, and made you want to look at what's painted on the walls closely. The wall decorations were super cool looking, too (with a bunch of Star Wars-related things for all you George Lucas fanatics)!

The staff was friendly. After my cousin and I were staring at the menu for a while, they told us they had a specialties menu just in front of the register (which is cool because it's less thinking for me -- I just have to pick the drink that sounds like it'll taste good LOL).

I ended up picking the "Serenity." It's advertised as: white chocolate, peppermint, whipped cream, and caramel drizzle. You could also get it served hot, iced, or blended. OH! And if you don't think they give you enough options already, they throw the "what kind of milk?" option at you. I looked at her kinda surprised at first because they usually never ask me that at coffee shops (I'm not really picky, either), but as she went on listing the types of milk I just had to go with the almond milk. BIG plus for having almond milk, by the way.

Anyway, the Serenity with the almond milk hit the spot! The name for the drink really did it justice because I was less grouchy after a couple sips. It was smooth. It had a very rich, creamy taste that only was complimented with the nutty almond-y goodness. The peppermint gave it a little bit of a zing. You know, like the coolness you get in your mouth after eating a peppermint patty. I feel like this drink will be the best drink for cold weather. It's definitely more of a winter holiday drink, but it's still pretty amazing anytime of the year!

With the amount of options here, it's worth the trip to try. Bring friends (and maybe play their board games they have out), catch up on some work, socialize, or sit by yourself and read/watch TV -- you can do it all here while enjoying some pretty astounding coffee!
The "Dora" was excellent. The brewed coffee, "Sumatra" tasted watered down. I would call it a fluke and try this place again. Starbursts handed out for while you wait was a nice touch.

This place was amazing. It is a cozy place with fun art work. It's very welcoming. It's like drinking a cup of coffee at a friends house.  They have all the fun flavors, and creations that you can imagine. There is a ton of seating, and great places to sit to have meetings, or work on projects. If you are looking for fun cool coffee make sure you stop here

I love the truck, but am glad that a shop has opened near my house. Before the only coffee options, within walking distance, was a chain. Now that Grouchy John's is located down the street, I can go for a stroll on a beautiful day to get my coffee. 

On a Sunday afternoon, around 4pm, it was dead. For each guest, there was one employee. The customers looked to be regulars and I can see why. All the employees warmly greeted us and helped us along the way in making our decisions. I strayed away from my usual Americano and went with a specialty coffee. I got the A.R.M frappe. This blended drink is a mixture of almond roca and mocha flavorings. It is possible to make certain drinks sugar free and that was how I got mine. My friend got the Grouchy John special and it was too sweet for my taste. White chocolate and amaretto is a rich combination, but I would ask for the syrups to be cut down. 

GJ has a good mix of tables for studying and couches for lounging. The leather cushioned chairs caused me to slouch into them. If only my yoga teacher could see me now. I would for sure get reprimanded. Laziness is definitely a side effect of this coffee shops comfy chairs.

This is the best coffee shop in all Las Vegas. Unfortunately, its very far from everything, but their coffee drinks are so good that it's actually worth the journey once in a while. Everything on the menu is amazing; you can't go wrong.

I'm not family or an employee or even a mistress, but I am connected to the owners cause you get connected the minute you walk in there.  The service is INCREDIBLE.  It's home without the comments about your weight or hair.  I go there quite a bit with my teaching partner to grade papers, plan lessons, and to restore my sanity and faith in humanity.  I also go there to write. Sometimes I just go there.  Mind you, I am driving from NLV, which is 3 time zones and a passport stamp away!
So, the service is fantastic - courteous, caring, fast with a spare ipad or phone charger and I'm a blackberry girl, not so easy in an Apple world, but JJ comes through every time, Yeah, the service is fantastic.  But good service and mediocre coffee would lead me to cheat on them with God forbid, Starbucks. No, the drinks are great!  I can't recommend a particular item because for a long time only the owner could remember what I liked.  Now, I typically order off menu.  I name the flavors I am craving or the mood I'm in or the 7 riduculous things that were said to me that day and a magical drink is created! It is always delicious.  If it is not sheer perfection, it gets remade. 
I even learned to drink chai there.  
In addition to the liquid goodness, there are pastries and now wraps.  i am partial to the bagels. At GJ's, the food items come from local vendors and businesses, which I love!
They have a drive through as well, but come inside.  You'll get connected too!
Great local coffee joint with a very friendly staff. They also use beans from a local roaster which I think really illustrates how much they are supporting the growing coffee community in Vegas!

ALWAYS COME HERE! Grouchy Johns is absolutely amazing!
From the outside you'd probably just pass by without thinking about it because it's pretty much a random boxy building in a random little strip mall. Once you come inside though, you will immediately see why this place is so cool. They have a bunch of bookshelfs with a community library thing going on, and a bunch of interesting artwork on the walls. Oh yeah, board games too! But even if you're not into that you can just hop on the good free wifi :)
More importantly they have the best staff you could imagine. Super friendly, and more important super caring. I've watched them offer to remake drinks every single time someone expresses even the slighest dissatisfaction, and they go out of their way to find out if you are satisfied.
On top of all that they have "happy hour" with half priced drinks both in the morning and the evening. They actually charged me $1.26 for a Sweet Arnie 20oz out the door. Un-fucking-believable!!!! They have a stamp card system too, where every 10 drinks gets you a free one (and there are opportunities for double stamping).

End of the day it all comes together at this place: tasty beverages and food served by awesome people in a very chill environment. COME HERE ALREADY!

I wish this coffeeshop was closer to me. I enjoy the geeky style of this coffee shop. It's refreshing to go and coffee here. They are geeky and the coffee is delicious and fresh. Definitely will be back when I'm in the area.

I absolutely LOVE this place. How can you not love, and support a local place like this?  They are SO friendly. The service is second to none. They have a game room for kids of all ages, and a 24 hour drive through. Get the card, stamp your way to freebies, and don't forget the Yelp check in. The place is more than just coffee. Nothing like 5 star service with a smile, every time!

Went here with girlfriend about a month ago. Place was nice, different. Nice change from Starbucks and Dunkin Donuts... We each got a sugary holiday themed drink. The drinks were good, but really sugary and sweet. Very tasty though. Staff was really nice. They have a grab and go coffee table where you throw $2 in a basket and just pour yourself a cup of coffee, pretty cool. All in all good experience.


****This was a pretty old review. For some reason the draft just went through...****

Another great experience!!! Service was great again. This time I ordered the Jedi. White chocolate and coconut. Yum! One of these days I will try one of the smoothies but what can I say... Momma needed her caffeine jolt!
The drinks were awesome and the service was great!!! We will definitely be going back soon :)

So I try  to boycott Starbucks as much as I can. I am giving this place 5 stars for a few reasons. 1. The made me a salted caramel cappuccino fat free and sugar free! And it was delicious. Can I get a What? What?
(At Starbucks it's hit or miss when I order fat fee and sugar free. I've paid 5 dollars for a not so great or even drinkable coffee.)

2. They were super friendly and help full. When my drink was ready they even asked me if I loved it, and if not they will remake it. Super nice and thoughtful!!

3.I liked it in there. It was inviting and clean. They had board games as well. My 6 year old's school is right around the corner so it is helpful if we had time to kill in the neighborhood.

I was considering giving it 4 stars instead of 5 just because they were out of 2 things I wanted to order. But after thinking a while I remembered that in comparison to coffee places I have been to, this place was so much better. My coffee was on point. Delicious. I didn't even need to stop at their "condiment station" and "fix" my coffee. I also understand that It is a new place and it is actually pretty busy, so understandable that they run out of things that are popular. Especially if these items are fresh. So I can appreciate their care of my satisfaction and the friendly staff. I'll be back and I will update if needed. 

By the way they can make almost anything sugar free and fat free and that's an extra bonus!!

Best coffee in town! The espresso they use has a great flavor without being bitter. Great signature drinks (i.e. the Grouchy John, my favorite). The employees are always friendly and promptly greet you when you walk in.
GJ's Is an Awesome place! the people a way friendly and I love all the dcor. I really enjoyed my GJ's Frappe with an extra shot. This is a breakout coffee shop.

Before I came here, my go-to coffee shop has always been Madhouse Coffee, which is delicious as well. However, grouchy johns just tops every coffee experience I have ever had, always amazing service, owner is always super nice and helpful and their coffee's are not only delicious but incredibly unique and have the best names. My personal favorite is a blended honey boo boo with an added shot. It's a blend of hazelnut and honey, super yummy!

Favorite coffee shop! I always go out of my way to stop here and grab a drink (my favorite is the Jedi and the different Italian sodas.) I definitely recommend finding them on Facebook before you go in so you can check out what new drinks they have - since not all the new drinks are on the menu. The staff is super friendly and even remembers me when I go in - something that is incredible considering how much business they get!

I also love that they participate in community events. It shows that they are truly interested in giving back and not just making a profit!

P.S. The free star bursts are amazing!

Yelps 365 Review Challenge - Los Angeles #10 - #365

I love a good cup of Joe once in a while. On my way to my hotel, "The Mirage," I decided to stop by Grouchy John's Coffee Shop since I was in the area and I heard a lot of good feedback from my fellow Yelp buddies. So, I used the GPS on my cell and viola, it was only 7 minutes away from where I was. Walking inside the Coffee Shop, there was a Grouchy John mobile with Vegas news anchors on the outside. 

Grouchy John's is not like Starbucks or Coffee Bean and Tea Leaf. It has that Mom and Pop feel (Non Commercialized), that I appreciate and wish we had more around the city. The decor was very fun to look at and they offered games and have special events scheduled.

**Checking in on your Yelp = 2 Stamps on your Grouchy John Coffee Card**

I ordered the Chai Tea Latte and a large donut from JJ (Melon Head), he had excellent customer service and was willing to answer any questions since I was a first time customer. 
What surprised me was, they had a drive thru around and I didn't know until I saw a drive thru window by the register. Pretty neat in my opinion for a Mom and Pop Coffee Shop. JJ also threw in 3 starbursts while I waited for my coffee, that was a first for me. =) 

Overall, my latte tasted excellent and the donut was delicious. You can sit on the media bar and enjoy your coffee or whatever while looking at small parts of the Vegas strip. Grouchy John has won me a return customer and I can't wait to come back and buy me a G.J. Coffee Mug Collection. 

LOL!

The service here is awesome and the choice of drink items is super unique. The bulletproof coffee is pretty good but only with the dark roast coffee option. Kinda just tastes like butter with the regular coffee roast. I usually just get the americano and it's superb not too bitter.

This is a cool little place to hangout and get a good drink while working. The setup inside is nice. I got a strawberry smoothie and it was delicious. Also they have games there and books that you can use. Cool little place.

This is some of best nitro cold-brew that I've tried in Las Vegas, smooth, creamy head, very low acidity.

I've now tried the drive thru- very convenient, and I've walked in- very funky, cool, hang-out.

I'm a muffin girl. Actually I'm a muffin and coffee girl. Today was my first time into this coffee spot and I ordered a Brazilian coffee, it was just okay, I'm a medium to dark roast coffee drinker.  I also order am apple muffin. It was one of the best muffins I have ever had and this is why I gave 4 stars.  The muffin looked good because it wasn't covered in sugar but instead some nice small crumbles on top. It was light and fluffy and awesome tasting. One of the best I've ever had.

What a cool little coffee shop in Vegas! We came in for an afternoon pick me up after some hardcore hiking in Red Rock Canyon (ok, it was mainly driving and taking pictures, but that's hard work too!)

The place was PACKED! There were folks typing away on their computers, chatting with friends on the couches and an elderly gentleman in a captains suit. I'll say it...I love this old man. He had some super young lady taking care of him - and lets just hope it was his nanny.

Anyways...the coffee was great! It was the holidays so we got egg nog lattes! WHOA! These were so good! Just enough egg nog so you still taste the coffee and some nice cinnamon flavor....ah, the taste of the holidays! 

Keeping up with the seasonal items we got a pumpkin cream cheese muffin. WOWZERS! This was delicious. I usually don't like pumpkin anything (except pie) but this was incredible. The cream cheese frosting was delicious and it was a nice snack to share with the wife - good size!

We sat outside in the cold - because, well we were tourists of course. They have a nice little setup with a table so you can sit outside. Super nice staff and overall a great place to grab a coffee. We meant to make it back before we left, but didn't have time unfortunatly. There's always next time!
Amazing coffee and great staff what more could someone ask for??? Love this place, I just wish there were more locations!!
Oh I'll be back!   Butterbeer Latte... I may possibly be spelling it wrong is amaze balls!  The stuff is edgy and awesome and it made my morning after a long hike!  :) thanks guys!

This place has great coffee and offers an amazing selection. The best part though is the small library they have. So much fun to spend a lazy morning off, reading a book and drinking a iced coffee, while chowing down on some avocado toast. The staff is great and the prices are reasonable as well. So glad they offer services at UNLV too!

Everything a friendly neighborhood coffee shop should be thanks to JJ and the gang. I'm rarely on this side of town but when I am, this is my go-to spot. The fact that Grouchy John's is covered in Star Wars art and memorabilia is an added bonus.

This place it great!!!!!! It has the best coffee flavors ever. I tried the white chocolate hazelnut and the butterscotch they both were amazing! They even have a white chocolate banana! I also ordered the avocado toast which was delicious and the bacon egg tomato and cheese croissant! For two breakfast sandwiches and two coffees it was $26 though! But it was worth it
Hey! What you need in morning a perfect cup of coffee to make your day awesome... It's Grouchy John's!!! Staff is very pleasant and very helpful.... Best place to stop for coffee... Love it!!!
Such a cute atmosphere. I used to live right next to this coffee shop for 2 years and just moved away a few months ago I miss it so much!!

First time here in July with my son and his father. The servers were not grouchy at all. Very helpful and patient in taking our orders, maybe because there was no line  but what the hey. I got double stamps for checking in. 
My son ordered the vanilla shake while his dad the strawberry flavor. They liked their drinks well enough. I had iced green tea. It was a little watered down.
They have big comfy seats. Free use of board games and books. Clean restroom. 
All in all a nice, cozy place to hang out without the noisy younger crowd at the other coffee shop.

Came here for the first time and I liked it right away! Walked into a much larger space than it seemed from the outside, with a whole separate room in addition to the main space with even more tables. There are books, paintings, plenty of entertainment as you enjoy your coffee. There's a wide selection of drinks on their menu, but I usually go for the simple ones and ordered an iced chai latte. I always love coffee shops with stamp cards, and this one is no exception. You even get a couple starbursts as a treat upon paying. There's a variety of seating areas, plenty to choose from and all relatively well-spaced from each other to have enough privacy. The chai was great, definitely makes me want to try more of their drinks. Will come back whenever I get the chance!
Love this coffee shop! There's so many wonderful things on the menu and I love all of the puns. Great local coffee shop! Loved the Chupacabra it's amazing!

You did it, guys! You made the nerdiest coffee shop I've ever visited, AND have comfy/not-gross couches, AND everyone is a paragon of service. Oh and I guess the coffee was good, too, or whatever. :) Well done, all around.

I had been here once before and got a vanilla latte and was not really impressed, but I came back for round two and wow what a difference. I am learning with these specialty coffee shops that it is best to simply get the signature lattes over anything you normally get at Starbucks or elsewhere.  You will thank me later for this. Most coffee shops in the area, including grouchy johns actually have signature lattes,  there happens to be a very tasty grouchy john latte (made of amaretto and white mocha) here that I discovered and enjoy very much! My friend got the PB & banana latte, which was different. It tasted like I was literally eating a Peanut butter and banana sandwich. Incredible.

The atmosphere here is very inviting, cozy and very easy going to hangout in for a while. They have board games to pass the time, tons of books, as well as comfy chairs to sit in for a while.  I thought the staff is pretty friendly and helpful, offering to bring you water, offer suggestions or bring your coffee to where you are seated. 

Overall this place is a cool, hip, hangout, for your daily coffee fix. Not my number 1, but for sure in the top 10. If I am in the area I will go back!

My "food karma" was working in full force that sunday morning I visited Grouchy Johns. My friend and I had a late night and were looking for nice coffee spot to help us wake up and get the day started. We walked into Grouchy Johns a bit fuzzy but we instantly perked up when we saw all of the cool star wars decor and local art work all over. It was a lot to take in, there was a lot of "oooh's and aahh's" before we even made it up to the counter. Then we were hit with the very wide variety of coffee and smoothie options, I am absolutely the most indecisive person on the planet, if your ever behind me in a drive thru I apolagize. I finally decided on the shirley temple of doom smoothie, this decision may have been made soley on the cool name. My friend got some iced latte and we shared a breakfast croissant sandwich. 

Now here is where my "food karma" kicked in! The customer ahead of us paid for our whole order! And only asked that we paid it forward! Which we happily did for the couple behind us. 

My smoothie was yummy and refreshing, and my friends latte was delicous as well, the breakfast sandwich wasn't bad, but could have been better. But all in all our experience at GJ's was pretty rad.
Nice ambiance, tasty coffee, wifi, games, books. One of the few great coffee places in Vegas.

I can't say enough good things about this place. The coffee is some of the best in Vegas and their signature drinks are killer. If you like Star Wars jokes, also a good place for you. The walls are lined with local art and one of the artists frequents the shop (as does the namesake). There are two rooms, plenty of space to study, play one of their many board games or even have a study group with some friends! The staff are very nice, and they go above and beyond to make your experience a good one.

Best coffee shop in the valley hands down. Awesome to know a shop is there when there's no time to hunt down the truck.  Friendly staff. Great atmosphere.

I want to add that as a transplant to the Vegas area from the Northwest i searched without success for months to find a suitable replacement for my coffee fix like I could get back home.  Grouchy Johns is just as good, maybe even better, than the good places back home in Coffee country.

I am never disappointed when I stop here. Every time, I am welcomed with smiles and friendly employees. Whether you are in the drive-thru or in the store, they are eager to help. They give you starbursts while you wait--I think this is a nice gesture. 

I have yet to try something I do not like. Today, I had a turkey wrap (which comes with kettle chips) and the Nitro Cold Brew. 

They really get to know their customers. This is a great place to sit when you have some work to get done, or just want to read a book with your coffee.

I discovered this coffee shop a couple of weeks ago and have gone there 4 times since. Huge list of specialty drinks. I've tried a few different ones, so far my favorite is the grouchy John. Their mocha with banana was good but I  was a tad disappointed to find out its not real banana, I had high expectations because one of my favorite blended coffee drinks is from Nordstroms cafe and they put a real banana in it. Despite that everything else is awesome including their wraps. I highly recommend, much better then the trendy Starbucks.

Love this place not only for their coffee but for the atmosphere. It's like a quiet living room with lots of windows, board games, a coffee table and couches and plenty of tables to do business at. We use it all the time to meet people for business. Keep it local!

I don't usually like cold coffee drinks. An iced latte once in a while, sure, but otherwise... not my thing. Even during the summer months in Vegas, coffee should be hot and should be served intravenously.

Out at the inaugural Saturday Night Truckstop, and trying some new (to me) food truck yumminess, I needed something to wash it all down. It was hot, I was full, and I had absolutely no idea what I wanted.

Trying to help me decide, they asked me some questions. The technical bits went something like this:

"Do you like [flavor, flavor, flavor, sweet, savory, this, that, and the other; and what type of milk]?"

"Um, yes, yes, not really, no, not too sweet, um, sure, maybe, and nonfat, please?"

(Forgive the paraphrasing.)

What I ended up with was an iced, amaretto-flavored espresso drink (I even took the whipped cream) that I absolutely loved.

Not too sweet, heavy on the coffee without going overboard, and none of that weird syrupy aftertaste that flavored drinks often end with. 

I'm a coffee person, no doubt about it, and Grouchy John's has a new fan for sure!

Our family loves this coffee shop! The staff are friendly, the drinks are yummy and reasonably priced, and the shop is truly a part of the community. The patio is dog friendly, and they always have a treat for our pup!
Super fun creative hang out. Great different coffees. Definitely bringing all my guests here. Especially my Star Wars fans
john can be grouchy but overall good service, coffee and vibe...
Great service- my sugar free Choc mocha was the best ever. Great quality chocolate! Didn't miss the sugar in the slightest!

I love Grouchy John's Coffee! Had them for the first time a First Friday a while ago. I have been to the shop several times and have always had a wonderful experiance. The staff is super friendly and will help you choose what to have if you cant decide. they are leaps and bounds better than starbucks and the price is better. The pastry choices are always from local places and i love that. Keep Up the good work guys!

One of my absolute favorite places in Vegas! The staff is extremely friendly and it's a great place to go for studying or just meeting up with a friend. They also do as much as they can to give back to the community, which is amazing. Their menu provides a lot of options and their Mint Mocha Frappes are delicious.

I'm in Reno for school now and I can't wait to go visit when I'm back in town. Although, they will give you a hard time if you're a Wolf Pack fan ;)
First time visit! Friendly and knowledgeable staff and enjoy the relaxed atmosphere. Will return regularly!

SUPPORTING A LOCAL BUSINESS

It's been two years since I first reviewed Grouchy John's and, back in 2013, I hadn't even been to the shop.  Since then, I've made several visits, many most recently.  I don't live near the shop, but it's worth the drive when I'm in the area.

CAFFEINE AND CANVAS nights with Tommy Vinci are what started me coming back to GJ's.  Just like the wine and paint places that you find around town, once a month local artist Tommy Vinci will teach you how to paint a scene of his choosing and make you feel like you know what you're doing.  $35 covers your art supplies (paint and canvas) plus any GJ's drink and pastry.  I've gone twice so far and it was a fun two hours each time.  I can't wait to go back when my schedule allows again.  Highly recommended for a night out with your friends.  Check the GJs Facebook page or Tommy Vinci's page to find out when the next class is and you can register online.

My favorite drinks are the HONEY LATTE and the YODA SMOOTHIE.  
I like the fact that I can have almond milk for the lattes and the Yoda Smoothie is a refreshing green (of course) drink made with kale, spinach, pineapple, strawberries, and mango.

CUSTOMER SERVICE is always friendly and the hours are nice for early mornings.  Yes, some people have to be up at the crack of dawn and coffee or tea can be a necessity.  GJ's opens at 5:00am, Monday through Friday, and 7:00am on the weekends.  Closing time all week is 8:00pm.  The atmosphere is always very relaxed and you can hang out on the couches or at a table enjoying your drink.  The staff has always checked on me to ensure that everything is to my liking.

STAMP CARDS:  Buy 10 drinks and the 11th is on the house.  If you use your Yelp app to check-in, you get an extra stamp.  

THEY GIVE BACK:  On their recent 3rd anniversary, GJ's collected donations for charity and had a blood mobile in the parking lot.  I went after work, donated blood, and there was free birthday cake available for customers.  Not to mention that I also received two free drinks in exchange for donating.  I love to support a business that in turn supports its community.

And lastly, GEOFF the resident gnome sits on the counter to greet everyone.  I love him because he is never in a bad mood and he treats everyone the same, whether they're grouchy or not.

Think opposite of a generic, commercial coffee shop chain. Grouchy John's is a coffee/ pastry shop, art gallery, library, Star Wars collection, local hangout with fun energy. I went in at 8am on St Pattys Day and I felt like I walked into a shamrock parade, a fun one. The baristas were all wearing leprechaun hats and the customers in green tie die shirts. 
I ordered a matcha latte (to support St Pattys day) and a lemon muffin. The matcha latte was foamy and sweet and the muffin had icing and was warmed up for me. Both were great and I'd get them again.
We tried this place over the weekend. Very good coffee. Ask you what kind of milk you want (whole, almond ect). I got the nitro cold brew. They have books for people to read inside
The staff there was very friendly and theres a nice little table you can sit a t to enjoy your food. Enjoy....

I know this place has a million flavors of coffee and combos, but I ended up getting a caf au lait (which was probably where I went wrong). The coffee itself just wasn't anything special. The caf is cute enough and the employees were friendly. This review probably isn't a fair shake, but if you're looking for just good regular coffee, I would say try somewhere else.

The people here are extremely friendly and helpful! Me and my friend Alex wanted to go here for a while, but we're never awake early enough to try it before work. He got the grouchy John and I got the Jedi! I like my drink a lot, strong tasting and warms my cold heart to love again. :D

Do or do not, there is no try. So Do get grouchy john's coffee!!!
This place is awesome. What a great alternative to Starbucks that has now become dull and boring. Star Wars memorabilia as far as the eye can see and the breakfast sandwiches and oatmeal.

So we went there today and i felt like i screwed up my order and confused them....so i went to double check and they were very happy to explain my order to me....very nice and John one of the owners brought our coffee to us......along with two free coffee cards....said thank you for your business and if I ever need anything to let either him or his partner know.

Its nice to see small businesses operating in Las Vegas......Kudos to John and his very pleasant crew for making me feel comfortable and for the free coffee cards. 

Thank you John for your hospitality!! Keep up the good work! Our coffees are delicious!

This is a fantastic coffee shop! Every time I've gone someone comes around asking if I need a refill. They really go out of their way to make sure you're happy. For people with dietary restrictions they have some fantastic options for milk and they always have every kind of sugar you could want out on their bar. They have great seating and the multiple couch options are great!

Dropped in because I saw this place on Instagram and it looked good. Plus good Yelp reviews, of course. 

I ordered the black and white - blended - with whole milk and whip (first time, so why skimp?). The hubby ordered an iced mocha.

Both drinks were wonderful! The coffee wasn't burned-tasting like Starbucks, and the ingredients were fresh. Plus, the staff were really helpful (especially when you don't know what to order!). The iced mocha was smooth and rich, and the black and white tasted like a mocha chocolate silk pie. 

I will definitely be frequenting this place more often!

Wow this place reminds me of the coffee shop version of the boba shop I work at. Strange. We were greeted as we entered AND as we left. Everyone was chill and helpful. The prices were simple (I love it when places round to the dollar) and affordable. I got a soy iced latte, which was pretty darn good.

The coffee beans they use are very different than what I'm used to...It's more earthy, I would say. I think I like it! The coffee taste is not too strong and not bitter at all, but the drink was definitely not weak or watery.

The decor is very inviting and I could see myself hanging out with friends, playing one of their numerous board games. However, I came here to study so I refrained from playing with all the little amenities they had.

I wanted to try one of their Yelp-famous grouchy cookies but the cashier said he had never heard of them. Strange...

Bonus points for hassle-free and very fast wifi! Too bad this place is so far from my house. Otherwise, I would definitely go more often.

Wow! This place rocks my socks! What I first noticed when I walked through the doors was how colorful the interior is. Art from local artists decorates the walls and there is a display of Star Wars toys to your immediate right. The patrons were sitting in various spots throughout and looked very comfy at the different sized tables and chairs. The place is very large and great for big groups! 

I ordered a blended mint mocha. Not very often to I go with the largest size, but I'm happy I did! I drank the whole thing it was so amazingly delicious. There are many milk alternatives available as well, I went with coconut milk this time. The menu is very large with lots of options! I can't wait to try them all. I really enjoy the stamp card they have as well, you get a stamp for every drink you buy and I believe after 10 you get a free drink. I wish there were more locations around the Vegas Valley.

Great vibe, friendly folks and wonderful coffee. Spent several hours here waiting for someone to arrive on a place. Staff were super friendly, coffee was awesome and everyone seemed super-chill. Especially liked the fact that parents with young children  were able to enjoy coffee while kids played with small collection of toys/animals/whatchamacallits. Thanks

the people here are friendly they make good coffee and it is a good price. They have all kinds of artwork to look at books to read and games to play. lots of seating and the cutest mascot ever made. About $8 for two small coffee. Definitely better than Starbucks.

Grouchy John's has the best customer service staff along with a great brew of Coffee. The employees really want you to come back and it's not a chain. Support the local guy who really treats customers with respect.

He has a dog friendly patio as well.

Man, I almost forgot what it's like to be in a groovy, trendy, local coffee shop!

Ambiance: fabulous art on the walls, lots of geeky memorabilia (heavy on Star Wars).

Service: fast and friendly.

Selection: I seriously doubt there is a type of coffee you like that they do not serve here.  From drip to various espresso drinks to MCT oil & butter, to nitogenated.  I got a "Bulletproof Coffee"  which is a coffee loaded in fat due to MCT oil and grass-fed butter.  It was slippery and delicious!

Don't be fooled by the generic exterior, this place packs massive amounts of charm!

While trying the eats at various food trucks in the wee am hours on Sunday, we walked up to the lonely yellow trailer, sitting there without a tow vehicle, to see what all the coffee trailer had to offer. 

For such a small "vehicle" they had a pretty decent selection of items. Wife decided she was going to give them a chance, and ordered a mango smoothie, after inquiring as to how strong they made them. Satisfied with the employee's response, she pulled the trigger.

I haven't seen her grin that quick after tasting something that is supposed to be mango in quite some time. 

We're not coffee drinkers, but if I see them around, I know how to win points easily!

Support/drink local! I am a bit ashamed to admit that this was my first time at Grouchy John's. And after working a 10 hour graveyard shift, John wasn't the only person who was grouchy!

I was meeting up with my Ex to talk about some things and this seemed like the perfect place to do so. Casual, not romantic in anyway (although I guess you could make romance anywhere), and on my way home. 

It's a funky place, and I like that. I love the decor and art work and the music was perfect, although I read and listened to my headphones until he arrived (late of course). I ordered a large dirty chai and it was quite tasty. I also got a bagel, which was good, except they don't give you enough cream cheese.  

The staff is super friendly and although it was during their busy morning rush, they were rocking out those drinks! I love that there is a drive thru and I think I'll definitely be using this in the very near future. 

It's in a great location, but not that easily accessible off the freeway, so you may have to go a bit out of your way - but it's worth it!

I love that this place opened up down the street from me! Even though I get the same damn drink every day (small iced latte w/ almond milk) they have a nice selection of drinks and the service is excellent! 

I had been going to the Starbucks down the block forever, and they never remembered me or my regular order. Great staff and a charming place!

This is my first time coming here and found out about it through a friend. I question why she didn't recommend this place to me before because this place is amazing! 

Initially when you walk into the shop, you'll notice that there is art work posted everywhere. From marvel characters to star wars, they have it posted on their wall! The front room has a few tables and a little library filled with books you can read. Don't worry if you can't find any tables in the front! There is a connecting rooms and in the back are more tables and a shelf filled with board games! 

When ordering, the workers are very helpful. They have speciality drinks and are willing to explain what they taste like. They have star wards themed drinks, like the Jedi (white chocolate, coconut) or the Sith (Dark chocolate, coconut). I don't know about you but I'm one who can't drink a lot of dairy. Not to worry though, they offer almond or soy milk substitutions. I ended up trying the Jedi and it was really good. It was a little too sweet for my liking but it tastes amazing! They also have a stamp card, so you can get a free drink. If you check in, I believe its one extra stamp?

I know they host painting classes in the backroom at 7ish sometimes and close 8, so keep that in mind if you're planning on doing some work or studying. If you haven't tried this place, I highly recommend it. Great drinks, great service and great atmosphere.

Good place to do some solo studying. They have free WiFi and plenty of seating. There's another room on the other side and the entrance to the other room is to right of where you order.

I ordered an iced OG latte which is flavored with vanilla and salted caramel. It was really good! They also have great looking pastries which I'll have to try at my next visit.

I had been through their drive through a few times before I had gone inside this adorable coffee shop. Much to my surprise it was very artsy and comfy. It was Star Wars themed and ha a variety of book shells, couches, board games.. I took my best friends there where we sat, sipped on coffee and played super scrabble .
First time stopping by this place with a colleague and it was great. They make sure you are taken care of; the food and coffee are delicious! Very pleasant experience. I will definitely be back!
Omg I love this place!!! I tried it based on a friends suggestion and I'm so glad I did!!! My favorite is the blended caramel macchiato!!! It's so good!!!

The coffee at this place is unbelievably good! I got a salted caramel latte with almond milk (they have milk options which is another plus!). I took one sip and I know I'm going to go there all the time now. :D  it was delicious. 

GROUCHY John's has the friendliest people working there. I only went through the drive thru but still ended up getting great service. The guy gave me a stamp card and 2 starbursts candies while waiting for my latte so nice. I haven't tried the pastries YET, I'll update about it! So mad at myself for waiting such a long time to discover this gem! Drove past it everyday thinking I'll try one day and went to Starbucks. If you appreciate great coffee you'll love this place.

My first time and I'm impressed.   Great coffee and an overall great place to hangout.  They offer free wifi and there's plenty of room here.  They offer morning and evening happy hours.  They offer pastries, bagels and fruit cups, breakfast sandwiches, oatmeal,  to name a few.

Wow. This place is great. I've been here twice already for refuge after a couple of work trips out to Vegas. Grouchy John's is my little oasis before heading off to the airport. I have had the grouchy john latte which is awesome because I love amaretto. I have also had the pumpkin spice latte, which truly was the best pumpkin spice latte drink I've ever had (obviously better than big chains). 

The turkey wrap I got was amazing too, with fresh bell peppers, spring mix lettuce greens, tomato, cheddar cheese and honey mustard. It was so fresh and made to order. They even wrapped it in plastic wrap for me upon request so that I could take it through airport security to have for dinner later!

I also love the comfy chairs in the back, there's plenty of seating and cozy bookshelves everywhere. It feels like my home away from home. The servers/baristas are super friendly and nice. This place is also affordable and not a rip off. I guess I can't say enough good things about it! When I'm ever back in Vegas, this place will be my first stop.

I used to come here often when my route to work took me up Maryland. Perfectly toasted bagels and amazing coffee. But that wasn't what really interested me about the place.  They have all sorts of books and boardgames inside and it reminded me of a coffee shop back in my home town. I haven't been here in a few months but I will definitely be back.

Huzzah! I finally got to try Grouchy John's, but I don't fully understand the grouchy part. I was met by an incredibly friendly staff when I arrived.  This place is much smaller than I had anticipated, but they make up for that in charm. From Star Wars decor, waving cat ornaments, and various works of art that were featured on an episode of Portlandia (If you know the show, you know what I'm talking about.) And not to mention the uniquely crafted beverages, Grouchy John's is an oasis in a desert of corporate coffee.

Totally dig this place! Lots of Star Wars stuff all over the place and even some of the coffees are named after Star Wars references! My favorite coffee shop so far! I had the iced Jedi and my boyfriend had the iced Dora..  Both were delicious.. Everyone was friendly.. And all of our questions were answered without hesitation on any of the drinks.. there's a lot to choose from so you'll have a reason to come back!
This place is a nice little coffee house gem. Great service. Great coffee and a fun inviting atmosphere. They also do a punch card.
The truck was parked outside Slidin Thru HQ today. Had a Suicide Smoothie - peach, mango, strawberry - with my meal. Excellent

Just got another cup and a breakfast sandwich.  Cold brew was good again.  Price for bfast sandwiches is steep ($5) but I had a bunch of options for cheese, and could either do croissant or bagel, and got to choose bagel type (went with wheat).  Eggs were fluffy and ham was good.  It was a quality, well-made sandwich, on par with something I could make at home (as opposed to god knows what you're getting at McDonald's) but $5 is steeper than Sbucks.

Their rewards programs seems much more generous than Sbucks.  It's a standard stamp card, and it looks like after 10 or so stamps, I get a free coffee.

In the past, Grouchy John's was my go to coffee shop in town with their great customer service, personable baristas, and unique feel in their shop. I was even surprised that they offered actual coffee mugs instead of paper cups to enjoy coffee when In-house. 

In recent times, I am sad to say, this coffee shop has begin to feel more and more like a Starbucks. Despite having an expansion, I haven't had that warm feel as I had in the past, and it seems as though paper cups are now the norm. 

3.5/5
Nice coffee shop; the staff is friendly, there's ample room inside, and the drinks are solid--not the best I've had but certainly good enough to enjoy. It is a bit hidden away.
Almond Roca Mocha is my fave and pretty much all I've tasted! Everybody is nice!

I love this place. The drinks are always on point and if they are not they will happily remake it for me. I like the art all over and the friendly baristas. I come one to four times a month to have my butterscotch or chai. I also come to paint night which is super fun. When I'm done with my drink they always give me complimentary water and it's not gross tap water. Plus one of the owners John is an amazing person.

I first tried this coffee a few years ago when a co-worker brought it into work and liked it a lot.   I kept meaning to come to the shop and try it again but I never had. 

We came in after dinner the other night and I was delightfully surprised at how cute it was.   There was an eclectic look to the decor and it was themed pretty well.   There are lots of books and such to keep you busy while drinking your coffee. 

The coffee selection is also pretty eclectic but this didn't stop it from being pretty good.  The "OG" was pretty delicious if not a little too sweet. 

All on all, if in this area again I'd definitely give it another try.
They really know how to make tasty coffee mixes. The art inside is fun to look at and you can even purchase them off the wall. Very friendly staff and fast service.

We intentionally trekked to Grouchy John's at the recommendation of the Camping World employees after asking them where a good nearby coffee shop was.

We have high standards for coffee shops and are happy to report that Grouchy John's does not disappoint!  This place has all the important stuff covered: great wi-fi, service, chow, decor, seating, parking, and COFFEE.

The folks who run this place are undoubtedly Star Wars fans (see photos)...not sure what that's all about, but the Storm Trooper, AT-AT Walker, Darth Vader, Chewbacca, Luke Skywalker, Princess Leia, and Han Solo art peppered all over the place was pretty cool. Props.

The chairs and couch in the front room near the counter were nice and comfy. The larger side room seemed more suitable for work or studying with more outlets, tables, chairs, good lighting, and separation from the front counter noise.

Our breakfast sandwich was tasty and filling (see photo). Our beverages were delicious and of far superior quality than that of large coffee chains. The drip coffee did not taste burnt and they had medium and light roast choices. They had several dairy alternatives from which to choose for those of us whose bodies reject cow excretions.

For those who enjoy a great cuppa joe or the vibe of a good coffee shop, Grouchy John's will not disappoint.

Cleanliness: 5 stars
This establishment is clean but not spotless, the restrooms have a clean appearance. This place reminds me of a small corner type coffee shop that you would find before the "fivebucks" craze.

Hospitality: 5 Stars
The employees were kind, and made eye contact while I placed my order. Someone was even kind enough to have prepaid my drink order, that was a great surprise. 

Food: 5 stars
Unique coffee flavor, I choose the medium roast and was very impressed.

Overall: 5 stars
Ample parking, hometown feel. I would recommend trying this local shop!
Everything is great about this place. Customer service, coffee ( haven't tried the food). The decor is nice too, it gives the place an old look but a chill atmosphere.

while dog sitting in the area i took advantage of grabbing a warm beverage from someplace other than The Coffee Shop Who Shall Not Be Named. Im a tea fan and was pleasently surprised to get loose leaf tea for the right price (even better, actually) Not only was my first time experience guided by a friendly barista but i continued to recieve the same genuine friendliness everytime I stopped by. i'll be dropping by grouchy johns for sake of good business everytime im in the area. bravo

This place is just okay... honestly it looks better in the photos than in person. It's a cool concept for a coffee lounge with art, board games and books to read. There is tons of seating and totally missed the back room. However, it needs a bit of an update or remodel. 

Coffee is mediocre, I tried 3 different drinks: PBM, Grouchy John and Almond Roca Mocha. Probably rate it from best to worst in that order too, but the drinks were not too memorable. Except the Almond Roca because was too sweet/ syrupy tasting. 

I left a bit disappointed after seeing tons of positive reviews for this coffee shop. I wished the baristas would have interacted with us more or gave drink recommendations.
Randy is the best !!!! My coffee and pastry tasted perfect. Thank Randy, i'll be back soon.

Have been coming here since they opened
Prices have gone up. Quality and taste down. Way down.. 
$3 for a regular coffee. No thanks
This place is consistently good!!! On my fat girl days I get a Nutella latte which satisfies on many levels. The rest of the time I get an Americano and I appreciate how fresh they always are.

I will never drink Starbucks again!
Thiis place is to far from me and I am not a big coffee drinker but after finding this place it will be the only coffee place I go to.
I also got the cranberry orange muffin and was concerned that it may be dry becuase it was almost 11 when I walked in but was hungry and went for it anyway.  OMG it was so moist and tasty.  One of the best cranberry orange muffins I have had. 
Will be returning

Best chai in town and the atmosphere is super chill and a little nerdy. Lots of options for seating- all comfortable- I can pop in for a quick drink with friends before running errands or study/work for hours and not break my focus. The wifi is super fast and dependable- plenty of charging outlets. The shelves are filled with interesting books you can read and the artwork is eclectic. 
The staff is AMAZING!!!!!! My husband gave them a flavor profile he wanted and they offered up a customized version of their Sith drink- he said it was the best drink he's ever had and he's a former barista. Awesome drinks, the best staff, and yummy food to boot! Lemon muffins= love!!!!!

(They also do super cool painting nights!!!)
Just noticed this- the yelp info is wrong about the hours- only the lobby hours are posted, but the drive thru is open 24/7!!!!

Just moved to the area and found this great local business. Laid back atmosphere and great decor. I'm a fan of the walking dead and upon my first visit seeing TWD paintings displayed was a bonus. Friendly staff and good coffee, pastries. A must if your in the area. BONUS- a drive thru

I love when a fellow Yelper made a recommendation and it's THE BOMB.COM!

I've only lived in Vegas a short time but long enough to crave those cute, quaint coffee shops back home.  You know the kind with local art for sell on the walls, comfy seating and an atmosphere that makes you wanna sit for a spell.

Well, Grouchy John's delivers.  Their menu is diverse, their lattes piping hot and customer service that makes you want to TIP!

Try the Cookie Butter Latte.  You won't be disappointed.  Oh, if you check in on Yelp you get an extra stamp for any drink purchase you make.  Don't forget to ask for a stamp/punch card!!!

Grouchy John....I love you.  And I will be back!!!!!
I love this place! Awesome energy and delicious coffee  I love the atmosphere and friendly staff
super friendly staff and neat little area to hang out while u sip on your smoothie / coffee love the local art work too, they have board games and plenty of couch room,

I take a 30 minute drive just for Grouchy John's. I wish they would open more locations, however I appreciate the classic ambiance of the place and the routine I have developed when going there. They have so many yummy collections of drinks. I prefer and iced "Twinkie". Their flavor collabs are to die for. They also offer punch cards which are super easy to fill up! And a 24 hour drive thru which is extremely convenient for night owls like me.
I've never had to have a drink remade or experienced bad service here. I love this place!!

Great place to come for a Great cup of coffee with plenty of books, games, and TVs to be entertained by. 

Or the studying to excel academically while the Maneki-neko (Chinese lucky cat) swings its arms at you, taunting you.

The baristas were great, gave recommendations on what to try, which milk goes best and even brought my cup out to the table instead of calling my name and letting me get up.

Gem.

We have becoming regulars here at Grouchy John, at the Maryland location, (they also have a mobile location that I see at UNLV), we are so glad that we gave this place a try, and you should too.

The atmosphere of the place is very warm and cozy. There are a lot of local art works along the walls and they has a very warm, relaxing tone, so you can actually come here and knock out a few homework or studies here and there while enjoying a hot cup of coffee.

The quality of the coffee is very rich. You will notice how sweet the drinks are, so if you are the type of person that likes it on the bitter side, ask for less pumps of flavor. They have quite a few choices to choose from, each with it's own unique, creative, funny name, some related to monkeys, yodas, and john himself. They also offer a few pastries here and there, like the one I had, chocolate muffin, it was delicious. 

They offer a punch card for the regulars, in which they double stamp if you check in on yelp. 10 stamps gives you a free coffee. I urge you to give this place a shot and support your local small businesses!
Still one of my favorite coffee shops. I love the atmosphere and the positivity, if I could I would live here. The drinks are great, you get what you pay for, and the food is even better.

I love this coffee shop. Definitely one of my all time favorites. Always get the butter beer and have a hard time tryin something new  Very cool art and a lot of room for seating. We played some board games and sat for a while playing. I love the atmosphere and love this place. Will definitely come back!!

I tried this place because everyone was raving about it. I ordered the Butter beer latte because I love butterscotch. When I got it, it was in a plain paper cup, which is a little disappointing when competitors around town serve in mugs if you stay there to drink. But hey, not a deal breaker. But what i didnt like is that my latte had a slight burnt taste to it. I couldn't tell if it was intentional  or accidental. Either way, it wasnt horrible but not very good. On the plus side, the staff is very friendly. Many specialty drink flavor combos and choices. I will give this place one more try before I come to a final decision on how I feel about this place.

I am super glad my guy found this place for me.  It's comfy and yummy.  And, the staff is really thoughtful/friendly.  
See my 'tip' for this fun coffee shop.  ;-)

I loved this place! The customer service is like no other and the ambient is chill. The coffee is good and the lunch menu is good too. I've only ever had the wrap from there and even my picky 8 year old enjoyed it.

They're coffee and bagel selection is to yummy to pass. The multiply times I've come here, I fall in love with this place more and more. They have a very interesting menu that has intwined Stars as much as possible making it even more spectacular

I really enjoy this coffee shop! I've tried their teas, coffees, and parfaits, and it's pretty good for what you get. What I enjoy the most is the atmosphere and free wifi! Perfect place to study, have a study group session in their giant room in the back, or even just study on your own on their little bar top. It gets pretty busy at peak times so expect to be studying with some noise in the background, otherwise bring a pair of headphones! The service is super friendly and they always greet you upon entry and exit. Definitely a place that I like to venture to when I want something other than my usual caffeine fix.

Grouchy John's is my ideal coffee shop. I love that they are very active w/ their customers within the shop and also on FaceBook. They may have other social media outlets but I only follow them on FB. When your in the shop, staff will actually check on you to make sure your drinks and eats are to your liking or even if you'd like a glass of water. I personally haven't seen a counter service type place treat their customers this way. Which is what puts them ahead of the rest!
On FaceBook, they are funny to follow! From Geoff the gnome to Flag Salute guy and even encouraging baby Gracie. If they have a new drink coming out they will give you the details and ask for suggestions on a name. At Halloween time they have a vote for a costume for JJ to wear! 
Such a cool place!! I just wish it was on my route more often so I can support them more! :)

Waited for ever forever for our food the place is a great find and would of been a 5 but went in drive thru and then was told to pull out front and it took over 20 minutes  I am changing the review to 5 John sent a message and made it right first class customer service!!!
DAAAAAAAAMN John!!! Bunch of nerds with good attitudes and even better coffee... I love it!!!!!!

Awesome coffee shop that reminds me of San Francisco's Lower Haight area  -- well, one of the rooms. If you're looking to have a meeting, work remote or study, GJC is a great place. Free wifi and a ton of space.

The coffee prices are affordable. I paid $3.25 for a large iced coffee! The shakes, however, are a bit pricey for the quality and quantity. I ordered Matcha Green Tea shake and wasn't too excited about it. 

Normally, I'd take a star off, but the service at this place makes up for it. The owner is super casual and engaging with his customers. He comes by each and everyone's table to see if they want anything else or if they want a cup of water. Love this local feel they're going for -- it really adds a personal touch.

Overall, this place is pretty dope. They have a lot of artwork on the wall too, which gives this place a lot more personality,

Loved this little local coffee shop! Brought the pup with us and sat on the patio! We had the yoda (green smoothie) and a sugar free caramel iced latte with almond milk (tasted like a dessert) and two turkey wraps! Oh and a dog treat!! Everything was great!

I'm not a coffee drinker or caffeine addict, but I do enjoy a nice tea from time to time. I have been a little under the weather lately due to a cold and while I was in the area running some errands, I stopped by Grouchy John's for a chai latte to ease my sore throat. 

I didn't go inside, but instead went through their drive thru. I'm always a fan of having a drive thru option since I'm usually in a hurry or just want a quick drink for my ride. I have driven by this location on many occasions and finally made a point to stop by. The guy taking my order was very helpful. I had a few questions about the menu and he helped clear up any confusion and decide on my order. Better yet, they didn't treat me like a moron for not knowing all the coffee lingo. By the time I drove up to the window my drink was ready and I was on my way. 

Definitely glad to utilize a locally-owned business for my chai tea needs. I'll definitely be back to check out some of their pastries and other drink options.

This used to be the location of my favorite coffee shop of all time, which shut all of its vegas store's doors. Thankful that Grouchy John's was able to make great use of this space and make me love them too. JJ is very friendly, always running around making sure every customer is content. They host painting events, they have giveaways, they do silly things, and they know the importance of social media for business these days. Good drinks, good service, free wifi, a movie playing daily, huge book trade sections, games, and my favorite part: an outlet at every seat so people like me who waste hours in a coffee shop on a laptop can stay charged with coffee while our computers stay charged via power-cord!

I've always loved this place and I'm trying to make an effort to go out of my way more to go here because it is leaps and bounds better than any chain coffee shop around. The service is always excellent and the employees seem genuinely happy to be there. Thank you to the car in front of me at the drive through this morning who paid for my wonderful Iced Soy Salted Caramel Latte!!

Absolutely the best coffee place in town.  Very friendly relaxing. The crew members are all great. 
Great place to hangout for a little while and get caffeinated.   JJ & John are wonderful.

I thank the coffee gods for this place! I just moved back to Vegas after living in Seattle for the past 4 years, and I was going through delicious coffee withdrawals. Starbucks and Coffee Bean were not cuttin it for me and this place was highly recommended to me so I decided to go.

I loved the decor and coziness of the shop. They have a TON of books and games I thought that was awesome. They had a pretty big menu with what looked like a rotating board of special drinks. I had a salted caramel latte and it was delish! Definitely up to Seattle standards and it satisfied my craving :) I will definitely be going back again and hanging out in the shop.

Way better than Starbucks. Staff is actually nice, and don't mock you when you don't order an item correctly. I've enjoyed many of the teas offered here, along with smoothies and hot chocolate. Never disappointed.
I can't comment on the coffee I'm not a coffee drinker, but their chai tea was horrible. It was by far the worst I've ever had.

I've been in numerous times and each time has been great drinks. 

Writing this review, finally, because the staff is patient and friendly when I ask my numerous questions on what is actually sugar-free. I'm diabetic so my drinks have to be ordered carefully.

I ordered the Sith which is dark chocolate and coconut. Both are sugar free. I subbed soy milk as well and made it decaf for drinking in the afternoon so I could sleep later.

It tasted so good I doubted the chocolate was sugar free, so went up to the front to double check. YEP! It's all good.

If you have finicky requirements, this is the place to go. They actually taste good too and you won't feel like you're missing out.
Coffee was amazing!  The ambiance was inviting and relaxing.  Definitely going back when I come back to Vegas. Had to buy one of their coffee mugs to take back home with me.

Ahhhh! I love finding these cool, quirky spots in Vegas outside the strip! Grouchy John's was an exciting find! (thanks yelp!!) It's worth the 10 minute drive to find coffee that doesn't start with 'S' and end in 'Bucks'. The coffee was really good here, although I am docking one star because I feel the drinks are prepared a little on the sweet side (I came here three times, during our stay, so I feel I had a pretty good feel for what they serve) But, it was good coffee as I said.

Service is outstanding! These people are eager to please! (so confusing considering the name!) Always friendly faces, and they even remade my husbands smoothie like 3 times to make sure he was happy with it (again, main problem was the sweetness...) Anyways, I wish we had a coffee shop like that in PHX!

Love the interior, it definitely has a coffee shop feel, and you can tell it's quite popular as it was always packed the days that we came in. 

This coffee shop is definitely now on our 'places-not-to-miss' list whenever we go to Vegas. OH! btw, when you check in, you get double stamps on their card! I actually earned a free drink while we were there for only 3 days!
